title: Small Business, Enterprise and Employment Bill - Programme
aye: to approve a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Small Business, Enterprise and Employment Bill.
nay: against proposed timetable for the consideration of the Small Business, Enterprise and Employment Bill.

title: Office for Budget Responsibility to Scrutinise Tax and Spending Measures in Political Party Manifestos
aye: for the Office for Budget Responsibility to scrutinise the tax and spending measures in the manifestos of the main political parties.
nay: against the Office for Budget Responsibility scrutinising the tax and spending measures in the manifestos of the main political parties.

title: Draft Gangmasters (Licensing Authority) Regulations 2014 - Structure of Authority's Board
aye: to reduce the size of the Gangmasters Licensing Authority's board and to have the board all appointed by the Secretary of State rather than by various interested organisations and Government departments.
nay: against reducing the size of the Gangmasters Licensing Authority's board and to have the board all appointed by the Secretary of State rather than by various interested organisations and Government departments.

title: Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill - Third Reading
aye: in favour of requiring the mass retention of information about communications, (but not the content of those communications); in favour of arrangements to limit access to such information; in favour of requiring those based outside of the UK to comply with warrants to intercept the content of communications and to state operators of internet-based services may be required enact such intercepts; in favour of limiting the use of intercepts, and police access to communications data, on economic grounds to cases involving the interests of national security; and also in favour of more frequent reports from the Interception of Communications Commissioner and for the independent reviewer of terrorism legislation to review the operation and regulation of investigatory powers by May 2015.
nay: against requiring the mass retention of information about communications, (but not the content of those communications); against arrangements to limit access to such information; against requiring those based outside of the UK to comply with warrants to intercept the content of communications and against stating operators of internet-based services may be required enact such intercepts; against limiting the use of intercepts, and police access to communications data, on economic grounds to cases involving the interests of national security; and also against more frequent reports from the Interception of Communications Commissioner and against the independent reviewer of terrorism legislation reviewing the operation and regulation of investigatory powers by May 2015.

title: Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill - New Clause 5 -  Act To Have Effect Despite European Union Treaties
aye: to ensure the Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill takes effect regardless of European Union treaties making the UK subject to European Union law and courts.
nay: not to ensure the Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill takes effect regardless of European Union treaties making the UK subject to European Union law and courts.

title: Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill - Clause 6 - Date of Repeal - Sunset Clause
aye: for the provisions of the Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill to only remain in force until the end of 2014, rather than until the end of 2016.
nay: against the provisions of the Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill only remaining in force until the end of 2014, rather than until the end of 2016.

title: Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill - Second Reading
aye: in favour of requiring the mass retention of information about communications, (but not the content of those communications); in favour of arrangements to limit access to such information; in favour of requiring those based outside of the UK to comply with warrants to intercept the content of communications and to state operators of internet-based services may be required enact such intercepts; and also in favour of limiting the use of intercepts, and police access to communications data, on economic grounds to cases involving the interests of national security.
nay: against requiring the mass retention of information about communications, (but not the content of those communications); against arrangements to limit access to such information; against requiring those based outside of the UK to comply with warrants to intercept the content of communications and against stating operators of internet-based services may be required enact such intercepts; and also against limiting the use of intercepts, and police access to communications data, on economic grounds to cases involving the interests of national security.

title: Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Bill - Fast-Track Timetable - House of Commons Stages in Single Day
aye: for a fast-track process, involving MPs completing all commons stages in a single day, for consideration of a new law on the retention of, and access to, communications data and on the interception of communications.
nay: against a fast-track process, involving MPs completing all commons stages in a single day, for consideration of a new law on the retention of, and access to, communications data and on the interception of communications.

title: Opposition Day - Rate of House Building
aye: to call on the Government to increase the rate of house building to 200,000 homes per year by 2020.
nay: against calling on the Government to increase the rate of house building to 200,000 homes per year by 2020.

title: Draft Civil Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 (Amendment of Schedule 1) Order 2014 - Residence Test for Legal Aid Eligibility
aye: for a residence test as an eligibility criteria for civil legal aid; subject to exceptions for refugees and those who have sought asylum.
nay: against a residence test as an eligibility criteria for civil legal aid; subject to exceptions for refugees and those who have sought asylum.

title: Finance Bill 2013-14 to 2014-15 - Third Reading
aye: to increase the personal income tax allowance, to reduce corporation tax, and to give a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well as to support other measures in the Finance Bill.
nay: against increasing the personal income tax allowance, against reducing corporation tax, and against giving a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well against other measures in the Finance Bill.

title: Finance Bill 2013-14 to 2014-15 - New Clause 1 - Corportation Tax Arrangments for Oil Industry Asset Hire Operations
aye: for changes to the Corporation Tax system aimed at ensuring a fair amount of tax is paid in the UK in relation to the hire of assets used in the oil exploration and exploitation industry which are often owned by companies in jurisdictions with lower corporation tax rates than the UK.
nay: against changes to the Corporation Tax system aimed at ensuring a fair amount of tax is paid in the UK in relation to the hire of assets used in the oil exploration and exploitation industry which are often owned by companies in jurisdictions with lower corporation tax rates than the UK.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 10 - Review Impact of Changes to the Annual Investment Allowance Made in 2011
aye: to require a report on the impact of reducing the tax incentive for businesses to invest in assets in 2011 (the incentive has since been increased above its original level).
nay: against requiring a report on the impact of reducing the tax incentive for businesses to invest in assets in 2011 (the incentive has since been increased above its original level).

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 9 - Publication of Treasury Analysis on Impact of Greater Flexibility in How People May Draw Down Pensions
aye: to require the publication of any analysis prepared by the Treasury prior to the publication of the 2014 Budget in relation to the expected impact of proposed changes to the law on pensions aimed at giving greater flexibility to individuals in the way they draw down their pensions.
nay: against requiring the publication of any analysis prepared by the Treasury prior to the publication of the 2014 Budget in relation to the expected impact of proposed changes to the law on pensions aimed at giving greater flexibility to individuals in the way they draw down their pensions.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 12 - Report on Tax Advantages Arising From Abusive Tax Arrangements
aye: for a report setting out further proposals to reduce the tax advantages arising from tax arrangements that are abusive.
nay: against requiring a report setting out further proposals to reduce the tax advantages arising from tax arrangements that are abusive.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 11 - Report on Impact on Tax Revenues of Introducing Employee Shareholder Status
aye: to require a report on the impact on tax revenues of  introducing employee shareholder status.
nay: against requiring a report on the impact on tax revenues of introducing employee shareholder status.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 107 - Report on Impact of Abolishing a Tax on Unit Trusts and Similar Investment Schemes
aye: to require a report on the impact of abolishing a tax on collective investment schemes such as unit trusts and open-ended investment companies in an effort to make the UK a more attractive place to invest.
nay: against requiring a report on the impact of abolishing a tax on collective investment schemes such as unit trusts and open-ended investment companies in an effort to make the UK a more attractive place to invest.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 14 - Report on Rate of Income Tax Applied to Incomes Over £150,000
aye: to require a report on the additional rate of income tax; the rate which applies to income over £150,000 and which at the time of the vote was 45%.
nay: against requiring a report on the additional rate of income tax; the rate which applies to income over £150,000 and which at the time of the vote was 45%.

title: Opposition Day  -Benefits System - Risks - Timeframe for Assessments
aye: for the publication of the risk register and other documentation relating to the delivery of Universal Credit; for publishing the time within which the Government will guarantee disabled people an assessment for the Personal Independence Payment; and for the publication of an assessment of the risk from delays, problems etc. on people receiving or entitled to benefits, departmental budgets and the Government's welfare cap.
nay: against the publication of the risk register and other documentation relating to the delivery of Universal Credit; against publishing the time within which the Government will guarantee disabled people an assessment for the Personal Independence Payment; and against the publication of an assessment of the risk from delays, problems etc. on people receiving or entitled to benefits, departmental budgets and the Government's welfare cap.

title: Opposition Day - Office for Budget Responsibility - Independent Audit of Spending and Tax Commitments in Manifestos
aye: against the Office for Budget Responsibility independently auditing the spending and tax commitments in the general election manifestos of the main political parties.
nay: for the Office for Budget Responsibility independently auditing the spending and tax commitments in the general election manifestos of the main political parties.

title: Opposition Day - Office for Budget Responsibility - Independent Audit of Spending and Tax Commitments in Manifestos
aye: for the Office for Budget Responsibility independently auditing the spending and tax commitments in the general election manifestos of the main political parties.
nay: against the Office for Budget Responsibility independently auditing the spending and tax commitments in the general election manifestos of the main political parties.

title: Opposition Day - Private Rented Sector - Ban on Letting Agent Fees - Default 3 Year Tenancies - Action on Excessive Rent Rises
aye: to ban letting agent fees, to make three year tenancies the default in the private rented sector and for action on excessive rent rises during longer tenancies.
nay: against banning letting agent fees, against making three year tenancies the default in the private rented sector and against action on excessive rent rises during longer tenancies.

title: Wales Bill - Clause 19 - Welsh Ministers to Set Own Capital Expenditure Priorities
aye: to allow Welsh Ministers to set their own capital expenditure priorities.
nay: against allowing Welsh Ministers to set their own capital expenditure priorities.

title: Wales Bill - Clause 2 - Allow Someone to Stand As Both Constituency and Regional Candidate in Welsh Assembly Election
aye: against allowing someone to stand as both a constituency and a regional candidate in a Welsh Assembly Election.
nay: to allow someone to stand as both a constituency and a regional candidate in a Welsh Assembly Election.

title: Wales Bill - New Clause 2 - Infrastructure Guarantees in Wales
aye: to enable the Welsh Government to underwrite borrowing by private organisations for the purpose of promoting investment in infrastructure.
nay: against enabling the Welsh Government to underwrite borrowing by private organisations for the purpose of promoting investment in infrastructure.

title: Deregulation Bill - Third Reading
aye: to remove or reduce burdens on businesses, civil society, individuals, public sector bodies and the taxpayer.
nay: against removing or reducing burdens on businesses, civil society, individuals, public sector bodies and the taxpayer.

title: Deregulation Bill - Clause 35 - Energy Efficiency in Developments of New Homes - Microgeneration - Renewable Energy
aye: to require a Zero-Carbon Housing Strategy be put before Parliament before repealing laws allowing local councils to demand high levels of energy efficiency in new developments.
nay: against requiring a Zero-Carbon Housing Strategy to be put before Parliament before repealing laws allowing local councils to demand high levels of energy efficiency in new developments.

title: Deregulation Bill - Clause 17 - Specific Authorisation of Insolvency Practitioners to Work With Companies or Individuals
aye: against allowing insolvency practitioners to be authorised to deal with either just individuals, or just companies, requiring them instead to be authorised to deal with all cases.
nay: to allow insolvency practitioners to be authorised to deal with either just individuals, or just companies, rather than requiring them to be authorised to deal with all cases.

title: Deregulation Bill - New Clause 8 - Plan to Replace Affordable Homes Lost Due to Right to Buy
aye: to require a plan to replace affordable homes lost in England as a result of Right to Buy.
nay: not to require a plan to replace affordable homes lost in England as a result of Right to Buy.

title: Deregulation Bill - Clause 35 - Duty to Re-Open Marine Accident Investigations
aye: to require the re-opening of marine accident investigations where "secondary investigations have enabled more new, significant, or important evidence to become available", rather than only permitting the reopening of investigations if the Secretary of State has grounds to suspect a miscarriage of justice may have occurred.
nay: against requiring the re-opening of marine accident investigations where "secondary investigations have enabled more new, significant, or important evidence to become available", rather than only permitting the reopening of investigations if the Secretary of State has grounds to suspect a miscarriage of justice may have occurred.

title: Deregulation Bill - Clause 10 - Relaxation of Regulation on Private Hire Taxis
aye: against making the offence of driving a private hire vehicle without a private hire vehicle driver’s licence only apply where the vehicle in question is being used as a private hire vehicle; against establishing standard three year licence periods for taxi drivers and five year licences for operators; and not to permit subcontracting between taxi operators licenced in different districts.
nay: to make the offence of driving a private hire vehicle without a private hire vehicle driver’s licence only apply where the vehicle in question is being used as a private hire vehicle; to establish standard three year licence periods for taxi drivers and five year licences for operators; and to permit subcontracting between taxi operators licenced in different districts.

title: European Union Recommended Revaluation of Properties for Council Tax Purposes
aye: against revaluing properties for council tax purposes.
nay: not to reject a recommendation to revalue properties for council tax purposes.

title: Opposition Day - Energy Prices - Require Suppliers to Pass on Wholesale Price Reductions to Consumers
aye: to require energy suppliers to pass on reductions in wholesale energy prices to consumers.
nay: not to require energy suppliers to pass on reductions in wholesale energy prices to consumers.

title: Opposition Day - Passport Applications - Compensation for Premimum and Fast Track Applicants - Publication of Statistics
aye: to pay compensation to those who opted to pay extra for premium and fast-track passport application services, in light of recent processing delays and for the publication of monthly statistics on passport applications.
nay: against paying compensation to those who opted to pay extra for premium and fast-track passport application services, in light of recent processing delays and against the publication of monthly statistics on passport applications.

title: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill -  New Clause 6 - Prison for Second Offence of Carrying a Knife
aye: for a minimum six-month jail sentence for adults convicted of carrying a knife for the second time.
nay: against a minimum six-month jail sentence for adults convicted of carrying a knife for the second time.

title: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill - Clause 58 - Judicial Review - Interveners and Costs
aye: against a presumption that interveners in judicial review cases will be required to pay any costs incurred by other parties as a result of their intervention.
nay: in favour of a presumption that interveners in judicial review cases will be required to pay any costs incurred by other parties as a result of their intervention.

title: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill - Clause 55 - Refusal of Applications for Judicial Review If Highly Unlikley Conduct Complained About Changed Outcome
aye: against allowing applications for judicial review to be refused if it appears to the court to be highly likely that the outcome for the applicant would not have been substantially different if the conduct complained of had not occurred.
nay: to allow applications for judicial review to be refused if it appears to the court to be highly likely that the outcome for the applicant would not have been substantially different if the conduct complained of had not occurred.

title: Consumer Rights Bill - Schedule 2 - Unfair Consumer Contract - Double Charging
aye: to deem a contract involving double charging an unfair consumer contract.
nay: against deeming a contract involving double charging an unfair consumer contract.

title: Consumer Rights Bill - New Clause 30 - Report on Detriment Caused by Letting Agent Fees and Plans to Prohibit Detrimental Fees
aye: to require a report on the detriment caused to tenants by letting agent fees and the steps the government intends to take to prohibit fees that cause detriment to tenants.
nay: against requiring a report on the detriment caused to tenants by letting agent fees and the steps the government intends to take to prohibit fees that cause detriment to tenants.

title: Queen's Speech - Note of Thanks - Legislatative Programme
aye: to send a proposed note of thanks to the monarch for reading out the government's legislative plans in Parliament.
nay: against sending a proposed note of thanks to the monarch for reading out the government's legislative plans in Parliament.

title: Queen's Speech - The Economy and Living Standards
aye: for a range of economic policies including raising the minimum wage, reintroducing a 10% starting rate of income tax and boosting the supply of housing.
nay: against a range of economic policies including raising the minimum wage, reintroducing a 10% starting rate of income tax and boosting the supply of housing.

title: Queen's Speech - Raising National Minimum Wage Faster than Average Earnings
aye: to raise the National Minimum Wage faster than average earnings.
nay: against raising the National Minimum Wage faster than average earnings.

title: Deregulation Bill - Clause 1 - Health and Safety Law Exemption for Self Employed People
aye: not to exempt self-employed people from health and safety law.
nay: to exempt self-employed people from health and safety law.

title: Consumer Rights Bill - New Clause 22 - Ban on Letting Agents Charging Tenants Fees
aye: to ban letting agents charging tenants, or prospective tenants, fees.
nay: not to ban letting agents charging tenants, or prospective tenants, fees.

title: Consumer Rights Bill - New Clause 16 - Guidance on How the Law Applies to Ticket Resellers
aye: for guidance to be produced for those reselling tickets for events on the subject of complying with the applicable law.
nay: against the production of guidance for those reselling tickets for events on the subject of complying with the applicable law.

title: Consumer Rights Bill - New Clause 13 - Labelling of Halal and Kosher Meat
aye: to require products containing halal and kosher meat to be labelled as such.
nay: against requiring products containing halal and kosher meat to be labelled as such.

title: Consumer Rights Bill - New Clause 23 - Ownership of Goods With A Charge Against Them Due to A Bill of Sale Agreement
aye: to make it so if someone purchases something they become its owner even if it has a debt secured on it as a result of a bill of sale agreement so long as they buyer was unaware of the loan.
nay: against making it so if someone purchases something they  become its owner even if it has a debt secured on it as a result of a bill of sale agreement so long as they buyer was unaware of the loan.

title: Consumer Rights Bill - New Clause 3 - Access to Data from Service Providers to Inform Consumer Choice
aye: to give consumers a right to data relating to their use of a service provided by a regulated service provider.
nay: against giving consumers a right to data relating to their use of a service provided by a regulated service provider.

title: Prohibition of Unpaid Internships
aye: to prohibit unpaid internships.
nay: against prohibiting unpaid internships.

title: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill - Clause 19 - Detention of Young Offenders in Young Offender Institutions, Secure Training Centres and Secure Colleges
aye: against replacing remand centres, detention centres and youth custody centres for those aged between 14 and 21 with young offender institutions, secure training centres and secure colleges.
nay: to replace remand centres, detention centres and youth custody centres for those aged between 14 and 21 with young offender institutions, secure training centres and secure colleges.

title: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill  - New Clause 15 - Hostility Based on Membership of the Armed Forced to be Considered Aggravating Factor in Offences
aye: to require hostility based on the victim being a former or serving member of the armed forces to be treated as aggravating factor to an offence when considering sentencing.
nay: not to make hostility based on the victim being a former or serving member of the armed forces to be treated as aggravating factor to an offence when considering sentencing.

title: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill - New Clause 38 - Release of Prisoners Liable for Deportation on Resettlement Licences
aye: to prevent prisoners liable for deportation from being released on resettlement licences.
nay: not to prevent prisoners liable for deportation from being released on resettlement licences.

title: Criminal Justice and Courts Bill - New Clause 22 - Increase Maximim Penalty for Driving While Disqualified to Two Years Imprisonment
aye: to increase the maximum penalty for driving while disqualified from six months to two years imprisonment.
nay: against increasing the maximum penalty for driving while disqualified from six months to two years imprisonment.

title: Care Bill - Clause 118 - Duties of Special Administrators of NHS Trusts
aye: to require special administrators of NHS trusts to act "without restricting access to", rather than "without harming", essential services.
nay: against requiring special administrators of NHS trusts to act "without restricting access to", rather than "without harming", essential services.

title: Immigration Bill - Requirement to Appoint Child Trafficking Guardian to Apply to England and Wales Only
aye: to require a child trafficking guardian to be appointed to represent the best interests of potential child victims of trafficking in human beings everywhere in the UK, not just in England and Wales.
nay: to require a child trafficking guardian to be appointed to represent the best interests of potential child victims of trafficking in human beings just in England and Wales rather than in the whole of the UK.

title: Immigration Bill - Require Appointment of Child Trafficking Guardians for Children Suspected to Have been Trafficked
aye: not to require the appointment of an independent child trafficking guardian to represent the best interests children suspected to have been brought to the UK as part of a trade in human beings.
nay: to require the appointment of an independent child trafficking guardian to represent the best interests children suspected to have been brought to the UK as part of a trade in human beings.

title: Immigration Bill - Clause 60 - Power to Deprive Naturalised Citizen of Citizenship Even If That Would Leave Them Stateless
aye: to allow the Secretary of State to deprive a naturalised British citizen of their citizenship even if doing so would make them stateless.
nay: against allowing the Secretary of State to deprive a naturalised British citizen of their citizenship even if doing so would make them stateless.

title: Requirement to Install Smoke Alarms In Privately Rented Accommodation
aye: to require the installation of smoke alarms in privately rented accommodation.
nay: against requiring the installation of smoke alarms in privately rented accommodation.

title: Minimum Price of Alcohol
aye: to introduce a ban on selling alcohol below a set minimum price.
nay: against introducing a ban on selling alcohol below a set minimum price.

title: Wales Bill - New Clause 1 - Consider Basing Welsh Public Funding on Need
aye: for a review of the system for allocating public money to Wales which would consider calculating funding on the basis of need rather than the current system of making changes based on population share.
nay: against reviewing the system for allocating public money to Wales and against considering calculating funding on the basis of need rather than the current system of than making changes based on population share.

title: Wales Bill - Clause 19 - Report on Welsh Ministers Issuing Bonds
aye: to require an independent report on the issuing of bonds by Welsh Ministers.
nay: not to require an independent report on the issuing of bonds by Welsh Ministers.

title: Wales Bill - Clause 6 - Report on Benefits of Symmetry Between Scottish and Welsh Devolved Tax Systems
aye: to require the chancellor to review the benefits of similar devolved tax schemes in Wales and Scotland if further tax raising powers were to be devolved to those countries.
nay: against requiring the chancellor to review the benefits of similar devolved tax schemes in Wales and Scotland if further tax raising powers were to be devolved to those countries.

title: Wales Bill- Clause 11 - Referendum on Devolving Welsh Income Tax Rate Setting - Independent Setting of Each Rate
aye: for any referendum on devolving Welsh income tax rate setting to the National Assembly for Wales to be on allowing each Welsh rate to be set independently, rather than just allowing an off-set from the rates set by the UK Parliament to be set.
nay: for any referendum on devolving Welsh income tax rate setting to the National Assembly for Wales to be on allowing an off-set from the rates set by the UK Parliament rather than allowing each Welsh rate to be set independently.

title: Wales Bill - New Clause 4 - Allowing National Assembly for Wales to Set The Number of AMs
aye: to allow the National Assembly for Wales to set the number of members of the National Assembly for Wales.
nay: against allowing the National Assembly for Wales to set the number of members of the National Assembly for Wales.

title: Wales Bill - Clause 2 - Allow Someone to Stand As Both Constituency and Regional Candidate in Welsh Assembly Election
aye: to allow someone to stand as both a constituency and a regional candidate in a Welsh Assembly Election.
nay: against allowing someone to stand as both a constituency and a regional candidate in a Welsh Assembly Election.

title: Government Assessment of Medium Term Economic and Budgetary Position for Submission to the European Commission
aye: to approve the Government's assessment of the UK's medium term economic and budgetary position for submission to the European Commission.
nay: not to approve the Government's assessment of the UK's medium term economic and budgetary position for submission to the European Commission.

title: Defence Reform Bill - Clause 49 - Report 12 Weeks In Advance of Consideration of Laws Enabling A Company To Provide Defence Procurement Services
aye: to require a report on the options for carrying out defence procurement to be published twelve weeks prior to the submission to parliament of any proposals for a company to provide defence procurement services to the Ministry of Defence, rather than just requiring the report at the same time as the submission.
nay: against requiring a report on the options for carrying out defence procurement to be published twelve weeks prior to the submission to parliament of any proposals for a company to provide defence procurement services to the Ministry of Defence, instead just requiring the report at the same time as the submission.

title: High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Bill - Second Reading
aye: for a High Speed Rail link between London and the West Midlands.
nay: against a High Speed Rail link between London and the West Midlands.

title: High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against a High Speed Rail link between London and the West Midlands.
nay: for a High Speed Rail link between London and the West Midlands.

title: Finance Bill - Part 2 - Devolution of Welsh Air Passenger Duty Rates to National Assembly for Wales
aye: to devolve responsibility for setting the rate of long haul air passenger duty applying to relevant flights originating in Wales to the National Assembly for Wales.
nay: against devolving responsibility for setting the rate of long haul air passenger duty applying to relevant flights originating in Wales to the National Assembly for Wales.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 112 - Require Report Before Reforms to Bank Levy
aye: to require a report on the impact bank levy rates before reforming them.
nay: against requiring a report on the impact bank levy rates before reforming them.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 5 - Report on Tax on Bankers' Bonuses and Sepnding Proceeds on Guaranteed Jobs
aye: for a review of the potential impact of introducing a tax on bankers bonuses covering how the revenue could be invested to pay for a guaranteed jobs scheme for those in long term unemployment.
nay: against a review of the potential impact of introducing a tax on bankers bonuses covering how the revenue could be invested to pay for a guaranteed jobs scheme for those in long term unemployment.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 11 - Transferable Tax Allowance for Married Couples and Civil Partners
aye: in favour of allowing married couples and civil partners to transfer their income tax free allowance to their partner.
nay: against allowing married couples and civil partners to transfer their income tax free allowance to their partner.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 11 - Review of Impact of Introducing Transferable Tax Allowance for Married Couples and Civil Partners
aye: to require a review of the impact of allowing married couples and civil partners to transfer their income tax free allowance to their partner within six months of permitting such a transfer.
nay: against requiring a review of the impact of allowing married couples and civil partners to transfer their income tax free allowance to their partner within six months of permitting such a transfer.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 1 - Childcare provision
aye: to require a review of possible changes to the tax and childcare systems aimed at making childcare more affordable.
nay: not to require a review of possible changes to the tax and childcare systems aimed at making childcare more affordable.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 1 - Report on Impact of Raising Tax Rate Applied to Income over £150,000 from 45% to 50%.
aye: to require a report on the impact of raising the rate of tax applied to income over £150,000 from 45% to 50%.
nay: against requiring a report on the impact of raising the rate of tax applied to income over £150,000 from 45% to 50%.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 4 - Report on impact of raising tax rate applied to income over £150,000 from 45% to 50%.
aye: to require a report on the impact of raising the rate of tax applied to income over £150,000 from 45% to 50%.
nay: against requiring a report on the impact of raising the rate of tax applied to income over £150,000 from 45% to 50%.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 5 - Report on Futher Corporation Tax Cut
aye: for a report on the impact of an additional cut of one per cent to main rate Corporation Tax on businesses, including small and medium sized enterprises.
nay: not to require a report on the impact of an additional cut of one per cent to main rate Corporation Tax on businesses, including small and medium sized enterprises

title: Opposition Day - Energy Price Freeze
aye: to freeze electricity and gas prices whilst the energy market is reformed.
nay: against freezing electricity and gas prices whilst the energy market is reformed.

title: Finance Bill - Carry-Over
aye: to increase the personal income tax allowance, to reduce corporation tax, and to give a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well as to support other measures in the Finance Bill.
nay: against increasing the personal income tax allowance, against reducing corporation tax, and against giving a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well against other measures in the Finance Bill.

title: Finance Bill - Second Reading
aye: to increase the personal income tax allowance, to reduce corporation tax, and to give a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well as to support other measures in the Finance Bill.
nay: against increasing the personal income tax allowance, against reducing corporation tax, and against giving a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well against other measures in the Finance Bill.

title: Finance Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against increasing the personal income tax allowance, against reducing corporation tax, and against giving a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well against other measures in the Finance Bill.
nay: to increase the personal income tax allowance, to reduce corporation tax, and to give a greater tax incentive to companies investing in assets, as well as to support other measures in the Finance Bill.

title: Welfare Cap - Charter for Budget Responsibility
aye: to cap the overall amount the state spends on welfare each year.
nay: against capping the overall amount the state spends on welfare each year.

title: Budget Resolution - The Bank Levy
aye: in favour of increasing the rate of the bank levy tax and in favour of changes aimed at improving the operational efficiency of the levy.
nay: against increasing the rate of the bank levy tax and against changes aimed at improving the operational efficiency of the levy.

title: Budget Resolution - Air Passenger Duty Rates  from 1 April 2014
aye: in favour of proposed increases in Air Passenger Duty.
nay: against proposed increases in Air Passenger Duty.

title: Budget Resolution - To Charge Corporation Tax for 2014-15
aye: to charge corporation tax during 2014-15
nay: not to charge corporation tax during 2014-15

title: March 2014 Budget
aye: to approve the March 2014 budget, increasing the personal income tax allowance, reducing corporation tax, capping welfare spending, reducing alcohol duties and more.
nay: against the the March 2014 budget, against increasing the personal income tax allowance, against reducing corporation tax, against capping welfare spending, against reducing alcohol duties and more.

title: Disenfranchisement of All Residents of Scotland In Event of Scottish Referendum In Favour of Independence
aye: to immediately prevent all residents of Scotland voting in UK general elections in the event of a Scottish referendum deciding in favour of an independent Scotland.
nay: against immediately preventing all residents of Scotland voting in UK general elections in the event of a Scottish referendum deciding in favour of an independent Scotland.

title: Pensions Bill - Occupational Pensions - Restriction of Charges
aye: to restrict management and transaction charges  for occupational pensions.
nay: against restricting management and transaction charges  for occupational pensions.

title: Pensions Bill - Clause 2 - Credit National Insurance Contribution Years Based on More than One Job
aye: against allowing people's earnings from more than one job to be combined for the purpose of determining eligibility for national insurance credits.
nay: to allow people's earnings from more than one job to be combined for the purpose of determining eligibility for national insurance credits.

title: Backbench Business - Badger Cull
aye: to stop the current badger culls.
nay: against stopping the current badger culls.

title: Intellectual Property Bill - New Clause 1 - Report on Plans for Future of Intellectual Property
aye: to require a report on the Government’s long term plans for the future of intellectual property in the United Kingdom prior to the introduction of new legislation.
nay: against requiring a report on the Government’s long term plans for the future of intellectual property in the United Kingdom prior to the introduction of new legislation.

title: Care Bill - Clause 119 - Proceedure for Dealing Financially Failing NHS Trusts - Requirement to Consult with Public
aye: to require administrators of financially failing NHS trusts to seek the support of those commissioning services from the trust, and affected trusts, for their proposed plan of action.
nay: against requiring administrators of financially failing NHS trusts to seek the support of those commissioning services from the trust, and affected trusts, for their proposed plan of action.

title: Care Bill - New Clause 16 - Detemination of Services to Continue at NHS Trusts under Administration
aye: to allow local commissioners, and commissioners at affected trusts, determine which services must continue to be provided by a NHS trust which has gone into administration; as well as to require public consultation prior to changes to services at affected trusts.
nay: against allowing local commissioners, and commissioners at affected trusts, to determine which services must continue to be provided by a NHS trust which has gone into administration; and against requiring public consultation prior to changes to services at affected trusts.

title: Care Bill - Clause 116 - Require Secretary of State's Approval For Use of Confidential Patient Information for Medical Research
aye: to require the Secretary of State's approval before any use of confidential patient information for medical research; rather than allowing the Health Research Authority alone to give approval.
nay: against requiring the Secretary of State's approval before any use of confidential patient information for medical research; rather than allowing the Health Research Authority alone to give approval.

title: Care Bill - New Clause 25 - New Offence Relating to Misuse of Information from the Health and Social Care Information Centre.
aye: to create a new specific offence of misusing, or negligently allowing the misuse of, information they requested and received from the Health and Social Care Information Centre.
nay: against creating a new specific offence of misusing, or negligently allowing the misuse of, information they requested and received from the Health and Social Care Information Centre.

title: Offender Rehabilitation Bill - Parliamentary Approval of Probation Service Reforms
aye: to require parliamentary approval of reforms to the probation service.
nay: to require parliamentary approval of reforms to the probation service.

title: Care Bill - Clause 90 - Role of Care Quality Commission - Local Government Provision of Adult Social Services
aye: to require the Care Quality Commission to review the provision, and commissioning, of adult social services by local councils.
nay: against requiring the Care Quality Commission to review the provision, and commissioning, of adult social services by local councils.

title: Care Bill - New Clause 27 - New Offence Relating to Abuse and Neglect of Those Receiving Care
aye: to make it an offence for care providers to manage or organise their activities in a manner leading to, or creating the possibility of, abuse or neglect occurring; and also to require care providers to investigate and report suspected risks of, or actual, abuse or neglect of those in their care.
nay: against making it an offence for care providers to manage or organise their activities in a manner leading to, or creating the possibility of, abuse or neglect occurring; and also against requiring care providers to investigate and report suspected risks of, or actual, abuse or neglect of those in their care.

title: Care Bill - New Clause 19 - Promoting Health of Carers
aye: to require the NHS to give specific consideration , particularly related to health, to those who, on an unpaid basis, look after a family member, partner or friend who needs help because of their illness, frailty or disability.
nay: against requiring the NHS to give specific consideration , particularly related to health, to those who, on an unpaid basis, look after a family member, partner or friend who needs help because of their illness, frailty or disability.

title: Care Bill - New Clause 11 - Human Rights Act to Apply to All Providers of Regulated Social Care
aye: to make it unlawful for any provider of regulated social care to act in a manner incompatible with the European Convention on Human Rights.
nay: against making it unlawful for any provider of regulated social care to act in a manner incompatible with the European Convention on Human Rights.

title: Care Bill - New Clause 9 - Require Annual Report on Social Care Funding Levels
aye: to require an annual report on the sufficiency of social care funding.
nay: not to require an annual report on the sufficiency of social care funding.

title: Make Same Sex Marriage Available to Armed Forces Personnel Outside the United Kingdom
aye: to make same sex marriage available to armed forces personnel outside the UK.
nay: against making same sex marriage available to armed forces personnel outside the UK.

title: Amendments to Acts of Parliament in Light of the Introduction of Same Sex Marriage in Parts of the UK
aye: in favour of various amendments to acts of Parliament in light of the introduction of same sex marriage.
nay: against various amendments to acts of Parliament in light of the introduction of same sex marriage.

title: Changes to Laws on Consular Marriage Following Introduction of Same Sex Marriages in Parts of the UK
aye: in favour of updating the law on marriages outside the UK in the presence of a consular official following the introduction of same sex marriages in England and Wales.
nay: against updating the law on marriages outside the UK in the presence of a consular official following the introduction of same sex marriages in England and Wales.

title: Registration of Armed Forces Chapels for Same Sex Marriages
aye: to require the Secretary of State for Defence have regard to the views of religious organisations which make significant use of an armed forces chapel before deciding if to register the chapel for marriage of same sex couples, or if to cancel such a registration.
nay: against requiring the Secretary of State for Defence have regard to the views of religious organisations which make significant use of an armed forces chapel before deciding if to register the chapel for marriage of same sex couples, or if to cancel such a registration.

title: Proceedures for Consenting to Registration of Shared Places of Worship for Same Sex Marriage
aye: to approve detailed procedures for the provision of consent for the registration of, and cancellation of the registration of, formally shared places of religious worship for the purposes of same sex marriage.
nay: against proposed detailed procedures for the provision of consent for the registration of, and cancellation of the registration of, formally shared places of religious worship for the purposes of same sex marriage.

title: Same Sex Marriage - Enabling Courts to Deal with Divorce or Annulment Proceedings
aye: to enable the courts to deal with proceedings for the divorce of, or annulment of the marriage of, a same sex couple.
nay: against enabling the courts to deal with proceedings for the divorce of, or annulment of the marriage of, a same sex couple.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Housing Benefit - Penalty for Excess Bedrooms - Removal of Unintended Exemption
aye: to retain an exemption from housing benefit penalties due to being deemed to have excess bedrooms which applied to those who've continuously received the benefit in the same property since before 1 January 1996.
nay: to remove an exemption from housing benefit penalties due to being deemed to have excess bedrooms which applied to those who've continuously received the benefit in the same property since before 1 January 1996.

title: Local Government Finance Report (England) 2014-15
aye: to approve the Local Government Finance Report (England) 2014-15.
nay: against the Local Government Finance Report (England) 2014-15.

title: Police Grant Report - 2014-15
aye: to approve proposed arrangements for funding policing in England and Wales.
nay: against proposed arrangements for funding policing in England and Wales.

title: Housing Benefit and Universal Credit - Regular Payments and Penalty for Excess Bedrooms
aye: against a financial penalty for those receiving housing related benefits on the basis of the number of bedrooms they have.
nay: in favor of a financial penalty for those receiving housing related benefits on the basis of the number of bedrooms they have.

title: Abolition of the National Consumer Council and Transfer of Estate Agent Regulation to Powys Trading Standards
aye: to abolish the National Consumer Council and to transfer the regulation of estate agencies from the Office of Fair Trading to Powys trading standards.
nay: against abolishing the National Consumer Council and against transferring the regulation of estate agencies from the Office of Fair Trading to Powys trading standards.

title: Opposition Day - Halt Further Spending and Welfare Cuts and Investigation Impact of Austerity Measures
aye: to halt further spending and welfare cuts and to investigate the impact of austerity measures on the incidence of poverty and inequality.
nay: not to halt further spending and welfare cuts and not to investigate the impact of austerity measures on the incidence of poverty and inequality.

title: Children and Families Bill - Prohibition on Purchasing Tobacco for a Child and Regulation of Tobacco Products
aye: to introduce a new offence of purchasing tobacco for an individual under 18 and to allow ministers to make regulations about the sale, packaging, and characteristics of tobacco products in the interests of protecting children.
nay: against the introduction of a new offence of purchasing tobacco for an individual under 18 and against allowing ministers to make regulations about the sale, packaging, and characteristics of tobacco products in the interests of protecting children.

title: Children and Families Bill - Offence of Smoking in a Private Vehicle When A Person Under 18 is Present
aye: in favour of a new law requiring private vehicles be smoke-free where a person under the age of 18 is present in the vehicle.
nay: against a new law requiring private vehicles be smoke-free where a person under the age of 18 is present in the vehicle.

title: Opposition Day - Employment Rights - Strategy for Creating Higher Skilled Better Paid Jobs
aye: to strengthen employment rights and to call on the Government to adopt a strategy for creating more high-skilled, better paid jobs.
nay: against strengthening employment rights and against calling on the Government to adopt a strategy for creating more high-skilled, better paid jobs.

title: Opposition Day - NHS Competition Policy
aye: for the Government's policies for regulated competition within the NHS.
nay: against the Government's policies for regulated competition within the NHS.

title: Opposition Day - NHS Competition Policy
aye: against the Government's policies for regulated competition within the NHS.
nay: for the Government's policies for regulated competition within the NHS.

title: Anti-Social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill - Clause 151 - Definition of Miscarriages of Justice
aye: to define a miscarriage of justice as being where a new or newly discovered fact shows beyond reasonable doubt that the person "did not commit", rather than "was innocent of", the offence.
nay: to define a miscarriage of justice as being where a new or newly discovered fact shows beyond reasonable doubt that the person "was innocent of", rather than "did not commit", the offence.

title: Anti-Social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill - Clause 151 - Definition of Miscarriages of Justice
aye: to require a person be shown to be innocent of the offence they have been convicted of for a miscarriage of justice to be considered to have taken place (rather than making the test showing conclusively that the evidence against the person at trial is so undermined that no conviction could possibly be based on it).
nay: not to require a person be shown to be innocent of the offence they have been convicted of for a miscarriage of justice to be considered to have taken place instead making the test showing conclusively that the evidence against the person at trial is so undermined that no conviction could possibly be based on it).

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Motion That The House Do Now Resume
aye: to curtail debate on a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU.
nay: to continue to debate a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Require Report on UK Relationship With EU Post Withdrawl Prior to EU Membership Referendum
aye: to require the publication of a report on the UK's intended relationship with the EU in the event of the UK's withdrawal prior to a referendum on the UK's EU membership.
nay: not to require the publication of a report on the UK's intended relationship with the EU in the event of the UK's withdrawal prior to a referendum on the UK's EU membership.

title: Immigration Bill - Third Reading
aye: for a series of immigration measures including greater removal and enforcement powers, restrictions on the detention of children, the introduction of powers to levy an NHS charge on some of those seeking to enter the UK, and measures to prevent those not legally present in the UK renting properties and obtaining driving licenses.
nay: against a series of immigration measures including greater removal and enforcement powers, restrictions on the detention of children, the introduction of powers to levy an NHS charge on some of those seeking to enter the UK, and measures to prevent those not legally present in the UK renting properties and obtaining driving licenses.

title: Immigration Bill - Clause 11 - Restrict Right to Appeal Immigration Decisions to the First-tier Tribunal
aye: against significantly restricting the circumstances in which an immigration decision may be appealed to the relevant Tribunal.
nay: to significantly restrict the circumstances in which an immigration decision may be appealed to the relevant Tribunal.

title: Immigration Bill - New Clause 15 - Exemptions to Automatic Deportation of Criminals on Human Rights Grounds
aye: to only allow human rights grounds to be used to prevent a foreign criminal being deported in cases where there would be a breach of the right to life, or right not to be tortured; and against adding a new exemption to deportation for cases where harm to the criminal's children outweighs the public interest in removal.
nay: against only allowing human rights grounds to be used to prevent a foreign criminal being deported in cases where there would be a breach of the right to life, or right not to be tortured; and to add a new exemption to deportation for cases where harm to the criminal's children outweighs the public interest in removal.

title: Immigration Bill - New Clauses 12 and 18 - Fees - Power to Deprive Naturalised Citizen of Citizenship Even If That Would Leave Them Stateless
aye: to allow the Secretary of State to deprive a naturalised British citizen of their citizenship even if doing so would make them stateless.
nay: against allowing the Secretary of State to deprive a naturalised British citizen of their citizenship even if doing so would make them stateless.

title: Opposition Day - Government Education Policies
aye: to note, acknowledge, recognise and register elements of the Government's education policies.
nay: not to note, acknowledge, recognise and register elements of the Government's education policies.

title: Opposition Day - Qualified Teacher Status
aye: to require all teachers in all state-funded schools to have, or be working towards, Qualified Teacher Status.
nay: against requiring all teachers in all state-funded schools to have, or be working towards, Qualified Teacher Status.

title: Children and Families Bill - Offence of Smoking in a Private Vehicle When a Child or Children Are Present
aye: to make it clearer to ministers that they have the power to introduce a new offence of smoking in a private vehicle when a child or children are present.
nay: against making it clearer to ministers that they have the power to introduce a new offence of smoking in a private vehicle when a child or children are present.

title: European Union (Approvals) Bill - Third Reading - European Archives and Europe for Citizens Programme
aye: for a 185 million Euro EU Europe for Citizens programme of activities and to require EU institutions to deposit their archives at the European University Institute
nay: against a 185 million Euro EU Europe for Citizens programme of activities and not to require EU institutions to deposit their archives at the European University Institute

title: European Union (Approvals) Bill - Clause 1 - Influence of Europe for Citizens Programme on EU Referenda and Elections
aye: to ensure the "Europe for Citizens" programme does not influence any EU referendum or election.
nay: against ensuring the "Europe for Citizens" programme does not influence any EU referendum or election.

title: European Union (Approvals) Bill - Clause 1 - Limitation of Scope of Europe for Citizens Programme
aye: to limit the EU's "Europe for Citizens" programme to education about, and reflection on, the Holocaust, armed conflicts and totalitarian regimes in Europe’s history and to explicitly forbid the programme from promoting European citizenship, integration or institutions.
nay: not to limit the EU's "Europe for Citizens" programme to education about, and reflection on, the Holocaust, armed conflicts and totalitarian regimes in Europe’s history and against explicitly forbidding the programme from promoting European citizenship, integration or institutions.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Require Report on Impact of UK Ceasing to be an EU Member
aye: to require the Government to produce an evidence based assessment of the impact of the United Kingdom ceasing to be a member of the European union prior to a referendum being held on the question of the UK's membership of the EU.
nay: against requiring the Government to produce an evidence based assessment of the impact of the United Kingdom ceasing to be a member of the European union prior to a referendum being held on the question of the UK's membership of the EU.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Wording of Referendum Question
aye: for the question for the referendum of the UK's membership of the EU to be "Should the United Kingdom remain a member of the European Union or leave the European Union?" rather than "Do you think that the United Kingdom should be a member of the European Union?"
nay: for the question for the referendum of the UK's membership of the EU to be "Do you think that the United Kingdom should be a member of the European Union?" rather than "Should the United Kingdom remain a member of the European Union or leave the European Union?"

title: Shrewsbury 24 - Release of Papers
aye: in favour of releasing papers related to a building dispute in 1972 which led to the prosecutions of workers known as the Shrewsbury 24.
nay: against releasing papers related to a building dispute in 1972 which led to the prosecutions of workers known as the Shrewsbury 24.

title: European Commission Work Programme 2014 and Support for Completion of the EU Single Market
aye: to support the that view that promoting jobs and growth in the EU, including by completing the EU Single Market, is the top priority.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 28 - Regulated Expenditure by Third Parties in General Elections
aye: against limiting what counts as controlled expenditure by third parties in general elections to only expenditure on election materials and unsolicited phone calls.
nay: to limit what counts as controlled expenditure by third parties in general elections to only expenditure on election materials and unsolicited phone calls.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Schedule 3 - Inclusion of Staff Costs in Controlled Expenditure
aye: to include staff costs under the controls on spending by campaigners who are not candidates, or who are not putting up candidates, in general elections.
nay: to exclude staff costs from the controls on spending by campaigners who are not candidates, or who are not putting up candidates, in general elections.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 2 - Inclusion of Those Who Lobby Special Advisers In Register of Lobbyists
aye: against requiring the inclusion of those who lobby special advisors in a register of consultant lobbyists.
nay: to require the inclusion of those who lobby special advisors in a register of consultant lobbyists.

title: Civil Legal Aid (Merits Criteria) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations - Legal Aid In Cases With Borderline Prospect of Success
aye: in favour of legal aid only being provided in cases assessed to have a greater than "borderline" chance of success.
nay: against legal aid only being provided in cases assessed to have a greater than "borderline" chance of success.

title: Opposition Day - Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures - Statement and Review
aye: to request a statement from the Government on the threat caused by six individuals exiting Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures and for a cross party review of the measures.
nay: to against requesting a statement from the Government on the threat caused by six individuals exiting Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures and against a cross party review of the measures.

title: Opposition Day - Pub Companies
aye: to note it is right the Government carefully considers the results of its pub companies and tenants consultation.
nay: against noting it is right the Government carefully considers the results of its pub companies and tenants consultation.

title: Opposition Day - Pub Companies
aye: for a statutory code of practice for large pub companies which would require them to offer the option of a rent only leases.
nay: against a statutory code of practice for large pub companies which would require them to offer the option of a rent only leases.

title: Benefit Entitlement (Restriction) Bill
aye: to restrict the entitlement of non-UK citizens from the European Union and the European Economic Area to UK taxpayer-funded benefits.
nay: not to restrict the entitlement of non-UK citizens from the European Union and the European Economic Area to UK taxpayer-funded benefits.

title: Opposition Day - Banking - National Minimum Wage
aye: to note the Government's record of increasing the minimum wage each year and its work on enforcement of it; as well as noting tax cuts for the lowest paid.
nay: against noting the Government's record of increasing the minimum wage each year and its work on enforcement of it; and against noting tax cuts for the lowest paid.

title: Opposition Day - Banking - National Minimum Wage
aye: to strengthen the enforcement of the minimum wage, to increase the national minimum wage, and to encourage employers to pay a living wage.
nay: against strengthening the enforcement of the minimum wage, against increasing the national minimum wage, and against encouraging employers to pay a living wage.

title: Opposition Day - Banking
aye: in favour of opposition calls for real reform and competition in the banking sector.
nay: against opposition calls for real reform and competition in the banking sector.

title: Offender Rehabilitation Bill - New Clause 5 - Provision of Probation Services: Report to Parliament
aye: to require a report on the performance of those contracted to provide probation services a year after the Act comes into force.
nay: against requiring a report on the performance of those contracted to provide probation services a year after the Act comes into force.

title: Offender Rehabilitation Bill - New Clause 4 - Probation Reform Pilot Schemes
aye: to require an independently evaluated pilot scheme, with the results laid before Parliament, before restructuring the probation service nationally.
nay: not to require an independently evaluated pilot scheme, with the results laid before Parliament, before restructuring the probation service nationally.

title: Offender Rehabilitation Bill - New Clause 1 - Probation Service Reform: Parliamentary Approval
aye: to require any proposals for restructuring or reforming the the probation service be approved by both Houses of Parliament.
nay: not to require any proposals for restructuring or reforming the the probation service be approved by both Houses of Parliament.

title: Inquiry into Impact of Welfare Reforms on Incidence of Poverty
aye: to establish a commission of inquiry to investigate the impact of the Government’s welfare reforms on the incidence of poverty.
nay: against establishing a commission of inquiry to investigate the impact of the Government’s welfare reforms on the incidence of poverty.

title: European Union (Approvals) Bill - Second Reading - European Archives and Europe for Citizens Programme
aye: for a 185 million Euro EU Europe for Citizens programme of activities and to require EU institutions to deposit their archives at the European University Institute
nay: against a 185 million Euro EU Europe for Citizens programme of activities and not to require EU institutions to deposit their archives at the European University Institute

title: Opposition Day  - Regulation of Gambling
aye: against giving local government more powers to regulate betting shops and fixed odds betting terminals.
nay: to give local government more powers to regulate betting shops and fixed odds betting terminals.

title: Opposition Day - Fixed Odds Betting Terminals and Betting Shops
aye: to give local councils powers to prevent the proliferation of fixed odds betting terminals and betting shops
nay: against giving local councils powers to prevent the proliferation of fixed odds betting terminals and betting shops

title: Opposition Day - Housing Supply - New Towns - Empowering Local Government
aye: to boost housing supply by reforming the development industry; for measures to tackle landbanking; for a new generation of New Towns and Garden Cities and for giving local authorities a new right to grow to deliver the homes their communities need.
nay: against boosting housing supply by reforming the development industry; against measures to tackle landbanking; against a new generation of New Towns and Garden Cities and against giving local authorities a new right to grow to deliver the homes their communities need.

title: Mesothelioma Bill - Clause 4 - Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme to Be At Least 80% of Average Civil Compensation Payments
aye: to require payments under the Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme be no less than 80 per cent of the average civil compensation recovered by mesothelioma claimants.
nay: not to require payments under the Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme be no less than 80 per cent of the average civil compensation recovered by mesothelioma claimants.

title: Mesothelioma Bill - Clause 2 - Eligiblity for Payments under Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme.
aye: to make those diagnosed with diffuse mesothelioma since 10 February 2010 rather than since 25 July 2012 potentially eligible for payments under the Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme.
nay: to make those diagnosed with diffuse mesothelioma since 25 July 2012 rather than since 10 February 2010 potentially eligible for payments under the Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme.

title: Mesothelioma Bill - New Clause 2 - Divert Up to 1% of Payment Scheme Levy to Fund Research
aye: for up to 1% of the levy on insurers designed to fund the Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme to be used to fund additional research into mesothelioma.
nay: against up to 1% of the levy on insurers designed to fund the Diffuse Mesothelioma Payment Scheme to be used to fund additional research into mesothelioma.

title: Water Bill - New Clause 11 - Reporting Requirements on Certain Water Companies
aye: to require certain water companies to annually provide information on their performance, investment, structure and dividends to the Secretary of State.
nay: against requiring certain water companies to annually provide information on their performance, investment, structure and dividends to the Secretary of State.

title: Water Bill - New Clause 7 - National Affordability Scheme for Water
aye: for national eligibility standards for assistance paying water bills.
nay: against national eligibility standards for assistance paying water bills.

title: Water Bill - New Clause 1 - Legislative Competence for Water in Wales
aye: to give the National Assembly for Wales full powers in relation to water in Wales up to the English border.
nay: against giving the National Assembly for Wales full powers in relation to water in Wales up to the English border.

title: Opposition Day - Food Banks - Economic Policies
aye: to publish the results of research into food banks; to freeze energy prices; for a water affordability scheme; for measures to end abuses of zero hours contracts; to incentivise those paying the living wage and to abolish the under-occupancy penalty for social housing tenants.
nay: against publishing the results of research into food banks; against freezing energy prices; against a water affordability scheme; against measures to end abuses of zero hours contract; against incentives for those paying the living wage and against abolishing the under-occupancy penalty for social housing tenants.

title: Opposition Day - Accident and Emergency - Guaranteed GP Appointments Within 48 Hours - Winter 2013
aye: for a guarantee of a GP appointment within 48 hours to be retained during winter 2013.
nay: to remove the guarantee of a GP appointment within 48 hours during winter 2013.

title: Local Audit and Accountability Bill - Clause 41 - Exclusion of City Deal Levies When Determining if Council Tax Rise Excessive
aye: to allow council tax increases due to levies agreed as part of a city deal to be excluded when considering if a council tax increase is excessive and needs to be put to a referendum.
nay: to include council tax increases due to levies agreed as part of a city deal when considering if a council tax increase is excessive and needs to be put to a referendum.

title: Local Audit and Accountability Bill - Clause 39 - Protocol for Issuing Direction Relating to Code of Practice on Local Authority Publicity
aye: to only allow the Secretary of State to issue a direction to a local council relating to compliance with the code of practice on local authority publicity where evidence of a breach of a code has been sent to the authority and, if the authority has replied, that a report from the Secretary of State in light of that reply has been published.
nay: against a proposal to only allow the Secretary of State to issue a direction to a local council relating to compliance with the code of practice on local authority publicity where evidence of a breach of a code has been sent to the authority and, if the authority has replied, that a report from the Secretary of State in light of that reply has been published.

title: Care Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against capping the amount a local authority can charge for care costs and against setting out the responsibilities of local authorities in relation to care as well as against reforming the regulation of care and support services.
nay: to cap the amount a local authority can charge for care costs and to set out the responsibilities of local authorities in relation to care as well as to reform the regulation of care and support services.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill  - Daily Information Exchange With Credit Reference Agencies by Those Offering High-Cost Short-Term Credit
aye: to require rules relating to high-cost short-term credit designed to protect borrowers against excessive charges to be made by 1 October 2014 rather than 2 January 2015.
nay: to require rules relating to high-cost short-term credit designed to protect borrowers against excessive charges to be made by 2 January 2015 rather than 1 October 2014.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill  - Daily Information Exchange With Credit Reference Agencies by Those Offering High-Cost Short-Term Credit
aye: to require those offering high-cost short-term credit to make daily updates of credit reference agency records and to use information from the agencies to assess their customers' creditworthiness.
nay: against requiring those offering high-cost short-term credit to make daily updates of credit reference agency records and to use information from the agencies to assess their customers' creditworthiness.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill - Licensing of those Working in the Financial Sector
aye: to require those carrying out certain functions in the financial sector to be licensed.
nay: against requiring those carrying out certain functions in the financial sector to be licensed.

title: National Insurance (Contributions) Bill - New Clause 3 - Report on Youth Unemployement and Effect of Scrapping Employer's National Insurance Contributions for Employees Under 21
aye: to require a review of the level of youth unemployment as at December 2013 and of the expected effect of abolishing employers' national insurance in respect of most employees aged under 21.
nay: against requiring a review of the level of youth unemployment as at December 2013 and of the expected effect of abolishing employers' national insurance in respect of most employees aged under 21.

title: Business of the House - Time for Consideration of Private Members' Bills
aye: to move consideration of Private Members Bills to the end of the day on the 10th of December 2013.
nay: against moving consideration of Private Members Bills to the end of the day on the 10th of December 2013.

title: Business Rates - Action to Ease Burden
aye: against action to ease the burden of business rates.
nay: for action to ease the burden of business rates.

title: Opposition Day - Business Rates
aye: for action to ease the burden of business rates on all sectors.
nay: against action to ease the burden of business rates on all sectors.

title: Energy Bill - Fuel Poverty Regulations and Strategy
aye: to require laws, and a strategy, aimed at addressing the fact some people are unable to afford adequate home heating.
nay: against requiring laws, and a strategy, aimed at addressing the fact some people are unable to afford adequate home heating.

title: Energy Bill - Enabling Carbon Dioxide Emissions Limits to be Applied to Stations Which Fit Pollution Abatement Equipment
aye: against allowing carbon dioxide emissions limits to be set in respect of existing stations which fit pollution abatement equipment.
nay: to allow carbon dioxide emissions limits to be set in respect of existing stations which fit pollution abatement equipment.

title: Recall of Elected Representatives - Power for Voters to Prompt New Election Before Term of Office Ends
aye: to give voters the power to prompt a new election for an elected representative before their term of office comes to an end.
nay: against giving voters the power to prompt a new election for an elected representative before their term of office comes to an end.

title: Categories of Gaming Machine (Amendment) Regulations 2014 - Stake and Prize Limit Increases
aye: to increase the stake, and prize, limits for certain categories of gambling machine.
nay: against increasing the stake, and prize, limits for certain categories of gambling machine.

title: European Union (Definition of Treaties) (Colombia and Peru Trade Agreement) Order 2013
aye: in favour of an EU trade agreement with Colombia and Peru
nay: against an EU trade agreement with Colombia and Peru

title: Mesothelioma Bill - Programme
aye: to approve a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Mesothelioma Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Mesothelioma Bill.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 3 - Breakdown of Results by European Parliament Constituency With Gibraltar Separate
aye: to require publication of breakdown of the results of a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU by European Parliamentary Constituency; with Gibraltar's result published separately.
nay: against requiring publication of a breakdown of the results of a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU by European Parliamentary Constituency; with Gibraltar's result published separately.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 3 - Deadline for Electoral Commission Recommendations on EU Referendum Rules
aye: to set a deadline of 1 March 2015 for the Electoral Commission to publish its recommendations for rules for a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union.
nay: not to set a deadline of 1 March 2015 for the Electoral Commission to publish its recommendations for rules for a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 2 - Entitlement of British Overseas Territories Residents to Vote in the Referendum
aye: to allow residents of all British Overseas Territories to vote in a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU
nay: against allowing residents of all British Overseas Territories to vote in a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 2 - Votes for 16 and 17 Year Olds in Referendum on UK's Membership of the EU
aye: to allow 16 and 17 year olds to vote in a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU
nay: against allowing 16 and 17 year olds to vote in a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Parliamentary Approval of Referendum Date
aye: to limit the role of Parliament in setting the date for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU
nay: against limiting the role of Parliament in setting the date for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Wording of Referendum Question
aye: for a referendum question asking if the UK should "remain" (rather than "be") in the EU.
nay: for a referendum question asking if the UK should "be" (rather than "remain") in the EU.

title: Opposition Day - Cost of Living
aye: for an energy price freeze; for long term reforms to the energy market; for more free childcare for working parents of three and four year olds; for action to boost the housing supply and for a compulsory jobs guarantee for young people and the long term unemployed.
nay: against an energy price freeze; against long term reforms to the energy market; against more free childcare for working parents of three and four year olds; against action to boost the housing supply and against a compulsory jobs guarantee for young people and the long term unemployed.

title: Gambling (Licensing and Advertising) Bill - New Clause 14 - Self-Exclusion for Remote Gambling
aye: to require those running internet and telephone gambling operations to ban those who have registered for self-exclusion.
nay: not to require those running internet and telephone gambling operations to ban those who have registered for self-exclusion.

title: Gambling (Licensing and Advertising) Bill - New Clause 11 - Power to Extend Horserace Betting Levy to Overseas Bookmakers
aye: to extend the horserace betting levy to overseas bookmakers.
nay: against extending the horserace betting levy to overseas bookmakers.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Consultation on Wording of Referendum Question
aye: to require consultation on the wording of the referendum question relating to the UK's membership of the EU.
nay: against consultation on the wording of the referendum question relating to the UK's membership of the EU.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Closure of Debate on Consultation on Wording of Referendum Question
