aye: to close the debate on if there ought be consultation on what question should appear on the ballot paper for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU and move to a vote on the matter.
nay: to spend more time debating the question of if there ought be consultation on what question should appear on the ballot paper for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Date of Referendum on the UK's Membership of the European Union
aye: to exclude the period between 31 July and 1 December 2017 from the potential dates for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU
nay: not to exclude the period between 31 July and 1 December 2017 from the potential dates for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Referendum on the UK's Membership of the EU on 23 October 2014
aye: to hold a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union on the 23rd of October 2014
nay: against requiring a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union be held specifically on the 23rd of October 2014; retaining instead a more general requirement to hold one by the end of 2017

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Report on Merits or Otherwise of UK Remaining a Member of the EU
aye: to require the production of a report on the merits or otherwise of the UK remaining a member of the EU.
nay: not to require the production of a report on the merits or otherwise of the UK remaining a member of the EU.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Clause 1 - Closure of Debate on Consultation on Wording of Referendum Question
aye: to stop the debate on if a report on the merits of otherwise of the UK's membership of the EU ought be produced following consultation and move straight to a vote
nay: to spend more time debating if a report on the merits of otherwise of the UK's membership of the EU ought be produced following consultation rather than moving straight to a vote

title: Defence Reform Bill - New Clause 6 - Leave Entitlement for Reserve Forces
aye: to give reservists an entitlement to two weeks additional unpaid leave from their employment, for paid training. This applies if their company has over 50 employees.
nay: against giving reservists an entitlement to two weeks additional unpaid leave from their employment, for paid training. This would apply if their company has over 50 employees.

title: Defence Reform Bill - New Clause 3 - Report and Parliamentary Approval of Plans on the Future of the Reserve Forces
aye: to require a report, and the approval of Parliament, before implementing plans to reform the reserve forces.
nay: against requiring a report, and the approval of Parliament, before implementing plans to reform the reserve forces.

title: Extending Free Nursery Places - Breakfast and After-School Clubs to Provide 8am-6pm Childcare - Tax Breaks for Firms Starting to Pay a Living Wage
aye: to extend free nursery places for 3 and 4 year olds from 15 to 25 hours per week; to introduce a guarantee of 8am-6pm childcare via breakfast and after-school clubs; and for a tax rebate for firms which sign up to pay the living wage.
nay: against extending free nursery places for 3 and 4 year olds from 15 to 25 hours per week; against introducing a guarantee of 8am-6pm childcare via breakfast and after-school clubs; and against a tax rebate for firms which sign up to pay the living wage.

title: Opposition Day - Free Child Care for Parents of 3-4 Year Olds
aye: to increase the amount of free child care offered to parents of 3 and 4 year olds from 15 to 25 hours
nay: against increasing the amount of free child care offered to parents of 3 and 4 year olds from 15 to 25 hours

title: Opposition Day - Housing Benefit - Deductions for Those Deemed to Have Excess Bedrooms
aye: for a reduction in housing benefit for social tenants deemed to have excess bedrooms.
nay: against a reduction in housing benefit for social tenants deemed to have excess bedrooms.

title: Opposition Day - Housing Benefit - Deductions for those deemed to have excess bedrooms
aye: against reducing housing benefit for those deemed to have excess bedrooms.
nay: in favour of reducing housing benefit for those deemed to have excess bedrooms.

title: Offender Rehabilitation Bill - Money
aye: in favour of Government policies aimed at reducing re-offending, including drug appointments conditions for those released from prison and more supervision following prison sentences.
nay: against Government policies aimed at reducing re-offending, including drug appointments conditions for those released from prison and more supervision following prison sentences.

title: Offender Rehabilitation Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Offender Rehabilitation Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Offender Rehabilitation Bill.

title: Offender Rehabilitation Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against Government policies aimed at reducing re-offending, including drug appointments conditions for those released from prison and more supervision following prison sentences.
nay: in favour of Government policies aimed at reducing re-offending, including drug appointments conditions for those released from prison and more supervision following prison sentences.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - New Clause 1 - Right of People of Gibraltar to Vote in Referendum on UK Membership of the EU
aye: to allow the people of Gibraltar to vote in a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union.
nay: against allowing the people of Gibraltar to vote in a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Closure Motion on Debate on Eligibility to Vote in Referendum on the UK Membership of the EU
aye: to close the debate on who ought be eligible to vote in a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU and move to votes on the matter.
nay: to spend more time debating who ought be eligible to vote in a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Business of the House - Require MPs to Provide Explanatory Statements Along With Amendments to Bills They Propose
aye: to require MPs to provide explanatory statements to accompany amendments they propose to Bills.
nay: against requiring MPs to provide explanatory statements to accompany amendments they propose to Bills.

title: Opposition Day - Energy Prices
aye: to freeze electricity and gas prices for 20 months; to introduce a new more powerful regulator of the energy sector; and to put all over 75s on the cheapest tariff.
nay: against freezing electricity and gas prices for 20 months;  against introducing a new more powerful regulator of the energy sector; and against putting all over 75s on the cheapest tariff.

title: High Speed Rail (Preparation) Bill - Third Reading
aye: to approve spending money on preparations for a high speed rail network connecting at least London, Birmingham, the East Midlands, Sheffield, Leeds, and Manchester.
nay: against spending money on preparations for a high speed rail network connecting at least London, Birmingham, the East Midlands, Sheffield, Leeds, and Manchester.

title: Opposition Day - Probation Service Reforms
aye: to support the Government's probation service reforms.
nay: against the Government's probation service reforms.

title: Opposition Day - Suspension of Probation Service Reforms
aye: to suspend Government reforms to the probation service.
nay: against suspending Government reforms to the probation service.

title: Opposition Day - Require State School Teachers to Have or be Working Towards Qualified Teacher Status
aye: to require state school teachers to have, or be working towards, qualified teacher status.
nay: against requiring state school teachers to have, or be working towards, qualified teacher status.

title: Draft Enterprise and Regulatory Reform (Designation of the UK Green Investment Bank) Order 2013
aye: to ensure Parliamentary oversight of UK Green Investment Bank PLC's objects; to enable the Bank to receive financial assistance from the Secretary of State; and to impose reporting and publication requirements on the Bank.
nay: against ensuring Parliamentary oversight of UK Green Investment Bank PLC's objects; against enabling the Bank to receive financial assistance from the Secretary of State; and against imposing reporting and publication requirements on the Bank.

title: Pensions Bill  - Clause 24 - Prevent Amendment of Pension Schemes for Former Nationalised Industries Following State Pension Changes
aye: to prevent a number of pension schemes relating to previously nationalised industries being amended following the introduction of the single state pension.
nay: not to prevent a number of pension schemes relating to previously nationalised industries being amended following the introduction of the single state pension.

title: Pensions Bill - New Clause 8 - Review To Determine Pension Entitlements for Women Born on or After 6 April 1951
aye: for a review to determine whether all women born on or after 6 April 1951 should be included within the scope of new state pension arrangements to be established by the Pensions Bill.
nay: against a review to determine whether all women born on or after 6 April 1951 should be included within the scope of new state pension arrangements to be established by the Pensions Bill.

title: Pensions Bill - New Clause 11 - Require Direction to or Provision of Brokerage Service
aye: to require work based pension schemes to pass their clients onto, or provide, an annuity broker at the relevant time.
nay: against requiring work based pension schemes to pass their clients onto, or provide, an annuity broker at the relevant time.

title: Pensions Bill  - New Clause 1 - Public Register of Charges, Fees and Costs For Work Based Pension Schemes
aye: for a public register of charges, administration fees and relevant fund transaction costs applying to work based pension schemes.
nay: against a public register of charges, administration fees and relevant fund transaction costs applying to work based pension schemes.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Opposition Day - Northern Ireland - Abolition of Air Passenger Duty
aye: in favour of abolishing air passenger duty.
nay: in favour of air passenger duty.

title: Immigration Bill - Second Reading
aye: for a series of immigration measures including greater removal and enforcement powers, restrictions on the detention of children, the introduction of powers to levy an NHS charge on some of those seeking to enter the UK, and measures to prevent those not legally present in the UK renting properties and obtaining driving licenses.
nay: against a series of immigration measures including greater removal and enforcement powers, restrictions on the detention of children, the introduction of powers to levy an NHS charge on some of those seeking to enter the UK, and measures to prevent those not legally present in the UK renting properties and obtaining driving licenses.

title: House of Lords Reform (No. 2) Bill - Removing absentees and those convicted of a serious offence from the House of Lords
aye: to remove members of the House of Lords who have been convicted of a serious offence, or who have failed to attend for a period, and to allow members to retire or resign.
nay: against removing members of the House of Lords who have been convicted of a serious offence, or who have failed to attend for a period, and against allowing members to retire or resign.

title: Defence Reforms - Delay Disbandment of Regular Units Until Army Reserve Plan Shown to Be Viable
aye: in favour of delaying the disbandment of regular units until it is established that the Army Reserve plan is viable and cost-effective.
nay: against delaying the disbandment of regular units until it is established that the Army Reserve plan is viable and cost-effective.

title: European Union - Civil Aviation Safety - Working Hours Regulations for Crew
aye: to say proposed European regulations on working hours for the crew of commercial passenger planes would improve safety and help deliver a level playing-field across the EU.
nay: against saying proposed European regulations on working hours for the crew of commercial passenger planes would improve safety and help deliver a level playing-field across the EU.

title: Opposition Day - Localism - Powers Relating to High Streets and Town and City Centres
aye: to give more powers to local communities in relation to high streets and town and city centres.
nay: against giving more powers to local communities in relation to high streets and town and city centres.

title: Opposition Day - Zero-hours Contracts - Consultation and Call for Evidence
aye: for a consultation and call for evidence on the use of zero hours contracts.
nay: against a consultation and call for evidence on the use of zero hours contracts.

title: Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill - Schedule 8 - Abolition of Anti-Social Behaviour Orders
aye: against abolishing Anti-Social Behaviour Orders (ASBOs).
nay: to abolish Anti-Social Behaviour Orders (ASBOs).

title: Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill - New Clause 26 - New Offence of Assault on Workers in Public Facing Roles
aye: to introduce a new offence of assault on workers in public facing roles
nay: against introducing a new offence of assault on workers in public facing roles

title: Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill - New Clause 3 - Dog Control Notices
aye: to introduce Dog Control Notices and require the microchipping of certain dogs subject to such notices.
nay: against introducing Dog Control Notices and against requiring the microchipping of certain dogs subject to such notices.

title: Anti-Social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill - New Clause 4 - Additional Constraints on Firearms Licensing
aye: to introduce a presumption a firearms license ought be refused where there is substantiated evidence of violent conduct, domestic violence, mental illness or drug or alcohol abuse found in a background check on an applicant.
nay: against a presumption a firearms license ought be refused where there is substantiated evidence of violent conduct, domestic violence, mental illness or drug or alcohol abuse found in a background check on an applicant.

title: Anti-Social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Anti-Social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Anti-Social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Bill.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Third Reading
aye: to introduce a register of lobbyists, to increase regulation of campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, in general elections and to strengthen requirements on trade unions to maintain up to date membership lists.
nay: against introducing a register of lobbyists, against increasing regulation of campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, in general elections and against strengthening requirements on trade unions to maintain up to date membership lists.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 27 - Cap on Spending by 3rd Parties in Elections
aye: not to reduce the amount campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, are permitted to spend on elections, and not to reduce the spending threshold at which such campaigners are required to register.
nay: to reduce the amount campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, are permitted to spend on elections, and to reduce the spending threshold at which such campaigners are required to register.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 26 - Definition of Controlled Expenditure by Third Parties During Elections
aye: for lesser restrictions on the activities of campaigners who are not candidates or are not putting up candidates during elections.
nay: for more restrictions on the activities of campaigners who are not candidates or are not putting up candidates during elections.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - New Clause 4 - Code of Conduct for Registered Lobbyists
aye: for a code of conduct for registered lobbyists.
nay: against a code of conduct for registered lobbyists.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Timetable motion
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: London Local Authorities and Transport for London (No. 2) Bill  - Clause 19 - Introduction of the Offence of Unlawful Use of Charging Point
aye: to introduce an offence of using an electric vehicle charging point for a purpose other than charging a vehicle.
nay: against introducing an offence of using an electric vehicle charging point for a purpose other than charging a vehicle.

title: London Local Authorities and Transport for London (No. 2) Bill - Clause 15 - Offence of Operating or Interfering With Barriers on Roads
aye: against it being a specific offence to operate or interfere with a gate or other barrier installed on a highway by or on behalf of a traffic authority in London.
nay: for it to be a specific offence to operate or interfere with a gate or other barrier installed on a highway by or on behalf of a traffic authority in London.

title: London Local Authorities and Transport for London (No. 2) Bill - Clause 9 - Penalty Charges - Skips on London Highways
aye: to enable penalty charges to be imposed where an owner of a skip placed on a London highway "does not take any reasonable steps to secure that" various requirements for permissions, marking and lighting are adhered to rather than "does not secure that" the requirements are complied with.
nay: to enable penalty charges to be imposed where an owner of a skip placed on a London highway "does not secure that" various requirements for permissions, marking and lighting are adhered to rather than "does not take any reasonable steps to secure that" the requirements are complied with.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 37 - Duty to appoint an assurer etc
aye: to require an assurer of a Trade Union to report on a membership audit certificate if the union has taken all reasonable steps to ensure their membership register is up to date.
nay: not to require an assurer of a Trade Union to report on a membership audit certificate if the union has taken all reasonable steps to ensure their membership register is up to date.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 37 - Confidentiality and Data Protection Duties of Trade Union Assurer
aye: to give an assurer of a trade union a duty of confidentiality to the trade union and its members as well as a duty to abide by the trade union's obligations under the Data Protection Act.
nay: against giving an assurer of a trade union a duty of confidentiality to the trade union and its members as well as a duty to abide by the trade union's obligations under the Data Protection Act.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 36 - Provision of Union Membership Audit Certificates to Regulator
aye: for a register of the names and addresses of members of a trade union to be sent to the regulator, the Certification Officer, only in the event of a complaint rather than for each annual reporting period.
nay: for a register of the names and addresses of members of a trade union to be sent to the regulator, the Certification Officer, each annual reporting period and not only in the event of a complaint.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 28 - Constituency Limit on Third Party Spending
aye: to cap the amount a campaigner who is not a candidate or putting up candidates can spend in each individual constituency during an election period at £9,750.
nay: against capping the amount a campaigner who is not a candidate or putting up candidates can spend in each individual constituency during an election period at £9,750.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 27 - Cap on Spending by 3rd Parties in Elections
aye: to reduce the amount campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, are permitted to spend on elections, and to reduce the spending threshold at which such campaigners are required to register.
nay: not to reduce the amount campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, are permitted to spend on elections, and not to reduce the spending threshold at which such campaigners are required to register.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Schedule 3 - Types of Third Party Spending Restricted
aye: to regulate and restrict election related campaigning by those who are who are not candidates, or putting up candidates, when it involves spending on advertising and material delivered to households etc. but not when it involves informing people about their candidates or communicating with their own organisation's supporters.
nay: against regulating and restricting election related campaigning by those who are who are not candidates, or putting up candidates, when it involves spending on advertising and material delivered to households etc. but not when it involves informing people about their candidates or communicating with their own organisation's supporters.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 26 - Meaning of "controlled expenditure"
aye: to regulate and restrict all spending broadly connected with an election by those campaigning who are not candidates, or putting up candidates, with an exemption for communications with an organisation's own supporters.
nay: against regulating and restricting all spending broadly connected with an election by those campaigning who are not candidates, or putting up candidates, with an exemption for communications with an organisation's own supporters.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 2 - Scope of Register of Lobbyists
aye: to require the inclusion on the register of lobbyists of those who are paid to advise on lobbying, those who arrange meetings for lobbying, MPs, foreign government officials and representatives of international organisations
nay: not to require the inclusion on the register of lobbyists of those who are paid to advise on lobbying, those who arrange meetings for lobbying, MPs, foreign government officials and representatives of international organisations

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 1 - Personal Registration of Employed Lobbyists
aye: to require the personal registration of individuals employed as lobbyists even if their employer is registered.
nay: not to require the personal registration of individuals employed as lobbyists if their employer is registered.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Clause 1 - Registration of Lobbyists -  Wording of Professional or Consultant Lobbyists
aye: to refer to "consultant" rather than "professional" lobbyists in the law introducing a register of lobbyists.
nay: to refer to "professional" rather than "consultant" lobbyists in the law introducing a register of lobbyists.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Opposition Day - Living Standards - Energy Prices and Profits
aye: for reforms to the energy market; to create a new energy regulator and to put all over-75s on the cheapest tariff.
nay: against proposed reforms to the energy market; against creating a new energy regulator and against putting all over-75s on the cheapest tariff.

title: Opposition Day - Jobs - Capital Investment - Mansion Tax - Income Tax - Rail Fares - Energy Bills - Private Tenants - Pensions - Payday Loans - Banking, Planning and Skills Reforms
aye: to call on the government to get more people into work, bring forward capital investment, introduce a compulsory jobs guarantee, reintroduce a 10% rate of income tax paid for by a mansion tax, act on "rip off" rail fares and soaring energy costs, stand up for families in the private rented sector, reform pensions, curb payday lenders, and reform banking, planning and the skills system.
nay: against calling on the government to get more people into work, bring forward capital investment, introduce a compulsory jobs guarantee, reintroduce a 10% rate of income tax paid for by a mansion tax, act on "rip off" rail fares and soaring energy costs, stand up for families in the private rented sector, reform pensions, curb payday lenders, and reform banking, planning and the skills system.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Committal to Committee and Timetable
aye: to send the Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill for consideration in committee and to approve the proposed timetable for its consideration there.
nay: against sending the Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill for consideration in committee and against the proposed timetable for its consideration there.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Second Reading
aye: to introduce a register of lobbyists, to increase regulation of campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, in general elections and to strengthen requirements on trade unions to maintain up to date membership lists.
nay: against introducing a register of lobbyists, against increasing regulation of campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, in general elections and against strengthening requirements on trade unions to maintain up to date membership lists.

title: Transparency of Lobbying, Non-Party Campaigning and Trade Union Administration Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against introducing a register of lobbyists, against increasing regulation of campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, in general elections and against strengthening requirements on trade unions to maintain up to date membership lists.
nay: to introduce a register of lobbyists, to increase regulation of campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, in general elections and to strengthen requirements on trade unions to maintain up to date membership lists.

title: Syria and the Use of Chemical Weapons
aye: to agree a strong humanitarian response to the use of chemical weapons in Syria was required from the international community that may, if necessary, require military action.
nay: against a motion stating a strong humanitarian response to the use of chemical weapons in Syria was required from the international community that may, if necessary, require military action.

title: Syria and the Use of Chemical Weapons
aye: to require conditions be fulfilled, including a vote of the UN Security Council, before any military action involving UK forces in response to the use of chemical weapons in Syria.
nay: against requiring conditions be fulfilled, including a vote of the UN Security Council before any military action involving UK forces in response to the use of chemical weapons in Syria.

title: NHS - Government Actions
aye: to support the Government's actions in relation to the NHS
nay: not to support the Government's actions in relation to the NHS

title: Publication of NHS Transition Risk Register and Implementation of Key Francis Recommendations
aye: in favour of publishing the NHS transition risk register and in favour of acting on key recommendations from the Mid Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust Public Inquiry.
nay: against publishing the NHS transition risk register and against acting on key recommendations from the Mid Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust Public Inquiry.

title: Opposition Day - Ban MPs Holding Paid Directorships and Consultancies
aye: to ban MPs from holding paid directorships or consultancies.
nay: not to ban MPs from holding paid directorships or consultancies.

title: Civil Procedure Rules - Closed Material Proceedings
aye: in favour of rules implementing the introduction of "closed material proceedings" to courts; the procedure involves making material deemed national security-sensitive available to the court and a special advocate but not parties to the case.
nay: against rules implementing the introduction of "closed material proceedings" to courts; the procedure involves making material deemed national security-sensitive available to the court and a special advocate but not parties to the case.

title: The Rules of the Court of Judicature (Northern Ireland) (Amendment) 2013 - Closed Material Proceedure
aye: in favour of rules implementing the introduction of "closed material proceedings" to the civil courts in Northern Ireland; the procedure involves making material deemed national security-sensitive available to the court and a special advocate but not parties to the case.
nay: against rules implementing the introduction of "closed material proceedings" to the civil courts in Northern Ireland; the procedure involves making material deemed national security-sensitive available to the court and a special advocate but not parties to the case.

title: CCTV Code of Practice
aye: in favour of a proposed code of practice on the use of surveillance camera systems.
nay: against a proposed code of practice on the use of surveillance camera systems.

title: Draft Unfair Dismissal (Variation of the Limit of Compensatory Award) Order 2013 - Cap at Lower of a Year's Pay or £74,200
aye: to cap compensation for unfair dismissal at the lower of a year's pay or the overall cap, which at the time of the vote was £74,200.
nay: against capping compensation for unfair dismissal at the lower of a year's pay or the overall cap, which at the time of the vote was £74,200.

title: 2014 JHA Opt-out Decision - European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation and Training - Opt In
aye: to consider the views of the Association of Chief Police Officers when deciding when to opt into Europol's European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation and Training; and against making opting in conditional on Europol not being given the power to direct national law enforcement agencies to initiate investigations or share data that conflicts with national security.
nay: to opt into Europol's European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation and Training so long as Europol is not given the power to direct national law enforcement agencies to initiate investigations or share data that conflicts with national security; and against considering the views of the Association of Chief Police Officers when deciding when to opt in.

title: Opt Out from European Union Police and Criminal Justice Measures
aye: to opt out of all EU police and criminal justice measures adopted before December 2009
nay: against opting out of all EU police and criminal justice measures adopted before December 2009

title: Opt Out from European Union Police and Criminal Justice Measures
aye: for a commitment to continue participation in the European Arrest Warrant and other schemes when opting out of police and criminal justice measures.
nay: against committing to continue participation in the European Arrest Warrant and other schemes when opting out of police and criminal justice measures.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Parliamentary Consent for Lethal Support to Anti-Government Forced in Syria
aye: to require the explicit prior consent of Parliament before the provision of any lethal support to anti-government forces in Syria.
nay: against requiring the explicit prior consent of Parliament before the provision of any lethal support to anti-government forces in Syria.

title: Opposition Day - Assessment of Impact of Government Changes on Disabled People
aye: against an assessment of the cumulative impact of the changes made by the Government that affect disabled people.
nay: for an assessment of the cumulative impact of the changes made by the Government that affect disabled people.

title: Assessment of Impact of Government Changes on Disabled People
aye: for an assessment of the cumulative impact of the changes made by the Government that affect disabled people.
nay: against an assessment of the cumulative impact of the changes made by the Government that affect disabled people.

title: Draft Alternative Investment Fund Managers Regulations 2013 - Harmonisation of Regulatory Framework
aye: to put in place a harmonised regulatory framework for alternative investment funds not already within the scope of European regulation.
nay: against putting in place a harmonised regulatory framework for alternative investment funds not already within the scope of European regulation.

title: Northern Ireland (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill  - Clause 3 - Disqualification of Members of the House of Lords from Membership of Northern Ireland Assembly
aye: to disqualify members of the House of Lords from membership of the Northern Ireland Assembly.
nay: against disqualifying members of the House of Lords from membership of the Northern Ireland Assembly.

title: Northern Ireland (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill - Clause 1 - Transparancy of Political Donations - Start Date
aye: to allow ministers to order greater transparency in relation political donations in Northern Ireland, starting with those made after 1 January 2014, rather than as originally proposed, after 1 October 2014.
nay: against allowing ministers to order greater transparency in relation political donations in Northern Ireland, starting with those made after 1 January 2014, rather than as originally proposed, after 1 October 2014.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill - New Clause 10 - Sale of state-owned banking assets
aye: to require a report to be presented to Parliament before the decision to sell any state owned banking assets.
nay: against requiring a report to be presented to Parliament before the decision to sell any state owned banking assets.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill - New Clause 8 - Review Of Competitiveness of Those Providing Core Banking Services in the UK
aye: to require a study into competition between UK financial services institutions involved in the core services of accepting deposits, providing facilities to withdraw money and make payments and the provision of overdraft facilities.
nay: against requiring a study into competition between UK financial services institutions involved in the core services of accepting deposits, providing facilities to withdraw money and make payments and the provision of overdraft facilities.

title: Draft Public Bodies (Abolition of Administrative Justice and Tribunals Council) Order 2013
aye: to abolish the Administrative Justice and Tribunals Council
nay: against abolishing the Administrative Justice and Tribunals Council

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill - New Clause 4 - Duty of Care for Ring-Fenced Retail Banking Divisions
aye: to give ring-fenced retail banking elements of banking groups a duty of care towards their customers.
nay: against giving ring-fenced retail banking elements of banking groups a duty of care towards their customers.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill - New Clause 9 - Financial Sector - Target Ratio of Liabilities to Assets - Role of Bank of England
aye: to require the Treasury to set a target for the overall ratio of liabilities to assets in the UK financial system and to require the Bank of England to report on action taken to meet the target.
nay: against requiring the Treasury to set a target for the overall ratio of liabilities to assets in the UK financial system and to require the Bank of England to report on action taken to meet the target.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill - Clause 4 - Full Separation of Ring-Fenced Retail Banking Activities
aye: to require retail banking divisions to be completely separated from other bodies, such as investment banks, within five years.
nay: against requiring retail banking divisions to be completely separated from other bodies, such as investment banks, within five years.

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Second Reading
aye: in favour of a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU
nay: against holding a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU

title: European Union (Referendum) Bill - Closure Motion
aye: in favour of stopping debate and moving to a vote on proposals for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU.
nay: to continue debating if there ought be a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU rather than moving straight to a vote on the matter.

title: Finance Bill - Third Reading
aye: to introduce a general anti-abuse rule to tackle abusive tax avoidance, to raise the basic income tax free allowance, and to support other tax changes proposed in the Finance Bill.
nay: against introducing a general anti-abuse rule to tackle abusive tax avoidance, to raise the basic income tax free allowance, and to support other tax changes proposed in the Finance Bill.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 11 - Stamp Duty Reserve Tax on Surrenders of Units in Unit Trusts
aye: to require a report on the abolition of Stamp Duty Reserve Tax on surrenders of units in collective investment schemes.
nay: against requiring a report on the abolition of Stamp Duty Reserve Tax on surrenders of units in collective investment schemes.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 38 - Real Estate Investment Trusts
aye: to require a report on the operation of Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) to include consideration of the Government's support for house building, including through the tax system.
nay: against requiring a report on the operation of Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) to include consideration of the Government's support for house building, including through the tax system.

title: Finance Bill  - New Clause - Report of Impact the Finance Act and Spending Round 2013 on Revenue
aye: to require a report on the impact on revenue of the Finance Act and Spending Round 2013
nay: against requiring a report on the impact on revenue of the Finance Act and Spending Round 2013

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 12 - International Tax Transparency for Multi-National Companies
aye: for a review of the potential for new internationally co-ordinated laws requiring greater transparency on how much tax multi-national companies pay to the UK and other countries.
nay: against requiring a review of the potential for new internationally co-ordinated laws requiring greater transparency on how much tax multi-national companies pay to the UK and other countries.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 9 - Reintroduce 10% Initial Rate of Income Tax
aye: to reintroduce a 10% initial rate of income tax paid for by a new property tax.
nay: against the reintroduction of a 10% initial rate of income tax paid for by a new property tax.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 1 - Report on Impact of Additional Rate of Income Tax for Income Over £150,000
aye: to require the production of report on the impact of changing the additional rate of income tax.
nay: against the production of a report on the impact of changing the additional rate of income tax.

title: High Speed Rail (Preparation) Bill - Second Reading
aye: to approve spending money on preparations for a high speed rail network connecting at least London, Birmingham, the East Midlands, Sheffield, Leeds, and Manchester.
nay: against spending money on preparations for a high speed rail network connecting at least London, Birmingham, the East Midlands, Sheffield, Leeds, and Manchester.

title: High Speed Rail (Preparation) Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against spending money on preparations for a high speed rail network connecting at least London, Birmingham, the East Midlands, Sheffield, Leeds, and Manchester.
nay: to approve spending money on preparations for a high speed rail network connecting at least London, Birmingham, the East Midlands, Sheffield, Leeds, and Manchester.

title: Draft Town and Country Planning (Fees for Applications, Deemed Applications, Requests and Site Visits) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
aye: for a set of changes to planning regulations primarily aimed at ensuring quicker and better decisions on planning applications.
nay: against a set of changes to planning regulations primarily aimed at ensuring quicker and better decisions on planning applications.

title: Opposition Day - Statutory Register of Lobbyists
aye: for the introduction of a statutory register for all professional lobbyists.
nay: for the introduction of a statutory register for all professional lobbyists.

title: Opposition Day - Statutory Register of Lobbyists
aye: for the introduction of a statutory register for all professional lobbyists.
nay: against the introduction of a statutory register for all professional lobbyists.

title: Opposition Day - Strategy for the Arts and Creative Industries
aye: against actively supporting the arts by developing a strategy for the arts and creative industries.
nay: to actively support the arts by developing a strategy for the arts and creative industries.

title: Opposition Day - Strategy for the Arts and Creative Industries
aye: to actively support the arts by developing a strategy for the arts and creative industries.
nay: against actively supporting the arts by developing a strategy for the arts and creative industries.

title: Principle of Financial Transaction Tax
aye: to support the principle of the Financial Transaction Tax.
nay: against the principle of the Financial Transaction Tax.

title: Opposition Day - European Arrest Warrant
aye: in favour of the UK remaining part of the European Arrest Warrant system but seeking to improve its operation.
nay: against the UK remaining part of the European Arrest Warrant system but seeking to improve its operation.

title: Opposition Day - Protecting Children Online
aye: to require safe search to be a default setting and requiring effective age verification online.
nay: against requiring safe search to be a default setting and against requiring effective age verification online.

title: Draft Employment Tribunals and the Employment Appeal Tribunal Fees Order 2013
aye: to introduce fees for an employment tribunal claim, or an appeal to the Employment Appeal Tribunal.
nay: against introducing fees for an employment tribunal claim, or an appeal to the Employment Appeal Tribunal.

title: Children and Families Bill - New Clause 20 - Personal Social and Health Education in State Funded Schools
aye: to require state funded schools to teach personal, social and health education, including sex and relationship education, including information about same-sex relationships, sexual violence, domestic violence and sexual consent.
nay: against requiring state funded schools to teach personal, social and health education, including sex and relationship education, including information about same-sex relationships, sexual violence, domestic violence and sexual consent.

title: Children and Families Bill - New Clause 6 - Staff to Child Ratios for Ofsted-Registered Childminding Establishments
aye: to generally permit each registered childminder to care for more children at a time.
nay: against permitting each registered childminder to care for more children at a time.

title: Increase Social Care Spending - Ensure Adequate Staffing in Hospitals
aye: to spend £1.2 billion to support social care in 2013-14 and 2014-15 paid for by a 2012-13 Department of Health underspend and to ensure adequate staffing levels at every hospital in England.
nay: against spending £1.2 billion to support social care in 2013-14 and 2014-15 paid for by a 2012-13 Department of Health underspend and against ensuring adequate staffing levels at every hospital in England.

title: Opposition Day - Badger Cull
aye: in favour of culling badgers in an effort to control bovine tuberculosis.
nay: against culling badgers in an effort to control bovine tuberculosis.

title: Opposition Day - Badger Cull
aye: against the proposed badger cull.
nay: for the proposed badger cull.

title: Energy Bill - Third Reading
aye: to reform the energy market with regard to reducing carbon dioxide emissions, securing supply, affordability for consumers and increasing generation from renewable sources.
nay: against reforming the energy market with regard to reducing carbon dioxide emissions, securing supply, affordability for consumers and increasing generation from renewable sources.

title: Energy Bill - Clause 10 - Financial Incentives for Larger Small Scale Low Carbon Generation Plants
aye: to allow financial incentives for small-scale low-carbon generation of electricity to be paid to plants which were previously too big to be eligible.
nay: against allowing financial incentives for small-scale low-carbon generation of electricity to be paid to plants which were previously too big to be eligible.

title: Energy Bill - Clause 1 - Requirement to Set a Decarbonisation Target Range
aye: to require the setting of a target range for the amount of carbon dioxide (or other greenhouse gases) produced per unit of electricity generated.
nay: against requiring the setting of a target range for the amount of carbon dioxide (or other greenhouse gases) produced per unit of electricity generated.

title: Communities and Local Government - Schedule 14 - Removal of Cap on Consumer Redress Order Payments
aye: to remove the cap on payments under "consumer redress orders" (set at 10% of an energy company's turnover) if one or more consumers suffer loss or damage greater than this value.
nay: against removing the cap on payments under "consumer redress orders" (set at 10% of an energy company's turnover) if one or more consumers suffer loss or damage greater than this value.

title: Energy Bill  - Schedule 14 - Make Consumer Redress Orders Retrospective
aye: to make a new law requiring energy companies provide redress to consumers who suffer as a result of breaches of regulatory requirements apply to breaches which occurred prior to the law coming into force.
nay: against making a new law requiring energy companies provide redress to consumers who suffer as a result of breaches of regulatory requirements apply to breaches which occurred prior to the law coming into force.

title: Energy Bill - Schedule 2 - Investment Contracts - Withholding Material from Parliament
aye: to limit material omitted from contracts under which subsidies are paid to electricity generators when they are put before Parliament to just trade secrets, rather than requiring any information the contract itself says must not be disclosed be omitted.
nay: to reject a proposal to limit material omitted from contracts under which subsidies are paid to electricity generators when they are put before Parliament to just trade secrets, preferring instead that any information the contract itself says must not be disclosed be omitted.

title: Energy Bill- Clause 42 - Exemption from Carbon Dioxide Emission Limits During Commissioning of Electricity Generation Plants Using Carbon Capture and Storage
aye: to exempt electricity generation plants using carbon capture and storage technology from annual carbon dioxide emissions limits during a commissioning and proving period of up to three years.
nay: not to exempt electricity generation plants using carbon capture and storage technology from annual carbon dioxide emissions limits during a commissioning and proving period of up to three years.

title: Energy Bill - Clause 11 - Subsidy of Nuclear Power Generation
aye: to require nuclear power subsidies be less than subsidies for generating electricity from renewable sources.
nay: not to require nuclear power subsidies be less than subsidies for generating electricity from renewable sources.

title: Energy Bill - New Clause 5 - Expert Panel To Advise Secretary of State On Using Powers to Regulate Energy Markets
aye: to establish an expert panel to advise the Secretary of State on the use of powers to regulate the energy markets.
nay: against establishing an expert panel to advise the Secretary of State on the use of powers to regulate the energy markets.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill - Third Reading
aye: in favour of allowing same sex couples to marry.
nay: against allowing same sex couples to marry.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill  - New Clause 16 - Review Civil Partnerships Following Introduction of Same-Sex Marriage
aye: for a review of the operation and future of civil partnerships following the introduction of same sex marriages.
nay: against a review of the operation and future of civil partnerships following the introduction of same sex marriages.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill - New Clause 8 - Domestic protection for persons
aye: to strengthen protections for those not wishing to conduct or participate in a religious marriage ceremony due to it being a marriage of a same sex couple.
nay: against strengthening protections for those not wishing to conduct or participate in a religious marriage ceremony due to it being a marriage of a same sex couple.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill - New Clause 6 - Protection of Beliefs About Marriage
aye: to make discrimination on the basis of an individual's beliefs regarding the definition of marriage illegal.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill - New Clause 3 - Conscientious Objection From Registrars to Marrying Same Sex Couples
aye: to allow registrars not to carry out same sex marriages if they object to them on the basis of sincerely held religious or other beliefs.
nay: to require registrars to carry out same sex marriages even if they object to them on the basis of sincerely held religious or other beliefs.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill - New Clause 10 - Civil Partnerships for All Couples
aye: to make Civil Partnerships available to all couples, rather than just same sex couples.
nay: against making Civil Partnerships available to all couples, rather than just same sex couples.

title: Queen's Speech - Note of Thanks
aye: to send the Queen a proposed note of thanks for attending Parliament to read out the Government's proposed programme of legislation.
nay: against sending the Queen a proposed note of thanks for attending Parliament to read out the Government's proposed programme of legislation.

title: Queen's Speech - Devolution of Tax Raising and Borrowing Powers to the Welsh Government
aye: in favour of devolving tax raising, and borrowing, powers to the Welsh Government.
nay: against devolving tax raising, and borrowing, powers to the Welsh Government.

title: Queen's Speech - EU Referendum
aye: to express regret that the Government had not included proposals for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU in their legislative programme.
nay: not to express regret that the Government had not included proposals for a referendum on the UK's membership of the EU in their legislative programme.

title: Queens' Speech - Economic Growth
aye: in favour of a package of economic policies including bringing forward long-term infrastructure investment, building 100,000 affordable homes, and guaranteeing jobs for the long term unemployed.
nay: against a package of economic policies including bringing forward long-term infrastructure investment, building 100,000 affordable homes, and guaranteeing jobs for the long term unemployed.

title: Cost of Living
aye: to call on the Government to take real action on jobs, affordable accommodation, rising energy and water bills, the costs of travel to work.
nay: against calling on the Government to take real action on jobs, affordable accommodation, rising energy and water bills, the costs of travel to work.

title: European Union Documents - Single European Railyway Area
aye: to seek to ensure that measures relating to the single European railway area are appropriate, encourage fair competition and are evidence-based, proportionate and have minimal regulatory burden.
nay: against seeking to ensure measures relating to the single European railway area are appropriate, encourage fair competition and are evidence-based, proportionate and have minimal regulatory burden.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill - Employee Shareholder Scheme Safeguards
aye: for safeguards requiring those entering a employee shareholder scheme to receive independent advice paid for by the employer at least seven days before the agreement to enter the scheme is made.
nay: against safeguards requiring those entering a employee shareholder scheme to receive independent advice paid for by the employer at least seven days before the agreement to enter the scheme is made.

title: Abolition of the Agricultural Wages Board
aye: against abolishing the Agricultural Wages Board.
nay: in favour of abolishing the Agricultural Wages Board.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill  - Employee Shareholder Status - Exemption from Certain Statutory Employment Rights
aye: to exempt those with employee shareholder status from certain statutory employment rights.
nay: against exempting  those with employee shareholder status from certain statutory employment rights.

title: Government assessment of medium term economic and budgetary position for submission to the European Commission
aye: to approve the Government's assessment of the UK's medium term economic and budgetary position for submission to the European Commission.
nay: not to approve the Government's assessment of the UK's medium term economic and budgetary position for submission to the European Commission.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - Schedule 1 - Pension Age for Members of the Ministry of Defence Police
aye: against setting the pension age for members of the Ministry of Defence Police at 60, in line with other members of a police force.
nay: to set the pension age for members of the Ministry of Defence Police at 60, in line with other members of a police force.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - Schedule 1 - Pension Age for Defence Fire and Rescue Service Firefighters
aye: against setting the pension age for Defence Fire and Rescue Service firefighters at 60, in line with firefighters in regional fire services.
nay: to set the pension age for Defence Fire and Rescue Service firefighters at 60, in line with firefighters in regional fire services.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 183 - Air passenger duty: rates of duty from 1 April 2013
aye: to increase Air Passenger Duty
nay: against increasing Air Passenger Duty

title: Finance Bill - New Schedule  - Devolution of Air Passenger Duty to Wales
aye: to devolve responsibility for setting the rate of Air Passenger Duty for long haul flights originating in Wales to the National Assembly for Wales.
nay: against devolving responsibility for setting the rate of Air Passenger Duty for long haul flights originating in Wales to the National Assembly for Wales.

title: Finance Bill - Part 2 - Devolution of Wales Long Haul Rates of Duty
aye: to devolve responsibility for setting the rate of Air Passenger Duty for long haul flights originating in Wales to the National Assembly for Wales.
nay: against devolving responsibility for setting the rate of Air Passenger Duty for long haul flights originating in Wales to the National Assembly for Wales.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 3 - Report on Impact of Taxation Changes on Living Standards of Basic Rate Taxpayers
aye: for a report on the impact of taxation changes on the living standards of basic rate taxpayers.
nay: against requiring a report on the impact of taxation changes on the living standards of basic rate taxpayers.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 2 - Rate of VAT
aye: to reduce VAT from 20% to 17.5%
nay: against reducing VAT from 20% to 17.5%

title: Finance Bill - Clause 1 - Report on Impact of Additional Rate of Income Tax for Income Over £150,000
aye: to require a report on the impact of changing the additional rate of income tax, which applies to income over £150,000.
nay: against requiring a report on impact of changing the additional rate of income tax, which applies to income over £150,000.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 7 - Review of Anti-Tax Avoidance General Anti-Abuse Rule
aye: to require a post-implementation review of the general anti-abuse rule aimed at tackling tax avoidance.
nay: not to require a post-implementation review of the general anti-abuse rule aimed at tackling tax avoidance.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 203 - Use of Tax Schemes Which Impact Developing Countries by UK Companies
aye: for action relating to UK companies avoiding paying tax in developing countries.
nay: against action relating to UK companies avoiding paying tax in developing countries.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 200 - Tax on Bankers' Bonuses
aye: for consideration of a new tax on bankers' bonuses.
nay: against consideration of a new tax on bankers' bonuses.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 5 - Mansion tax
aye: in favour of considering a mansion tax
nay: against considering a mansion tax

title: Delay Start of House of Commons Sitting - Cancel Prime Minister's Questions - Funeral of Margaret Thatcher
aye: to delay the start of the House of Commons sitting on Wednesday the 17th of April 2013 for the funeral of ex Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher.
nay: against delaying the start of the House of Commons sitting on Wednesday the 17th of April 2013 for the funeral of ex Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher.

title: Defamation Bill -  Recognised Arbitration Services for Defamation Cases - Incentives
aye: not to introduce certified arbitration services for defamation cases and to provide incentives for using them.
nay: to introduce certified arbitration services for defamation cases and to provide incentives for using them.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 61 - Employer Liability for Breaches of Health and Safety Regulations
aye: to make employers only liable for negligent breaches of health and safety regulations rather than all breaches of health and safety regulations.
nay: against making employers only liable for negligent breaches of health and safety regulations rather than all breaches of health and safety regulations.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Discrimination on the Basis of Caste
aye: to make it illegal to discriminate on the basis of caste
nay: against making it illegal to discriminate on the basis of caste

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 56 - Commission for Equality and Human Rights
aye: to reduce the responsibilities of the Commission for Equality and Human Rights, focusing them on more specific, rather than general, duties.
nay: against reducing the responsibilities of the Commission for Equality and Human Rights, focusing them on more specific, rather than general, duties.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 56 - Commission for Equality and Human Rights
aye: in favour of the Commission for Equality and Human Rights working to support the development of a society where people's ability to achieve their potential is not limited by prejudice or discrimination and there is respect for human rights.
nay: against the Commission for Equality and Human Rights working to support the development of a society where people's ability to achieve their potential is not limited by prejudice or discrimination and there is respect for human rights.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for consideration of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for consideration of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill  - Development orders: development within the curtilage of a dwelling house
aye: against giving local councils the power to remove householders' permitted development rights.
nay: to give local councils the power to remove householders' permitted development rights.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill - Employee Shareholder Status
aye: to permit employers not to extend certain otherwise statutory rights to employees with a new employee shareholder status.
nay: against permitting employers not to extend certain otherwise statutory rights to employees with a new employee shareholder status.

title: Finance Bill 2013 - Second Reading
aye: to introduce a general anti-abuse rule to tackle abusive tax avoidance, to raise the basic income tax free allowance, and to support other tax changes proposed in the Finance Bill.
nay: against introducing a general anti-abuse rule to tackle abusive tax avoidance, to raise the basic income tax free allowance, and to support other tax changes proposed in the Finance Bill.

title: Draft Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992 (Amendment) Order 2013 - Minimum Consultation and Notice Period for Large Scale Collective Redundancies
aye: to reduce the minimum consultation and notice periods for large scale collective redundancies.
nay: against reducing the minimum consultation and notice periods for large scale collective redundancies.

title: Budget Resolutions - Air Passenger Duty Rates from 1 April 2013
aye: to increase rates of Air Passenger Duty
nay: against increasing rates of Air Passenger Duty

title: Budget Resolution - 31 - Employee Shareholder Scheme Tax Exemptions
aye: for tax exemptions to encourage the use of the scheme where employers are permitted not to extend certain otherwise statutory rights to those with employee shareholder status.
nay: against tax exemptions to encourage the use of the scheme where employers are permitted not to extend certain otherwise statutory rights to those with employee shareholder status.

title: Income Tax for 2013-14
aye: to levy an income tax during the tax year 2013-14.
nay: against levying an income tax during the tax year 2013-14.

title: March 2013 Budget
aye: to set a budget for 2013-14 involving raising £612bn and spending £720bn; continuing to reduce corporation tax, introducing a scheme to help people buy homes worth up to £600,000 and to increase the personal income tax allowance for those of working age.
nay: against the proposed budget for 2013-14 which proposed raising £612bn and spending £720bn; continuing to reduce corporation tax, introducing a scheme to help people buy homes worth up to £600,000 and to increase the personal income tax allowance for those of working age.

title: Jobseekers (Back to Work Schemes) Bill - Third Reading
aye: to retrospectively replace regulations relating to schemes for helping people obtain employment which those claiming Jobseekers Allowance can be required to take part in after a court ruled the previous regulations defective.
nay: against retrospectively replacing regulations relating to schemes for helping people obtain employment which those claiming Jobseekers Allowance can be required to take part in after a court ruled the previous regulations defective.

title: Jobseekers (Back to Work Schemes) Bill - Second Reading
aye: to retrospectively replace regulations relating to schemes for helping people obtain employment which those claiming Jobseekers Allowance can be required to take part in after a court ruled the previous regulations defective.
nay: against retrospectively replacing regulations relating to schemes for helping people obtain employment which those claiming Jobseekers Allowance can be required to take part in after a court ruled the previous regulations defective.

title: Crime and Courts Bill - Clause 24 - Protect Basic Level of Subsistance When Setting Installement Levels for Paying Fines
aye: to require courts to protect a reasonable financial subsistence level for an individual when setting schedules for the payment of fines by installments.
nay: not to require courts to protect a reasonable financial subsistence level for an individual when setting schedules for the payment of fines by installments.

title: Crime and Courts Bill - New Clause 21A - Press Regulation - Exemplary Damages
aye: to prevent the courts awarding exemplary damages against relevant publishers who are members of an effective approved press regulator; incentivising participation in the regulatory regime.
nay: against preventing the courts awarding exemplary damages against relevant publishers who are members of an effective approved press regulator; against incentivising participation in the regulatory regime.

title: Crime and Courts Bill - Programme Amendment
aye: to approve a proposed amended timetable for the consideration of the Crime and Courts Bill.
nay: against a proposed amended timetable for the consideration of the Crime and Courts Bill.

title: Motion to Sit In Private
aye: for the House of Commons to enter a private session.
nay: against the House of Commons entering a private session.

title: Crime and Courts Bill - New Clause 7 - Allow Complaints About Baliffs to Be Taken to Ombudsman
aye: to allow complaints about baliffs to be taken to the Office for Legal Complaints' Legal Ombudsman.
nay: against allowing complaints about baliffs to be taken to the Office for Legal Complaints' Legal Ombudsman.

title: Crime and Courts Bill - Schedule 13 - Diversity of Judicial appointments
aye: to require, so far as is reasonably practicable, the diversity of those appointed to judicial office be reflective of the community.
nay: against requiring, so far as is reasonably practicable,  the diversity of those appointed to judicial office be reflective of the community.

title: Crime and Courts Bill - Clause 12 - National Crime Agency - No Strike Provisions
aye: against a ban on anyone, for example a trade union, from calling a strike at the National Crime Agency and against allowing the Home Secretary to seek an injunction to stop any threatened strike.
nay: for a ban on anyone, for example a trade union, from calling a strike at the National Crime Agency and allowing the Home Secretary to seek an injunction to stop any threatened strike.

title: Crime and Courts Bill - New Clause 3 - Modification of NCA functions
aye: to allow the Home Secretary to confer counter-terrorism functions on the National Crime Agency and remove or modify those functions.
nay: against allowing the Home Secretary to confer counter-terrorism functions on the National Crime Agency and remove or modify those functions.

title: European Union - Renewable Sources of Fuel for Machinery, Tractors and Recreational Craft.
aye: to require those supplying fuels to a wider range of users, including mobile machinery, tractors and recreational craft when not at sea, to demonstrate a certain percentage of fuel comes from renewable sources.
nay: against requiring those supplying fuels to a wider range of users, including mobile machinery, tractors and recreational craft when not at sea, to demonstrate a certain percentage of fuel comes from renewable sources.

title: Draft Tax Credits Up-rating, etc. Regulations 2013 - Rates of Child Tax Credit and the Working Tax Credit
aye: to set various monetary elements and thresholds related to the rates of Child Tax Credit and the Working Tax Credit.
nay: against setting various monetary elements and thresholds related to the rates of Child Tax Credit and the Working Tax Credit.

title: Draft Non-Domestic Rating (Levy and Safety Net) Regulations 2013 - Smoothing Business Rate Income For Local Councils
aye: for a levy and safety net system to dampen the impact of year to year volatility in business rate income for local councils.
nay: against a levy and safety net system to dampen the impact of year to year volatility in business rate income for local councils.

title: Conditional Fee Agreements Order 2013 - Caps on No-Win No-Fee Success Fees
aye: to cap success fees in no-win no-fee cases at 100% of the lawyer's basic fee, and to additionally set a further cap of 25% of damages awarded in personal injury cases.
nay: against capping success fees in no-win no-fee cases at 100% of the lawyer's basic fee, and against additionally setting a further cap of 25% of damages awarded in personal injury cases.

title: Opposition Day - Require Larger Public Sector Contractors to Offer Apprenticeships
aye: to require firms winning public contracts worth over £1m to offer apprenticeships.
nay: against requiring firms winning public contracts worth over £1m to offer apprenticeships.

title: Opposition Day - Tax Fairness
aye: to note a number of elements of the Coalition Government's tax policies.
nay: against noting a number of elements of the Coalition Government's tax policies.

title: Opposition Day - Tax Fairness - Tax on Properties Worth over £2m to Fund Tax Cut for Those on Middle and Low Incomes
aye: for a tax on properties worth over £2 million to fund a tax cut for those on middle and low incomes.
nay: against a tax on properties worth over £2 million to fund a tax cut for those on middle and low incomes.

title: Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Financial Services (Banking Reform) Bill.

title: Justice and Security Bill - Third Reading
aye: to allow material deemed national security-sensitive to be made available to a civil court and a special advocate but not parties to the case; to strengthen oversight of intelligence and security activities in Government; and to permit intercept evidence in closed proceedings in employment cases before tribunals.
nay: against allowing material deemed national security-sensitive to be made available to a civil court and a special advocate but not parties to the case; against strengthening oversight of intelligence and security activities in Government; and against permitting intercept evidence in closed proceedings in employment cases before tribunals.

title: Justice and Security Bill - Clause 2 - Intelligence and Security Committee - Consideration of Prospective New Agency Heads
aye: for Parliament's Intelligence and Security Committee to consider the proposed appointments of new heads of MI5, MI6 and GCHQ, including by questioning the prospective appointees and potentially holding hearings in public.
nay: against Parliament's Intelligence and Security Committee considering the proposed appointments of new heads of MI5, MI6 and GCHQ, including by questioning the prospective appointees and potentially holding hearings in public.

title: Hold Extra Sitting Day on Wednesday Rather than Friday
aye: for the House of Commons to have an extra sitting day to allow for a four day budget debate on a Wednesday rather than a Friday, consequently resulting in an additional Prime Minister's questions.
nay: against the House of Commons holding an extra sitting day to allow for a four day budget debate on a Wednesday rather than a Friday, consequently avoiding in an additional Prime Minister's questions.

title: House of Commons Sitting on Friday 22 March 2013
aye: for the House of Commons to sit on Friday 22 March 2013 to enable a four day budget debate before a planned commons recess.
nay: against the House of Commons to sit on Friday 22 March 2013 to enable a four day budget debate before a planned commons recess.

title: Suspension of Standing Orders to Enable Vote on House of Commons Sitting for an Extra Friday
aye: to enable a vote on if the Commons should sit on Friday the 22nd of March 2013 to be held on the evening of 6th of March rather than being deferred until Wednesday 13th of March as the Standing Orders required.
nay: against enabling a vote on if the Commons should sit on Friday the 22nd of March 2013 to be held on the evening of 6th of March rather than being deferred until Wednesday 13th of March as the Standing Orders required.

title: Justice and Security Bill - Clause 8 - Balance National Security vs Public Interest in Requests to Withhold Information From Parties in Civil Court Cases
aye: to allow the disclosure of material if the court considers disclosure the degree of damage to the interests of national security would be outweighed by the interests of justice.
nay: to prevent the disclosure of material if the court considers disclosure would be damaging to the interests of national security, even if that damage would be outweighed by the interests of justice.

title: Justice and Security Bill - New Clause 4 - Closed Material Procedure - Expiry of Provisions Unless Renewed
aye: to make the closed material procedure for introducing national security sensitive information to courts, but not making it available to the parties and their representatives, expire after a year unless it is actively renewed.
nay: against making the closed material procedure for introducing national security sensitive information to courts, but not making it available to the parties and their representatives, expire after a year unless it is actively renewed.

title: Justice and Security Bill - Clause 6 - Balance Interests of Justice With Harm to National Security - Closed Material Proceedings
aye: to only allow the closed material procedure for using national security sensitive information in court to to be used where the degree of harm to national security caused by disclosure would be likely to outweigh the public interest in fair and open justice.
nay: against allowing the closed material procedure for using national security sensitive information in court to only be used where the degree of harm to national security caused by disclosure would be likely to outweigh the public interest in fair and open justice.

title: Justice and Security Bill - Clause 6 - Closed Material Proceedings Only If Fair Determination Not Possible By Other Means
aye: to permit closed material proceedings only if a fair determination of the case would not be possible by other means.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Opposition Day - Housing Benefit (Under-occupancy Penalty)
aye: against a housing benefit under-occupancy penalty.
nay: in favour of a housing benefit under-occupancy penalty.

title: Groceries Code Adjudicator Bill - Clause 14 - Annual Report - Details of Actual or Potential Compromised Food Safety, Hygine or Authenticity
aye: to require the Groceries Code Adjudicator to report on cases which have come to their attention of actual, or potential, compromised food safety, hygiene or authenticity in their annual report.
nay: against requiring the Groceries Code Adjudicator to report on cases which have come to their attention of actual, or potential, compromised food safety, hygiene or authenticity in their annual report.

title: Groceries Code Adjudicator Bill - Clause 13 - Recommendations to Office of Fair Trading
aye: to require the Office of Fair Trading to publish a response to any recommendations for changes to the Groceries Code proposed by the Groceries Code Adjudicator
nay: against requiring the Office of Fair Trading to publish a response to any recommendations for changes to the Groceries Code proposed by the Groceries Code Adjudicator.

title: Groceries Code Adjudicator Bill - New Clause 2 - Preculde Referals to Adjudicator Relating to Suppliers With a Billion Pound or Greater Turnover
aye: to prevent cases of breaches of the Groceries Code involving suppliers with a turnover in excess of a billion pounds a year being referred to the Groceries Code Adjudicator.
nay: against preventing cases of breaches of the Groceries Code involving suppliers with a turnover in excess of a billion pounds a year being referred to the Groceries Code Adjudicator.

title: Local Government Finance Settlement 2013-14 (England)
aye: to approve the amounts of Revenue Support Grant proposed by Secretary of State for Communities and Local Government to pay to local councils in 2013-14
nay: against approving the amounts of Revenue Support Grant proposed by Secretary of State for Communities and Local Government to pay to local councils in 2013-14

title: Police Grant Report 2013-14
aye: to approve police funding proposals for 2013-14
nay: against police funding proposals for 2013-14

title: Draft Universal Credit (Transitional Provisions) Regulations 2013 - Universal Credit Pilots
aye: to enable pilot schemes to test processes and systems for the introduction of universal credit.
nay: not to enable pilot schemes to test processes and systems for the introduction of universal credit.

title: Draft Social Security (Personal Independence Payment) Regulations 2013
aye: to approve the detailed rules and entitlement conditions for the Personal Independence Payment.
nay: against proposed detailed rules and entitlement conditions for the Personal Independence Payment.

title: Opposition Day - Bring Forward Infrastructure Investment Including New Homes
aye: to bring forward infrastructure investment including building thousands more affordable homes.
nay: against bringing forward infrastructure investment including building thousands more affordable homes.

title: Opposition Day - Horsemeat
aye: to ensure police and fraud specialists investigate the criminal networks involved in horsemeat adulteration; to speed up offical meat tests; and for new testing, labelling and traceability standards for the meat industry.
nay: against ensuring police and fraud specialists investigate the criminal networks involved in horsemeat adulteration; against speeding up offical meat tests; and against new testing, labelling and traceability standards for the meat industry.

title: Canterbury City Council Bill - Put Information on Street Trading Regulation on Website - Ensure Officers Using Powers Adequately Trained
aye: to require Canterbury City Council to put information on its website about its powers and policies relating to the regulation of street trading and to require the council to ensure officers exercising powers under the Canterbury City Council Act are adequately trained.
