nay: against requiring Canterbury City Council to put information on its website about its powers and policies relating to the regulation of street trading and against requiring the council to ensure officers exercising powers under the Canterbury City Council Act are adequately trained.

title: Canterbury City Council Bill - Clause 4 - Include Provision of Services In Activities Subject to Street Trading Regulations
aye: to extend the power to regulate street trading to be given to Canterbury City Council to include those supplying or offering services on the streets.
nay: against extending the power to regulate street trading to be given to Canterbury City Council to include those supplying or offering services on the streets.

title: Canterbury City Council Bill - Clause 2 - Removal of Definitions
aye: to remove definitions for the terms: equipment; perishable item; the police; proper officer and receptacle from the Canterbury City Council Bill.
nay: against removing definitions for the terms: equipment; perishable item; the police; proper officer and receptacle from the Canterbury City Council Bill.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill - (Carry-over)
aye: in favour of allowing same sex couples to marry.
nay: against allowing same sex couples to marry.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill (Money)
aye: in favour of allowing same sex couples to marry.
nay: against allowing same sex couples to marry.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill (Programme)
aye: to approve a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill.
nay: against approving a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill.

title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill - Second Reading
aye: in favour of allowing same sex couples to marry.
nay: against allowing same sex couples to marry.

title: Canterbury City Council Bill - Clause 2 - Definition of Comunity Support Officer in Canterbury City Council Bill
aye: for making it clear only Kent community support officers to be empowered to issue Fixed Penalty Notices in relation to street trading offences covered by the Canterbury City Council Bill including those related to the supplying of or offering to supply any service in a street for gain or reward.
nay: against making it clear only Kent community support officers to be empowered to issue Fixed Penalty Notices in relation to street trading offences covered by the Canterbury City Council Bill including those related to the supplying of or offering to supply any service in a street for gain or reward.

title: Canterbury City Council Bill - Clause 2 - Remove Definition of Chief Constable From The Bill
aye: to remove the definition of the chief constable as meaning the Chief Constable of the Kent police force from the Canterbury City Council Bill.
nay: against removing the definition of the chief constable as meaning the Chief Constable of the Kent police force from the Canterbury City Council Bill.

title: Canterbury City Council Bill - Clause 2 - Training for Street Trading Enforcement Officers
aye: to require officers enforcing street trading laws covering offering services be required be adequately trained in the use of their powers.
nay: against requiring officers enforcing street trading laws covering offering services be required be adequately trained in the use of their powers.

title: Canterbury City Council Bill - Close Debate on Requirement for Street Trading Enforcement Officers to be Trained
aye: to conclude their debate on if officers enforcing street trading laws covering offering services should be required be trained and move to a vote on the question.
nay: against concluding their debate on if officers enforcing street trading laws covering offering services should be required be trained and move to a vote on the question.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - New Clause on Review of Parliamentary Constituency Boundaries
aye: against postponing a review of the boundaries of parliamentary constituencies until 2018 and against delaying a review of the effect of reducing the number of MPs
nay: to postpone reviewing the boundaries of parliamentary constituencies until 2018 and also to delay a review into the effect of reducing the number of MPs

title: Equality (Marriage) (Amendment) Bill - Protection In Respect of Beliefs About Definition of Marriage
aye: to give people protection from being discriminated against due to their beliefs about the definition of marriage.
nay: against giving people protection from being discriminated against due to their beliefs about the definition of marriage.

title: Draft Public Bodies (Abolition of the Disability Living Allowance Advisory Board) Order 2013
aye: to abolish the Disability Living Allowance Advisory Board.
nay: against abolishing the Disability Living Allowance Advisory Board.

title: Succession to the Crown Bill - New Clause 1 - Remove Requement for Monarch to be Member of the Church of England
aye: to make it possible for someone not joining in communion with the Church of England to succeed to the Crown.
nay: against making it possible for someone not joining in communion with the Church of England to succeed to the Crown.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Reduce Voting Age to 16
aye: to reduce the voting age to 16
nay: against reducing the voting age to 16

title: Opposition Day - Support Investors in Rental Properties and Action Against Rogue Landlords
aye: to support a £200m "build to rent" fund and £10bn in lending guarantees to help investors buy properties to rent as well as to support action against rogue landlords.
nay: against a £200m "build to rent" fund and £10bn in lending guarantees to help investors buy properties to rent as well as to support action against rogue landlords.

title: Opposition Day - Regulation of the Private Rented Sector
aye: for more regulation of the private rental sector, a national register of landlords, clearer information on charges, and the promotion of longer tenancies when tenants want them.
nay: against more regulation of the private rental sector, against a national register of landlords, against clearer information on charges, and against the promotion of longer tenancies when tenants want them.

title: Welfare Benefits Up-rating Bill - Third Reading - Capping Increase of Specified Benefits at 1%
aye: to cap any increase in specified benefits payments and tax credits at 1% rather than allow them to increase by 2.2% in line with prices.
nay: not to cap any increase in specified benefits payments and tax credits at 1% given an increase in prices of 2.2%.

title: Welfare Benefits Up-rating Bill - Clauses 1 to 3 and Schedule - Capping Increase of Specified Benefits at 1%
aye: to cap any increase in specified benefits payments and tax credits at 1% rather allow them to be increased by 2.2% in line with prices.
nay: not to cap specified benefits payments and tax credits at 1% potentially allowing them to increase by 2.2% in line with prices.

title: Welfare Benefits Up-rating Bill  - Clause 1 - Rate of Increase of Certain Benefits, Payments and Tax Credits
aye: against setting the rate of increase of certain benefits, payments and tax credits at 1% rather than in line with prices at 2.2% for 2014 and 2015
nay: to set the rate of increase of certain benefits, payments and tax credits at 1% rather than in line with prices at 2.2% for 2014 and 2015

title: Opposition Day - Loans and Grants for Heating and Insulation - Energy Saving - Carbon Emissions Reductions
aye: in favour of government loans for energy saving measures being offered on fair and affordable terms; and in favour of energy companies complying with their obligations to deliver energy saving measures to low income households and complying with their carbon emissions targets; and in favour of extending the Warm Front scheme of grants for heating systems and insulation.
nay: against government loans for energy saving measures being offered on fair and affordable terms; against energy companies complying with their obligations to deliver energy saving measures to low income households and complying with their carbon emissions targets; and against extending the Warm Front scheme of grants for heating systems and insulation.

title: Opposition Day - Examination Reform
aye: against introducing English Baccalaureate Certificates.
nay: to introduce English Baccalaureate Certificates.

title: Draft Charging Orders (Orders for Sale: Financial Thresholds) Regulations 2012
aye: to prevent a charging order being made in respect of a debt of under £1,000.
nay: against preventing a charging order being made in respect of a debt of under £1,000.

title: Opposition Day - Rising Cost of Transport - Cap on Rail Fare Increases
aye: to cap rail fare increases and to ban the introduction of a new category of ticket for super-peak trains.
nay: against capping rail fare increases and against banning the introduction of a new category of ticket for super-peak trains.

title: Opposition Day - Pub Companies - Require Free-of-Tie Option for Tenants
aye: to require pub companies to offer their tenants an option to rent the premises with no requirement to buy beer, and other supplies, from the pub company.
nay: against requiring pub companies to offer their tenants an option to rent the premises with no requirement to buy beer, and other supplies, from the pub company.

title: Welfare Up-rating Bill - Programme Motion
aye: to agree with the proposed timetable for dealing with the Welfare Up-rating Bill 2013.
nay: to disagree with the proposed timetable for dealing with the Welfare Up-rating Bill 2013.

title: Welfare Benefits Up-rating Bill - Second Reading - Capping Increase of Specified Benefits at 1%
aye: to cap any increase discretionary working age benefits and tax credits at 1% in 2014-15 and 2015-16
nay: against capping any increase discretionary working age benefits and tax credits at 1% in 2014-15 and 2015-16

title: Welfare Benefits Up-rating Bill - Decline Second Reading - Capping Increase of Specified Benefits at 1%
aye: against capping proposed increases in working age benefits and tax credits at 1% potentially allowing them to rise by 2.2% in line with prices.
nay: in favour of capping any increase in working age benefits and tax credits at 1% rather than potentially allowing them to rise by 2.2% in line with prices.

title: Energy Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against reforming the energy market with regard to reducing carbon dioxide emissions, securing supply, affordability for consumers and increasing generation from renewable sources.
nay: to reform the energy market with regard to reducing carbon dioxide emissions, securing supply, affordability for consumers and increasing generation from renewable sources.

title: Charities Act 2011 (Amendment) Bill - Presumption of Charitable Status for Religious Institutions
aye: to restore a presumption of charitable status for religious institutions.
nay: against restoring a presumption of charitable status for religious institutions.

title: Justice and Security Bill - Second Reading
aye: to allow material deemed national security-sensitive to be made available to a civil court and a special advocate but not parties to the case; to strengthen oversight of intelligence and security activities in Government; and to permit intercept evidence in closed proceedings in employment cases before tribunals.
nay: against allowing material deemed national security-sensitive to be made available to a civil court and a special advocate but not parties to the case; against strengthening oversight of intelligence and security activities in Government; and against permitting intercept evidence in closed proceedings in employment cases before tribunals.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill - Third Reading
aye: for a new employment status of employee shareholder, holders of which may be exempted from certain statutory employment rights; for an option for planning applications to be made directly to the Secretary of State in areas where the local planning authority is deemed to be performing poorly and to postpone a business rate revaluation from 2015 to 2017.
nay: against a new employment status of employee shareholder, holders of which may be exempted from certain statutory employment rights; against an option for planning applications to be made directly to the Secretary of State in areas where the local planning authority is deemed to be performing poorly and against postponing a business rate revaluation from 2015 to 2017.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill - Clause 25 - Employee Shareholder Status - Exemption from Certain Statutory Employment Rights
aye: against exempting  those with employee shareholder status from certain statutory employment rights.
nay: to exempt those with employee shareholder status from certain statutory employment rights.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill - Clause 5 - Central Government Funding to Fulfil Affordable Homes Requirement on Developments
aye: for those required to provide affordable housing as a requirement of planning permission to be able to apply for the requirement to be met in full, or part, by central government funding allocated for the delivery of affordable homes.
nay: against those required to provide affordable housing as a requirement of planning permission being able to apply for the requirement to be met in full, or part, by central government funding allocated for the delivery of affordable homes.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill - Clause 1 - Planning Applications Directly to Secretary of State
aye: against an option to make planning applications directly to the Secretary of State in areas where the local planning authority is deemed to be performing poorly.
nay: for an option to make planning applications directly to the Secretary of State in areas where the local planning authority is deemed to be performing poorly.

title: NHS Funding - Call on Ministers to Reflect Official Spending Statistics When Speaking About Health Spending
aye: to ask ministers to reflect the official treasury spending statistics when making public statements on health spending.
nay: against asking ministers to reflect the official treasury spending statistics when making public statements on health spending.

title: Financial Services Bill - Clause 6 - Financial Services Authority Regulation of Setting Benchmarks for Commodity Prices
aye: to include the setting of benchmarks for determining the price at which commodities may be bought and sold among the activities subject to regulation by the Financial Services Authority.
nay: against including the setting of benchmarks for determining the price at which commodities may be bought and sold among the activities subject to regulation by the Financial Services Authority.

title: Financial Services Bill - Bank of England Oversight Committee - Duty to Monitor Arrangements for Crisis Management
aye: to require the Bank of England's Oversight Committee to monitor the adequacy and effectiveness of the bank's arrangements with the Treasury for crisis management.
nay: against requiring the Bank of England's Oversight Committee to monitor the adequacy and effectiveness of the bank's arrangements with the Treasury for crisis management.

title: Civil Legal Aid (Merits Criteria) Regulations 2012
aye: to approve proposed criteria for determining if legal aid is to be awarded in particular circumstances.
nay: against proposed criteria for determining if legal aid is to be awarded in particular circumstances.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 (Amendment of Schedule 1) Order 2012 - Extension of Legal Aid to Certain Welfare Appeals and Certain International Child Benefit Recovery Cases
aye: to extend legal aid to certain welfare appeals and certain international child benefit recovery cases.
nay: not to extend legal aid to certain welfare appeals and certain international child benefit recovery cases.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - Third Reading
aye: to enable new public sector pensions schemes to be established via secondary legislation according to a proposed framework.
nay: against enabling new public sector pensions schemes to be established via secondary legislation according to a proposed framework.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - Clause 9 - Power to Alter Public Sector Pension Ages Following Capability Reviews
aye: to empower ministers to adjust the normal pension ages of those in certain public sector roles following a capability review.
nay: against empowering ministers to adjust the normal pension ages of those in certain public sector roles following a capability review.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - Clause 9 - Pension Age For Pensions Relating to Public Service in Scotland
aye: against linking the pension age for pensions relating to public service in Scotland with the state pension age.
nay: to link the pension age for pensions relating to public service in Scotland with the state pension age.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - Clause 3 - Prevention of Reducing Accrued Pension Benefits
aye: to expressly prevent new public sector pension schemes reducing accrued pensions benefits without the agreement of those affected.
nay: not to expressly prevent new public sector pension schemes reducing accrued pensions benefits without the agreement of those affected.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - New Clause 3 - Entitlement to Remain Member of Public Sector Pension Scheme If Transferred to Contractor
aye: to allow public sector workers who are transferred to a contractor outside of the public sector to be entitled to remain a member of their public sector pensions scheme.
nay: against allowing public sector workers who are transferred to a contractor outside of the public sector to be entitled to remain a member of their public sector pensions scheme.

title: Human Rights Act 1998 Repeal Bill
aye: to repeal the Human Rights Act 1998
nay: against repealing the Human Rights Act 1998

title: Prisons (Property) Bill - Clause 1 - Power to Destroy or Otherwise Dispose of Unauthorised Property or Unattributable Property
aye: to empower a governor or director of a prison to destroy or otherwise dispose of unauthorised or unattributable articles found in any location a prisoner attends while in custody, instead of limiting the power to just articles found in a prison or prison transport.
nay: against empowering a governor or director of a prison to destroy or otherwise dispose of unauthorised or unattributable articles found in any location a prisoner attends while in custody; instead limiting the power to just articles found in a prison or prison transport.

title: Scotland and the Union
aye: to express a belief that Scotland is better off as part of the UK and the rest of the UK is better off together with Scotland.
nay: against expressing the belief that Scotland is better off as part of the UK and the rest of the UK is better off together with Scotland.

title: Scotland and the Union
aye: against expressing the belief that Scotland is better off as part of the UK and the rest of the UK is better off together with Scotland.
nay: to express a belief that Scotland is better off as part of the UK and the rest of the UK is better off together with Scotland.

title: Opposition Day - Bankers Bonus Tax - Impact of Disability Benefit Changes
aye: for a bank bonus tax to fund jobs for young people and for an impact assessment of disability benefit changes.
nay: against introducing a bank bonus tax to fund jobs for young people and against an impact assessment of disability benefit changes.

title: Reduction in Income Tax Rate Applying to Income Over £150,000
aye: against cutting the top rate of income tax applying to income over £150,000 from 50% to 45%.
nay: in favour of cutting the top rate of income tax applying to income over £150,000 from 50% to 45%.

title: Small Charitable Donations Bill - New Clause 1 - Annual Report on Gift Aid Small Donations Scheme
aye: to require an annual report on operation of the the Gift Aid Small Donations Scheme which enables certain small cash donations to be treated as if they came with a Gift Aid declaration.
nay: against requiring an annual report on operation of the the Gift Aid Small Donations Scheme which enables certain small cash donations to be treated as if they came with a Gift Aid declaration.

title: Draft Benefit Cap (Housing Benefit) Regulations 2012 - Individual Benefits Cap
aye: to cap the total amount of welfare benefits an individual can claim from April 2013 at £350 for a single person and £500 for couple per week.
nay: against capping the total amount of welfare benefits an individual can claim from April 2013 at £350 for a single person and £500 for couple per week.

title: Opposition Day -  Ash Dieback Disease
aye: for the Government to issue clear advice on preventing the spread of Ash Dieback Disease and ensure the Forestry Commission has adequate resources to deal with the disease.
nay: against the Government issuing clear advice on preventing the spread of Ash Dieback Disease and against ensuring the Forestry Commission has adequate resources to deal with the disease.

title: New Criminal Injuries Compensation Scheme
aye: to approve a proposed compensation scheme for those who have suffered criminal injuries.
nay: against a proposed compensation scheme for those who have suffered criminal injuries.

title: Opposition Day -  Cost of Living - Tax Avoidance and Evasion
aye: to support action on tackling tax avoidance and evasion and to do more to help with the cost of living subject to financial constraints.
nay: against action on tackling tax avoidance and evasion and to do more to help with the cost of living subject to financial constraints.

title: Opposition Day - Fuel Duty
aye: against increasing taxes on fuel by 3% as of January 2013.
nay: in favour of increasing taxes on fuel by 3% as of January 2013.

title: Increased Commercialisation of the House of Commons to Generate Income
aye: to defer plans to increase Parliament's income by extending its operations as a commercial visitor attraction, additional retail activities, and greater commercial hire of rooms.
nay: in favour of plans to increase Parliament's income by three million pounds per year by extending its operations as a commercial visitor attraction, additional retail activities, and greater commercial hire of rooms.

title: New Criminal Injuries Compensation Scheme
aye: against a proposed compensation scheme for those who have suffered criminal injuries.
nay: to approve a proposed compensation scheme for those who have suffered criminal injuries.

title: NHS - Regional Pay - Support for Employers and Unions Working Together - Evidence Based Change
aye: to support NHS employers and and unions working together for the benefit of patients and staff and in favour of no change to NHS pay arrangements without strong evidence and a rational case for proceeding.
nay: against supporting NHS employers and and unions working together for the benefit of patients and staff and against requiring strong evidence and a rational case for proceeding to justify any change to NHS pay arrangements.

title: Regional Pay (NHS)
aye: against regionally varying pay in the NHS
nay: for regionally varying pay in the NHS

title: European Union - Banking Union and Economic and Monetary Union - European Banking Authority
aye: against the UK's involvement in a European Supervisory Authority, the European Banking Authority.
nay: for the UK to be involved in a European Supervisory Authority, the European Banking Authority.

title: Growth and Infrastructure Bill - Second Reading
aye: for a new employment status of employee shareholder, holders of which may be exempted from certain statutory employment rights; for an option for planning applications to be made directly to the Secretary of State in areas where the local planning authority is deemed to be performing poorly and to postpone a business rate revaluation from 2015 to 2017.
nay: against a new employment status of employee shareholder, holders of which may be exempted from certain statutory employment rights; against an option for planning applications to be made directly to the Secretary of State in areas where the local planning authority is deemed to be performing poorly and against postponing a business rate revaluation from 2015 to 2017.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Seek Real Terms Cut in European Union Budget
aye: to call on the UK Government to seek a real terms cut in the European Union budget
nay: against calling on the UK Government to seek a real terms cut in the European Union budget

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Review Localised Council Tax Support After Three Years
aye: for a review of localised council tax support after three years of operation.
nay: against a review of localised council tax support after three years of operation.

title: Draft Welfare of Wild Animals in Travelling Circuses (England) Regulations 2012 - Minimum Welfare Standards
aye: to introduce a set of minimum welfare standards for all ‘wild’ animals used by travelling circuses in England.
nay: against introducing a set of minimum welfare standards for all ‘wild’ animals used by travelling circuses in England.

title: Public Service Pensions Bill - Second Reading
aye: to enable new public sector pensions schemes to be established via secondary legislation according to a proposed framework.
nay: against enabling new public sector pensions schemes to be established via secondary legislation according to a proposed framework.

title: Badger Cull
aye: to stop the badger cull which was aimed at tackling bovine tuberculosis.
nay: against stopping badger cull which was aimed at tackling bovine tuberculosis.

title: Opposition Day - Police and Crime Commissioner Elections
aye: to oppose plans to hold Police and Crime Commissioner elections in November rather than May.
nay: to support plans to hold Police and Crime Commissioner elections in November rather than May.

title: Opposition Day - Put Over 75s on Cheapest Energy Tariff and Reform Energy Market
aye: to put all those over 75 on the cheapest energy tariff and reform the energy market with a view to reducing energy prices.
nay: against putting ll those over 75 on the cheapest energy tariff and against reforming the energy market with a view to reducing energy prices.

title: Draft Housing Benefit (Amendment) Regulations 2012 - Under Occupation Critera - Local Housing Allowance Rates
aye: to introduce under-occupation criteria applying to housing benefit for working age claimants in the social rented sector and to set the rates of Local Housing Allowance which applies to private rented accommodation.
nay: against introducing under-occupation criteria applying to housing benefit for working age claimants in the social rented sector and not to set the rates of Local Housing Allowance which applies to private rented accommodation.

title: Backbench Business — 2nd Battalion the Royal Regiment of Fusiliers
aye: against the disbandment of the 2nd Battalion, the Royal Regiment of Fusiliers.
nay: in favour of the disbandment of the 2nd Battalion, the Royal Regiment of Fusiliers.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Third Reading
aye: in favour of establishing a Green Investment Bank, strengthening copyright law relating to commercialised works, encouraging employment disputes to be settled outside of tribunals, and other business related reforms.
nay: against establishing a Green Investment Bank, strengthening copyright law relating to commercialised works, encouraging employment disputes to be settled outside of tribunals, and other business related reforms.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 52 - Commission for Equality and Human Rights
aye: against removing some powers and duties from the Commission for Equality and Human Rights and against reducing the frequency with which the Commission is required to report on progress in society.
nay: to remove some powers and duties from the Commission for Equality and Human Rights and to reduce the frequency with which the Commission is required to report on progress in society.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 61 - Consultation of Employee Representative Before Quoted Company Changes Policy on Director Pay
aye: to require a representative of a quoted company's employees be consulted before the director's remuneration policy is revised.
nay: against requiring a representative of a quoted company's employees be consulted before the director's remuneration policy is revised.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 4 - The UK Green Investment Bank - Ability to Borrow
aye: to enable the UK Green Investment Bank to borrow money so it could begin operating at scale as quickly as possible.
nay: against acting to enable the UK Green Investment Bank to borrow money so it could begin operating at scale as quickly as possible.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - New Clause 22 - UK Green Investment Bank - Duty to Support Climate Change Act Targets
aye: to require the the UK Green Investment Bank to explicitly act in support of the target of reducing UK carbon emissions to 20% of 1990 levels by 2050.
nay: against requiring the UK Green Investment Bank to explicitly act in support of the target of reducing UK carbon emissions to 20% of 1990 levels by 2050.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 13 - Power to Set Limit on Unfair Dismissal Compensation
aye: to empower the Secretary of State to set the limit on a compensatory award for unfair dismissal at a point between median annual earnings and three times median annual earnings.
nay: against empowering the Secretary of State to set the limit on a compensatory award for unfair dismissal at a point between median annual earnings and three times median annual earnings.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Clause 12 - Make Settlement Agreements Inadmissible in Unfair Dismissal Cases
aye: against making settlement agreements inadmissible in unfair dismissal cases in an effort to encourage the use of settlement agreements.
nay: to make settlement agreements inadmissible in unfair dismissal cases in an effort to encourage the use of settlement agreements.

title: European Union - Regulation of Emission of Pollutants from Ships
aye: in favour of proposed European Union action to regulate emissions of pollutants from ships.
nay: against proposed European Union action to regulate emissions of pollutants from ships.

title: Draft Public Bodies (Abolition of the Commission for Rural Communities) Order 2012
aye: to abolish the Commission for Rural Communities
nay: against the abolition of the Commission for Rural Communities

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - New Clause 12 - Equality Act 2010: Third Party Harassment of Employees and Applicants
aye: to remove a provision making an employer guilty of harassment if their employee was harassed in the course of their work.
nay: in favour of continuing to consider an employer guilty of harassment if their employee was harassed in the course of their work.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - New Clause 14 - Civil Claims In Health and Safety Cases Only On Basis of Negligence
aye: to only permit civil actions in relation to claimed health and safety breaches on the basis that the employer has been negligent, and not for example, on the basis of technical breaches of a law.
nay: not to only permit civil actions in relation to claimed health and safety breaches on the basis that the employer has been negligent, and not for example, on the basis of technical breaches of a law.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Programme
aye: for a proposed new timetable for their consideration of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill.
nay: against a proposed new timetable for their consideration of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill.

title: Infrastructure (Financial Assistance) Bill - Clause 1 - Consideration of Clawback Conditions When Providing Financial Assistance for the Provision of Infrastructure
aye: to require reasonable consideration to be given to clawback conditions to safeguard best value for the taxpayer when spending on financial assistance for the provision of infrastructure.
nay: against requiring reasonable consideration to be given to clawback conditions to safeguard best value for the taxpayer when spending on financial assistance for the provision of infrastructure.

title: Infrastructure (Financial Assistance) Bill - Clause 1 - Expenditure on financial assistance for the provision of infrastructure
aye: to require public money spent giving financial assistance in relation to the provision of infrastructure be only spent in relation to the provision of infrastructure within the UK.
nay: not to require public money spent giving financial assistance in relation to the provision of infrastructure be only spent in relation to the provision of infrastructure within the UK.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Draft Jobseeker's Allowance (Sanctions) (Amendment) Regulations 2012 - Three Tier Sanctions for Jobseeker's Allowance
aye: for a new three tier sanctions regime for Jobseeker’s Allowance claimants.
nay: against a new three tier sanctions regime for Jobseeker’s Allowance claimants.

title: Defamation Bill - Clause 10 - Additional Restrictions to Circumstances Where Someone Other Than The Author, Editor or Publisher of Material Can Have Defamation Action Brought Against Them
aye: to add further restrictions to the circumstances in which someone other than the author, editor or publisher of material can have a defamation action brought against them.
nay: against adding further restrictions to the circumstances in which someone other than the author, editor or publisher of material can have a defamation action brought against them.

title: Defamation Bill - Clause 5 - Operators of Websites - Defence to Defamation Action if They Did Not Post Statement
aye: against providing website operators with a defence to defamation action if they did not post the statement on the website; subject to circumstances which defeat the defence.
nay: to provide website operators with a defence to defamation action if they did not post the statement on the website; subject to circumstances which defeat the defence.

title: Defamation Bill - New Clause 2 - Regulation of Payments for Legal Services In Defamation Cases
aye: not to exempt defamation cases from capping of no-win no-fee success fees and provisions to prevent costs awards relating to legal insurance premiums.
nay: to exempt defamation cases from capping of no-win no-fee success fees and provisions to prevent costs awards relating to legal insurance premiums.

title: Opposition Day - Higher and Further Education - Tuition Fees
aye: to reduce tuition fees to £6,000, funded by reversing the corporation tax cut for banks and requiring graduates earning over £65,000 a year to pay higher interest rates on their student loans.
nay: against reducing tuition fees to £6,000, funded by reversing the corporation tax cut for banks and requiring graduates earning over £65,000 a year to pay higher interest rates on their student loans.

title: Universal Credit and Welfare Reform
aye: for the publication of the business case for the “Universal Credit” scheme.
nay: against publishing the business case for the “Universal Credit” scheme.

title: European Union (Approval of Treaty Amendment Decision) Bill - New Clause 3 - Report on the impact of the European Stability Mechanism on the economic performance of the European Union
aye: to require a report assessing the impact of the European Stability Mechanism on the economic performance of the European Union.
nay: against requiring a report assessing the impact of the European Stability Mechanism on the economic performance of the European Union.

title: European Union (Approval of Treaty Amendment Decision) Bill - New Clause 1 - Impact of the European Stability Mechanism on the UK
aye: to require a report assessing the impact of the European Stability Mechanism on the risks to the interests and obligations of the United Kingdom from eurozone instability.
nay: against requiring a report assessing the impact of the European Stability Mechanism on the risks to the interests and obligations of the United Kingdom from eurozone instability.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Opposition Day - House Building - Bankers' Bonus Tax - VAT on Work on Homes
aye: to levy a tax on bankers' bonuses to fund 25,000 affordable homes, to invest in infrastructure, to cut VAT on works on homes.
nay: against levying a tax on bankers' bonuses to fund 25,000 affordable homes, against investing in infrastructure, and against cutting VAT on works on homes.

title: Opposition Day - Housing
aye: to introduce a tax on bankers' bonuses to fund 25,000 additional affordable homes, to make planned investment sooner, to reduce VAT on home improvements and to call on the Government to create jobs.
nay: against introducing a tax on bankers' bonuses to fund 25,000 additional affordable homes, against making planned investment sooner, against reducing VAT on home improvements and against calling on the Government to create jobs.

title: Opposition Day - Rail Fares
aye: to cap annual rail fair increases at 1% above inflation and to ban increases in excess of that limit.
nay: against capping annual rail fair increases at 1% above inflation and not to ban increases in excess of that limit.

title: Opposition Day - Adult Social Care - Cost of Care
aye: to protect people against high costs of care by establishing a legal and financial framework for adult social care.
nay: against protecting people against high costs of care by establishing a legal and financial framework for adult social care.

title: National Health Service - Health Spending and Rationing by Cost
aye: to ask the Government to take action to prevent rationing by cost in the NHS and to call on the Government to honour its pledge to increase health spending in real terms each year.
nay: against asking the Government to take action to prevent rationing by cost in the NHS and against calling on the Government to honour its pledge to increase health spending in real terms each year.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Draft European Union Budget
aye: to state the Prime Minister’s failure to secure allies had weakened the UK's ability to negotiate the EU budget bot not to say the 2005 decision to give away parts of the UK rebate had caused UK contributions to the EU to rise.
nay: against stating the Prime Minister’s failure to secure allies had weakened the UK's ability to negotiate the EU budget but in favour of saying the 2005 decision to give away parts of the UK rebate had caused UK contributions to the EU to rise.

title: House of Commons to Sit on Tuesdays from 7pm until 10pm to Consider Private Members' Bills
aye: for the House of Commons to sit on Tuesdays from 7.00 pm until 10.00 pm to consider Private Members’ Bills.
nay: against the House of Commons sitting on Tuesdays from 7.00 pm until 10.00 pm to consider Private Members’ Bills.

title: Thursdays
aye: for the House of Commons to begin its session on Thursdays at 9.30am and to bring the main business to a close at 5.00pm.
nay: against the House of Commons to beginning its session on Thursdays at 9.30am and beginning the main business to a close at 5.00pm.

title: Sitting Times of the House of Commons on Tuesdays
aye: for the House of Commons to begin its session on Tuesdays at 11.30am and to bring the main business to a close at 7.00pm.
nay: against the House of Commons to beginning its session on Tuesdays at 11.30am and beginning the main business to a close at 7.00pm.

title: House of Commons Sitting Start Time on Tuesdays
aye: not to change the time at which the House of Commons starts its session on a Tuesday.
nay: to change the time at which the House of Commons starts its session on a Tuesday.

title: House of Lords Reform Bill - Second Reading
aye: in favour of reforming the House of Lords, introducing 15 year terms for most members and introducing an elected element.
nay: against proposed reforms of the House of Lords including the introduction of 15 year terms for most members and an elected element.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Joint Committee on Professional Standards in the Banking Industry
aye: to establish a joint committee of MPs and members of the House of Lords to consider professional standards in the banking industry.
nay: against establishing a joint committee of MPs and members of the House of Lords to consider professional standards in the banking industry.

title: Opposition Day - Public Inquiry Into Professional Standards in the Banking Industry - Libor
aye: for a public inquiry into the professional standards of the banking industry, covering fraud and collusion reporting inter-bank interest rates.
nay: against a public inquiry into the professional standards of the banking industry, covering fraud and collusion reporting inter-bank interest rates.

title: Draft Education (Amendment of the Curriculum Requirements for Fourth Key Stage) (England) Order 2012 - Remove Work-Related Learning from Curriculum
aye: to remove the requirement on maintained schools to provide work-related learning as part of the National Curriculum for the fourth key stage.
nay: against removing the requirement on maintained schools to provide work-related learning as part of the National Curriculum for the fourth key stage.

title: Police and Crime Commissioners - Election Rules
aye: in favour of proposed detailed rules for the election of Police and Crime Commissioners.
nay: against proposed detailed rules for the election of Police and Crime Commissioners.

title: Finance Bill 2012 - Third Reading
aye: to raise the basic income tax free allowance, cut corporation tax, and to support other tax changes proposed in the Finance Bill.
nay: against raising the basic income tax free allowance, against cutting corporation tax, and against the other tax changes proposed in the Finance Bill.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 13 - Report on Bankers' Bonus Tax
aye: to require a report on a tax on Bankers' Bonuses, including on how the revenue raised could be spent to create jobs.
nay: against requiring a report on a tax on Bankers' Bonuses, including on how the revenue raised could be spent to create jobs.

title: Finance Bill - New Schedule 1 - Transitory Arrangements - VAT on Alterations To Certain Listed Buildings
aye: for transitional arrangements to phase in the application of VAT to alterations of certain listed buildings.
nay: against transitional arrangements to phase in the application of VAT to alterations of certain listed buildings.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 12 - Rate of VAT
aye: to cut VAT from 20% to 17.5%
nay: against cutting VAT from 20% to 17.5%

title: Finance Bill - Clause 8 - Recovery of Child Benefit from Those With Income Over Fifty Thousand Pounds Per Year
aye: not to recover Child Benefit those with an income of over £50K per year.
nay: to recover Child Benefit from those with an income of over £50K per year.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 4 - Phasing Out of Additional Tax Free Income Tax Allowance for Those Aged 65 or over
aye: to phase out the additional tax free income tax allowance for those aged 65 or over.
nay: against phasing out the additional tax free income tax allowance for those aged 65 or over.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 1 - Additional Rate of Income Tax
aye: to abolish the additional rate of income tax applying to income over £150,000 per year
nay: to set the additional rate of income tax, applying to income over £150,000 per year, at 45% for 2013-14, a reduction from the previous 50% rate.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Third Reading - Individual voter registration etc.
aye: in favour of introducing individual voter registration and other changes to electoral registration and the administration of elections.
nay: against introducing individual voter registration and other changes to electoral registration and the administration of elections.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Wait for Successful Data Matching Pilots
aye: to wait for the positive outcome of data-matching pilots before removing people from the electoral register following a move to individual voter registration.
nay: not to wait for the positive outcome of data-matching pilots before removing people from the electoral register following a move to individual voter registration.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - New Clause 4 - Voters in queue outside polling station at poll closing time
aye: to allow those in a queue outside a polling station at the poll closing time to vote.
nay: against allowing those in a queue outside a polling station at the poll closing time to vote.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Schedule 4 - Duties of Electoral Registration Officers
aye: to place a duty on electoral registration officers to secure that persons who are entitled to be registered in a register (and no others) are registered in it and not to limit that duty by including "so far as is reasonably practicable".
nay: to place a duty on electoral registration officers to secure that, so far as is reasonably practicable, persons who are entitled to be registered in a register (and no others) are registered in it.

title: European Union Review of UK Economic Policy - Government approach to deficit reduction, growth and EU sanctions
aye: to support of the Government's approach to reducing the deficit and promoting growth, as well as to support the policy of seeking assurances the UK cannot be subject to EU sanctions in relation in relation to EU economic measures.
nay: to support of the Government's approach to reducing the deficit and promoting growth, as well as to support the policy of seeking assurances the UK cannot be subject to EU sanctions in relation in relation to EU economic measures.

title: Draft Sexual Offences Act 2003 (Remedial) Order 2012 - Mechinism For Review of Indefinite Notification Requirements
aye: to introduce a mechanism for reviewing indefinite notification requirements under the Sexual Offences Act 2003.
nay: against introducing a mechanism for reviewing indefinite notification requirements under the Sexual Offences Act 2003.

title: Draft Sexual Offences Act 2003 (Notification Requirements) (England and Wales) Regulations 2012  - Strengthening Police Notification Requirements
aye: to strengthen requirements on sex offenders to notify police of foreign travel, residence, banking and identity information.
nay: not to strengthen requirements on sex offenders to notify police of foreign travel, residence, banking and identity information.

title: Opposition Day - Defence Reform - Military Covenant - Strategic Defence and Security Review Assumptions
aye: to call on the Government to strengthen the military covenant and to request a reassessment of the assumptions on which the Strategic Defence and Security Review was based.
nay: against calling on the Government to strengthen the military covenant and against requesting a reassessment of the assumptions on which the Strategic Defence and Security Review was based.

title: Opposition Day - Secondary Education
aye: for changes to the secondary education system to be approved by Parliament.
nay: for changes to the secondary education system to be approved by Parliament.

title: Opposition Day - Approval of Secondary Education Policies by MPs in the House of Commons
aye: to ask for any proposed changes to secondary education to be put before MPs in the House of Commons.
nay: against asking for any proposed changes to secondary education to be put before MPs in the House of Commons.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration - Schedule 5 - Eligibility for Absentee Ballot
aye: to remove a voter's entitlement to an absentee ballot if they had not successfully applied to register to vote during the operation of the first or second "canvass" under the new individual voter registration system.
nay: to remove a voter's entitlement to an absentee ballot if they had not successfully applied to register to vote during the operation of the first "canvass" under the new individual voter registration system,

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Schedule 5 - Removal of Entries from the Register of Electors
aye: to only remove people from the register of electors if they fail to successfully make an individual voter registration application in the first three, rather than just two, canvasses under the new individual registration system.
nay: to remove people from the register of electors if they fail to successfully make an individual voter registration application in the first two, rather than three, canvasses under the new individual registration system.

title: Opposition Day - Regional Pay in the Public Sector
aye: in favour of seeking advice on regional pay in the public sector and waiting for that advice before making proposals.
nay: against seeking advice on regional pay in the public sector and against waiting for that advice before making proposals.

title: Opposition Day - Public Sector Pay Negotiation.
aye: to oppose changes to the way public sector pay is negotiated.
nay: to support changes to the way public sector pay is negotiated.

title: Opposition Day - Disability Benefits and Social Care
aye: to call on the Government to review aspects of their reforms to support for disabled people and their families.
nay: against calling on the Government to review aspects of their reforms to support for disabled people and their families.

title: Draft Community Right to Challenge (Fire and Rescue Authorities and Rejection of Expressions of Interest) (England) Regulations 2012
aye: to extend the ability of various groups to bid to take over state-run services to fire and rescue services and extend the grounds on which bids to run services can be rejected.
nay: not to extend the ability of various groups to bid to take over state-run services to fire and rescue services and not to extend the grounds on which bids to run services can be rejected.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Clause 4 - Universities etc. to Provide Student Lists and Students to Be Written to With Individual Voter Registration Forms
aye: to require higher and further education institutions to provide lists of students at the start of each academic year and to require electoral registration officers to write individually to all students with an electoral registration form.
nay: against requiring higher and further education institutions to provide lists of students at the start of each academic year and against requiring electoral registration officers to write individually to all students with an electoral registration form.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Clause 4 - Annual Electoral Registration Canvass To Take Place in October
aye: to require the annual distribution of electoral registration forms and subsequent activity to update the electoral register to take place in October.
nay: against requiring the annual distribution of electoral registration forms and subsequent activity to update the electoral register to take place in October.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Clause 1 - Individual Voter Registration - Ministerial Guidance
aye: for electoral registration officers to be required to have regard to ministerial guidance on the operation of individual voter registration until the Electoral Commission believes the new system is operating effectively, rather than for five years as alternatively proposed.
nay: for electoral registration officers to be required to have regard to ministerial guidance on the operation of individual voter registration for five years rather than, as alternatively proposed, until the Electoral Commission believes the new system is operating effectively.

title: Investigation Into If Jeremy Hunt MP Breached the Ministerial Code
aye: to refer Jeremy Hunt MP for an investigation on if he had breached the Ministerial Code.
nay: against referring Jeremy Hunt MP for an investigation on if he had breached the Ministerial Code.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for consideration of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for consideration of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill.

title: Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against establishing a Green Investment Bank, strengthening copyright law relating to commercialised works, encouraging employment disputes to be settled outside of tribunals, and other business related reforms.
nay: in favour of establishing a Green Investment Bank, strengthening copyright law relating to commercialised works, encouraging employment disputes to be settled outside of tribunals, and other business related reforms.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Second Reading
aye: in favour of introducing individual voter registration and other changes to electoral registration and the administration of elections.
nay: against introducing individual voter registration and other changes to electoral registration and the administration of elections.

title: Electoral Registration and Administration Bill - Individual Electoral Registration - Decline Second Reading
aye: against introducing Individual Electoral Registration to replace the previous household based system.
nay: to introduce Individual Electoral Registration to replace the previous household based system.

title: Financial Services Bill - Clause 22 - Financial Conduct Authority - Power to Set Rules on Setting Remuneration
aye: to empower the Financial Conduct Authority to set rules requiring, within certain bodies, an employee representative on the remuneration committee, and for remuneration consultants advising on remuneration policy to be appointed by the shareholders.
nay: against empowering the Financial Conduct Authority to set rules requiring, within certain bodies, an employee representative on the remuneration committee, and for remuneration consultants advising on remuneration policy to be appointed by the shareholders.

title: Financial Services Bill - Clause 22 - Powers of Financial Conduct Authority - Credit Offered on Terms Causing Consumer Detriment
aye: to empower the Financial Conduct Authority to make rules, or apply sanctions, to regulated individuals who offer credit on terms the authority deems cause consumer detriment.
nay: against empowering the Financial Conduct Authority to make rules, or apply sanctions, to regulated individuals who offer credit on terms the authority deems cause consumer detriment.

title: Financial Services Bill - Clause 47 - Power for Treasury to Change Law on Mutual Societies by Order To Promote Such Societies, Collect Statistics on Them and Diversify the Financial Sector
aye: to allow the Treasury to change a series of laws on mutual societies to provide for increased diversity in the financial services sector, the promotion of mutual societies and to make arrangements to collect statistics on mutual societies.
nay: against allowing the Treasury to change a series of laws on mutual societies to provide for increased diversity in the financial services sector, the promotion of mutual societies and to make arrangements to collect statistics on mutual societies.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Third Reading
aye: to allow local councils to retain a proportion of the business rates generated in their area and to localise assisting those in financial need to pay their council tax.
nay: against allowing local councils to retain a proportion of the business rates generated in their area and not to localise assisting those in financial need to pay their council tax.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - New Clause 6 - Determination of Central vs Local Share of Business Rates
aye: to require the Secretary of State to have regard to an areas's needs and capacity for business rate growth when determining the proportion of business rates to be retained locally.
nay: against requiring the Secretary of State to have regard to an areas's needs and capacity for business rate growth when determining the proportion of business rates to be retained locally.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - New Clause 5 - Report on Effects of Changes to Council Tax support
aye: to require a report on the impact of localising arrangements for supporting those in financial need to pay Council Tax.
nay: against a proposal to require a report on the impact of localising arrangements for supporting those in financial need to pay Council Tax.

title: Queen's Speech - Note of Thanks
aye: to send a proposed note of thanks to the Queen following the Queens' Speech to Parliament.
nay: against sending the proposed note of thanks to the Queen following the Queens' Speech to Parliament.

title: Queens' Speech - Jobs - Banker's Bonus Tax - VAT Cut - Tax Incentive to Take on Workers - Sooner Infrastructure Investment
aye: to create jobs; to tax bank bonuses to fund guaranteed jobs for young people out of work for a year; to cut VAT; to give a tax break to small firms taking on more workers and to make infrastructure investment sooner.
nay: against creating jobs; a tax on bank bonuses to fund guaranteed jobs for young people out of work for a year; a VAT cut; a tax break for small firms taking on more workers and making infrastructure investment sooner.

title: Queens' Speech - Tax on Bank Bonuses - Jobs Guarantee - VAT Reduction - Make Investment Sooner
aye: for measures to stimulate economic growth and job creation; for a tax on bank bonuses to fund guaranteed jobs for young people out of work for over a year; to reduce VAT; for a tax break for small firms taking on extra workers and to make infrastructure investment sooner.
nay: against measures to stimulate economic growth and job creation; against a tax on bank bonuses to fund guaranteed jobs for young people out of work for over a year; against reducing VAT;  against a tax break for small firms taking on extra workers and against making infrastructure investment sooner.

title: Queens' Speech - Cost of Living - Public Transport Fares - VAT on Fuel
aye: in favour of reducing public transport fares, and reducing VAT on fuel to help motorists and boost the economy.
nay: against reducing public transport fares, and against reducing VAT on fuel to help motorists and boost the economy.

title: Sunday Trading (London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games) Bill - Third Reading
aye: to suspend restrictions on Sunday trading hours for the period of the London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games.
nay: against suspending restrictions on Sunday trading hours for the period of the London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games.

title: Sunday Trading (London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games) Bill - Second Reading
aye: to suspend restrictions on Sunday trading hours for the period of the London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games.
nay: against suspending restrictions on Sunday trading hours for the period of the London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games.

title: Sunday Trading (London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games) Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Sunday Trading (London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games) Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Sunday Trading (London Olympic Games and Paralympic Games) Bill.

title: Civil Aviation Bill - Clause 84 - Requirement for Civil Aviation Authority to Publish Information on Greenhouse Gas Emissions
aye: to require the Civil Aviation Authority to publish information on greenhouse gas emissions resulting from air travel to and from civil airports.
nay: against requiring the Civil Aviation Authority to publish information on greenhouse gas emissions resulting from air travel to and from civil airports.

title: Civil Aviation Bill - Clause 18 - Airport Operator Licence Holders - Passenger Welfare Plans
aye: to require the holder of an airport operator's licence to develop passenger welfare plans.
nay: against requiring the holder of an airport operator's licence to develop passenger welfare plans.

title: Civil Aviation Bill - Clause 1 - Civil Aviation Authority - Greenhouse Gas Emission Reduction Duty
aye: to require the Civil Aviation Authority to have regard to working with other bodies to meet the UK's greenhouse gas emission reduction obligations.
nay: against requiring the Civil Aviation Authority to have regard to working with other bodies to meet the UK's greenhouse gas emission reduction obligations.

title: European Union - Data Protection in the Areas of Police and Criminal Justice (EU Directive)
aye: in favour of EU data sharing for criminal justice purposes.
nay: against EU data sharing for criminal justice purposes.

title: Government Assessment of Medium Term Economic and Budgetary Position for Submission to the European Commission
aye: to approve the Government's assessment of the UK's medium term economic and budgetary position for submission to the European Commission.
nay: not to approve the Government's assessment of the UK's medium term economic and budgetary position for submission to the European Commission.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Evidence to Show Legal Aid Eligibility - Domestic Abuse - Child Abuse
aye: against including in law examples of what would count as evidence of domestic abuse and lead to eligibility for legal aid and against removing any time limit on providing evidence a child is at risk of abuse in connection with a legal aid application.
nay: to include in law examples of what would count as evidence of domestic abuse and lead to eligibility for legal aid and against any time limit on providing evidence a child is at risk of abuse in connection with a legal aid application.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Clause 1 - Duty for Lord Chancellor to Consider Needs of Legal Aid Applicants
aye: to give the Lord Chancellor a duty to exercise his powers in relation to Legal Aid with a view to securing that individuals have access to legal services that effectively meet their needs, subject to resources and the law.
nay: against giving the Lord Chancellor a duty to exercise his powers in relation to Legal Aid with a view to securing that individuals have access to legal services that effectively meet their needs, subject to resources and the law.

title: Labelling of Halal and Kosher Meat
aye: to require products containing halal and kosher meat to be labelled as such.
nay: against requiring products containing halal and kosher meat to be labelled as such.

title: Financial Services Bill - Clause 5 - New Regulators for Financial Service and Insurance Industries
aye: against new regulators for the financial services and insurance industries.
nay: in favour of new regulators for the financial services and insurance industries.

title: Financial Services Bill - Clause 3 - Bank of England's Financial Policy Committee - To Have Regard To Government Policy and Objectives
aye: to require the Bank of England's Financial Policy Committee to have regard to the government's economic policy and objectives for growth and employment when fulfilling its role contributing to UK financial stability.
nay: against requiring the Bank of England's Financial Policy Committee to have regard to the government's economic policy and objectives for growth and employment when fulfilling its role contributing to UK financial stability.

title: Financial Services Bill - New Clause 10 - Mortgage Rate Forewarning
aye: to require mortgage lenders to warn their customers about potential interest rate changes and their impact on mortgage repayments.
nay: against requiring mortgage lenders to warn their customers about potential interest rate changes and their impact on mortgage repayments.

title: Financial Services Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Financial Services Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Financial Services Bill.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 8 and Schedule 1 - Child Benefit Recovery from those with an income of over £50K
aye: to recover Child Benefit from those with an income of over £50K
nay: against recovering Child Benefit from those with an income of over £50K

title: Finance Bill 2012 - Schedule 1 - Income Threshold for Recovery of Child Benefit
aye: to make the income threshold for recovering child benefit £100,000 for a couple combined, rather than £50,000 for either individual.
nay: against making the income threshold for recovering child benefit £100,000 for a couple combined, rather than £50,000 for either individual.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 8 - Study Of Impact of Child Benefit Proposals on Single Earner Families
aye: to require a study into ways of reducing the impact on families with only one earner of proposals to recover child benefit from those earning over £50,000.
nay: not to require a study into ways of reducing the impact on families with only one earner of proposals to recover child benefit from those earning over £50,000.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 4 - Phasing Out of Additional Tax Free Income Tax Allowance for Those Aged 65 or over
aye: to phase out the additional tax free income tax allowance for those aged 65 or over and introduce a single personal allowance for all.
nay: not to phase out the additional tax free income tax allowance for those aged 65 or over and introduce a single personal allowance for all.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 4 - Phasing Out of Additional Tax Free Income Tax Allowance for Those Aged 65 or over
aye: against phasing in a single tax free income tax personal allowance for all (rather than having an additional tax free allowance for those over 65).
nay: to phase in a single tax free income tax personal allowance for all (rather than having an additional tax free allowance for those over 65).

title: Finance Bill - Schedule 23 - Air Passenger Duty
aye: to devolve responsibility for Air Passenger Duty to the Scottish Parliament.
nay: against devolving responsibility for Air Passenger Duty to the Scottish Parliament.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 7 - VAT: Protected Buildings
aye: to prevent any changes to the definition of "protected building" used for VAT purposes.
nay: to allow changes to the definition of "protected building" used for VAT purposes.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 6 - Extending VAT to Static Holiday Caravans
aye: against extending VAT to static holiday caravans.
nay: in favour of extending VAT to static holiday caravans.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 5 - VAT on Hot Baked Goods - (Pasty Tax)
aye: against introducing VAT on hot baked goods, such as pasties even if they were not specifically kept hot for consumption.
nay: to introduce VAT on hot baked goods, such as pasties even if they were not specifically kept hot for consumption.

title: Finance Bill 2012 - New Clause 3 - Report on Impact of Changes to VAT
aye: to require the chancellor to review the impact on jobs, living standards and businesses of any changes to the classes of goods and services on which VAT is not charged.
nay: against requiring the chancellor to review the impact on jobs, living standards and businesses of any changes to the classes of goods and services on which VAT is not charged.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 209 - Tax on Bankers' Bonuses
aye: to require the chancellor to review the possibility of reintroducing a tax on bankers' bonuses and how the revenue raised could be spent on tackling unemployment.
nay: against requiring the chancellor to review the possibility of reintroducing a tax on bankers' bonuses and how the revenue raised could be spent on tackling unemployment.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 1 - Report on Additional Rate of Income Tax
aye: to require  a report on the additional rate of income tax, including a consideration of the impact of reducing the additional rate to 45%.
nay: against requiring a report on the additional rate of income tax, including a consideration of the impact of reducing the additional rate to 45%.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 1 - Additional Rate of Income Tax
aye: to abolish the additional rate of income tax applying to income over £150,000 per year
nay: to set the additional rate of income tax, applying to income over £150,000 per year, at 45% for 2013-14, a reduction from the previous 50% rate.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing & Punishment of Offenders Bill - Exception in Industrial Disease Cases From Ban on Costs Awards Covering No Win No Fee Success Fees and Insurance Premiums
aye: not to allow "no win no fee" success fees and related legal insurance premiums to be included in costs awarded in cases relating to damages for health impacts due to a breach of an employer's duty to their employee.
nay: to allow "no win no fee" success fees and related legal insurance premiums to be included in costs awarded in cases relating to damages for health impacts due to a breach of an employer's duty to their employee.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing & Punishment of Offenders Bill — Lords amendments - Exceptions in respiratory (industrial disease or illness) cases
aye: not to allow "no win no fee" success fees and related legal insurance premiums to be included in costs awarded in cases relating to damages for respiratory health impacts due to industrial exposure to harmful substances.
nay: to allow "no win no fee" success fees and related legal insurance premiums to be included in costs awarded in cases relating to damages for respiratory health impacts due to industrial exposure to harmful substances. The Bill included provisions to generally stop the award of costs to cover such success fees and insurance premiums.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing & Punishment of Offenders Bill - Legal Aid for children
aye: against making legal aid available to children in a wider range of cases.
nay: to make legal aid available to children in a wider range of cases.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing & Punishment of Offenders Bill - Legal Aid for Social Welfare Law
aye: against making legal aid available in respect of social welfare decisions.
nay: to make legal aid available in respect of social welfare decisions.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing & Punishment of Offenders Bill - Civil Legal Aid For Domestic Abuse Victims
aye: against specifying in primary legislation what counts as evidence that domestic abuse has occurred and so entitles the victim to civil legal aid.
nay: to specify in primary legislation what counts as evidence that domestic abuse has occurred and so entitles the victim to civil legal aid.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing & Punishment of Offenders Bill - Preserving Face-to-Face Initial Legal Aid Advice
aye: to allow initial legal aid advice to be provided online or by phone rather than requiring it be offered in face to face.
nay: to require initial legal aid advice be offered face to face rather than allowing it to be provided online or by phone

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing & Punishment of Offenders Bill - Ensure Individuals Have Access to Legal Services They Need
aye: not to require the Lord Chancellor to ensure that, subject to resources, individuals have access to legal services that effectively meet their needs.
nay: to require the Lord Chancellor to ensure that, subject to resources, individuals have access to legal services that effectively meet their needs.

title: Legal Aid, sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Programme motion
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Legal Aid, sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Legal Aid, sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill.

title: Finance Bill (carry over)
aye: to raise the tax free income tax allowance, reduce corporation tax and recover child benefit from couples where an individual earns over £50,000.
nay: against raising the tax free income tax allowance, against reducing corporation tax and against recovering child benefit from couples where an individual earns over £50,000.

title: Finance Bill - Second Reading
aye: to raise the tax free income tax allowance, reduce corporation tax and recover child benefit from couples where an individual earns over £50,000.
nay: against raising the tax free income tax allowance, against reducing corporation tax and against recovering child benefit from couples where an individual earns over £50,000.

title: Reduction in Income Tax Rate Applying to Income Over £150,000
aye: to indicate support for a reduction in the additional rate of income tax, which applies to income over £150k, from 50% to 45%.
nay: to indicate opposition to a reduction in the additional rate of income tax, which applies to income over £150k, from 50% to 45%.

title: Budget Resolutions -  Air Passenger Duty Rates from 1 April 2012
aye: for increases in Air Passenger Duty Rates
nay: against increases in Air Passenger Duty Rates

title: Budget Resolution - Recovery of Child Benefit from Those with High Incomes
aye: in favour of recovering child benefit from high earners through the tax system.
nay: against recovering child benefit from high earners through the tax system.

title: March 2012 Budget
aye: in favour of the March 2012 budget which planned spending of £683bn against expected revenue of £592bn and also increased the income tax personal tax free allowance, reduced corporation tax, introduced a new top rate of Stamp Duty and introduced a tax to recover child benefit from households with an individual earning over £50K.
nay: against the March 2012 budget which planned spending of £683bn against expected revenue of £592bn and also increased the income tax personal tax free allowance, reduced corporation tax, introduced a new top rate of Stamp Duty and introduced a tax to recover child benefit from households with an individual earning over £50K.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Lords Amendments - Access to NICE Approved Drugs - Improved Clarity
aye: to ensure patients would continue to have access to NICE-approved drugs and treatments, whether NHS or local authority funded and to improve the clarity and functionality of the Health and Social Care Bill.
nay: against ensuring patients would continue to have access to NICE-approved drugs and treatments, whether NHS or local authority funded and against improving the clarity and functionality of the Health and Social Care Bill.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Regulatory Approval of Activities by NHS Foundation Trusts Not Related to Healthcare
aye: to require the approval of the health service regulator Monitor before the implementation of any plans by Foundation Trusts which would result in their income from activities not related to healthcare exceeding 5% of their total income.
nay: not to require the approval of the health service regulator Monitor before the implementation of any plans by Foundation Trusts which would result in their income from activities not related to healthcare exceeding 5% of their total income.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Clinical Commissioning Group Members' Interests - Eligibility to Partipate in Decision Making
aye: to prevent members of Clinical Commissioning Groups with a declarable interest in a provider of services from taking part in discussions or decisions in relation to arrangements with that provider.
nay: to allow members of Clinical Commissioning Groups with a declarable interest in a provider of services to take part in discussions or decisions in relation to arrangements with that provider.

title: Health and Social Care Bill (Programme) (No. 4)
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for considering the Health and Social Care Bill
nay: against a proposed timetable for considering the Health and Social Care Bill

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Defer Consideration Until Publication of NHS Transitional Risk Register
aye: to agree MPs had considered if consideration of the Health and Social Care Bill ought be deferred until the publication of the NHS transitional risk register.
nay: to say MPs had not considered if consideration of the Health and Social Care Bill ought be deferred until the publication of the NHS transitional risk register.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Clause 64 - Level of Supervision of Volunteers Working With Children for Exemption from Barring Regulations
aye: to require volunteers working with children to be under close audio and visual supervision, rather than just reasonable supervision, for them to be exempted from regulations barring people from working with children.
nay: against requiring volunteers working with children to be under close audio and visual supervision, rather than just reasonable supervision, for them to be exempted from regulations barring people from working with children.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Stalking
aye: to broaden the definition of stalking to include acting in any way that would cause a reasonable person to suffer fear or alarm.
nay: against broadening the definition of stalking to include acting in any way that would cause a reasonable person to suffer fear or alarm.

title: Draft Employment Tribunals Act 1996 (Tribunal Composition) Order 2012 - Lone Judge to Hear Cases of Unfair Dismissal
aye: to enable Employment Tribunal proceedings in respect of unfair dismissal to be heard by an Employment Judge sitting alone, without the need for a full panel.
nay: against Employment Tribunal proceedings in respect of unfair dismissal being heard by an Employment Judge sitting alone, rather than by a full panel.

title: Draft Unfair Dismissal and Statement of Reasons for Dismissal (Variation of Qualifying Period) Order 2012 - Period Working Before Eligible to Claim for Unfair Dismissal
aye: to increase the minimum qualifying period for the right to claim unfair dismissal from one year to two years for employees starting new employment
nay: against increasing the minimum qualifying period for the right to claim unfair dismissal from one year to two years for employees starting new employment

title: Water Industry (Financial Assistance) Bill - New Clause 1 - Minimum Standards for Water Company Social Tariffs
aye: in favour of the Government setting minimum standards for social tariffs for water to help those struggling to pay water bills.
nay: against the Government setting minimum standards for social tariffs for water to help those struggling to pay water bills.
