title: Water Industry (Financial Assistance) Bill  - Clause 2 - Risk Managment Framework - Providing Financial Assistance for Water Infrastructure
aye: to require the use of a specified risk management framework when providing financial assistance for the construction of water infrastructure.
nay: against requiring the use of a specified risk management framework when providing financial assistance for the construction of water infrastructure.

title: Water Industry (Financial Assistance) Bill - Clause 1 - Financial Assistance to Reduce Charges
aye: to require the Secretary of State to give details of which customers would benefit, and how, from any payment made to water providers made to secure lower prices for customers.
nay: against requiring the Secretary of State to give details of which customers would benefit, and how, from any payment made to water providers made to secure lower prices for customers.

title: The Tax Credits Up-rating Regulations 2012
aye: to increase certain tax credits in line with inflation and to make changes to elements of the tax credit system.
nay: against increasing certain tax credits in line with inflation and to make changes to elements of the tax credit system.

title: Health and Social Care Bill
aye: against proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.
nay: to support proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.

title: Health and Social Care Bill
aye: against proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.
nay: to support proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.

title: Backbench Business Committee - Election of Members and Chair - Operation of Committee
aye: or members of the House of Commons Backbench Business Committee to be elected by members of political parties rather than, as was the case previously, by the whole House of Commons, and to make other changes to the operation of the committee.
nay: against members of the House of Commons Backbench Business Committee being elected by members of political parties rather than, as was the case previously, by the whole House of Commons, and against other changes to the operation of the committee.

title: Election of Backbench Business Committee
aye: to require a representative of MPs from minority parties on the Backbench Business Committee.
nay: against requiring a representative of MPs from minority parties on the Backbench Business Committee.

title: Election of Backbench Business Committee by Parties
aye: against members of the House of Commons Backbench Business Committee being elected by members of political parties rather than, as was the case previously, by the whole House of Commons.
nay: members of the House of Commons Backbench Business Committee to be elected by members of political parties rather than, as was the case previously, by the whole House of Commons.

title: European Union - Safety of Offshore Oil and Gas Activities
aye: to support the Government's policy of pursuing EU safety regulation of offshore oil and gas activities in a manner which would protect both the environment and UK interests.
nay: against the Government's policy of pursuing EU safety regulation of offshore oil and gas activities in a manner which would protect both the environment and UK interests.

title: Opposition Day - Revenue from Tax Avoidance - Tax Credits - Child Benefit
aye: to use revenue from tackling tax avoidance to cancel changes to tax credits and in favour of a review of proposed changes to child benefit.
nay: against using revenue from tackling tax avoidance to cancel changes to tax credits and against a review of proposed changes to child benefit.

title: Opposition Day - Jobs and Growth in a Low-carbon Economy
aye: to call on the Government to adopt "an active industrial strategy for low-carbon growth" via measures including supporting growth in the regions and encouraging manufacturing.
nay: against calling on the Government to adopt "an active industrial strategy for low-carbon growth" via measures including supporting growth in the regions and encouraging manufacturing.

title: Backbench Business - Indexation of Occupational Pensions
aye: for a return to basing the indexation for occupational pensions on the Retail Prices Index.
nay: against a return to basing the indexation for occupational pensions on the Retail Prices Index.

title: Business of the House - Sittings of the House (20 and 23 March)
aye: for an extra siting day of the House of Commons Wednesday 28 March, and consequently an additional session of Prime Minister's questions.
nay: against an extra siting day of the House of Commons Wednesday 28 March, and consequently an additional session of Prime Minister's questions.

title: Business of the House - Hold Westminister Hall Debate Session in Lieu of One Cancelled for Visit by Monarch
aye: to hold a session of debates in Westminster Hall on the 19th of March 2012 in lieu of one cancelled for a visit by the monarch on the 20th of March 2012.
nay: against holding a session of debates in Westminster Hall on the 19th of March 2012 in lieu of one cancelled for a visit by the monarch on the 20th of March 2012.

title: Health and Social Care Bill Risk Register
aye: for the publication of the risk register associated with the Health and Social Care Bill
nay: against publication of the risk register associated with the Health and Social Care Bill

title: Ten Minute Rule Bill- Annual Statements of Healthcare Costs
aye: to require GPs to issue patients with an annual statement of their healthcare costs.
nay: against requiring GPs to issue patients with an annual statement of their healthcare costs.

title: London Local Authorities Bill - Clause 9 - Street trading: vehicles and the internet
aye: to make the sale of motor vehicles on the internet, where the vehicle is kept on the highway, come within the existing street trading legislation which applies in London.
nay: against making the sale of motor vehicles on the internet, where the vehicle is kept on the highway, come within the existing street trading legislation which applies in London.

title: London Local Authorities Bill -  Closure of Debate on Amendments
aye: to bring the debate on more powers for local authorities in London to a close.
nay: not to bring the debate on more powers for local authorities in London to a close.

title: Adjournment Dates 2012 (Easter, May, Whitsun, Summer, Conference, November and Christmas)
aye: in favour of proposed adjournment dates for the House of Commons for Easter, May, Whitsun, Summer, Conference, November and Christmas 2012.
nay: against proposed adjournment dates for the House of Commons for Easter, May, Whitsun, Summer, Conference, November and Christmas 2012.

title: European Annual Growth Survey 2012
aye: to support decisions aimed at bringing the deficit under control and stimulate economic growth and support the Government's view the European Annual Growth Survey 2012 sends important messages about the urgency of pursuing both fiscal consolidation and structural reform.
nay: against supporting decisions aimed at bringing the deficit under control and stimulate economic growth and against supporting the Government's view the European Annual Growth Survey 2012 sends important messages about the urgency of pursuing both fiscal consolidation and structural reform.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 11 - Housing costs - Exemptions from Benefit Reductions Due to Excess Bedrooms
aye: not to add proposed exclusions from a reduction in housing benefits due to being deemed to have excess bedrooms.
nay: to exclude people in specified circumstances from a reduction in housing benefits due to being deemed to have excess bedrooms.

title: Backbench Business - Iran - Rule out Use of Force - Redouble Diplomatic Efforts
aye: against ruling out the use of force against Iran and seeking to reduce tensions by redoubling diplomatic efforts.
nay: to rule out the use of force against Iran and seek to reduce tensions by redoubling diplomatic efforts.

title: Local Government Finance - Thresholds for Referendums Relating to Council Tax Increases
aye: to set the threshold of council tax increases for 2012-13 which would prompt a referendum at either 3.5% or 4% depending on the body concerned.
nay: against setting the threshold of council tax increases for 2012-13 which would prompt a referendum at either 3.5% or 4% depending on the body concerned.

title: Police Grant Report - 2012-13
aye: to approve police funding proposals for 2012-13
nay: against police funding proposals for 2012-13

title: Draft Wireless Telegraphy Act 2006 (Directions to OFCOM) Order, 2012 - Spectrum Availability for Local TV Services
aye: to ensure the availability of spectrum for local television services
nay: against ensuring the availability of spectrum for local television services

title: Draft Local Digital Television Programme Services Order 2012 - Local Digital TV Services
aye: to enable local digital TV services.
nay: against enabling local digital TV services.

title: Draft City of Wakefield (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Wakefield City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Wakefield City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Coventry (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Coventry City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Coventry City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Sheffield (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Sheffield City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Sheffield City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Newcastle-upon-Tyne (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Newcastle-upon-Tyne City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Newcastle-upon-Tyne City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Manchester (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Manchester City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Manchester City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Report (1st Day) - mental health as a definition of health to to be improved
Opposition Day - Banking - Access to Credit for Businesses - Banking Sector Pay Reform
aye: for banking reforms to give businesses easier access to credit and to bring transparency, accountability and responsibility into the setting of pay in the banking sector.
nay: against banking reforms to give businesses easier access to credit and to bring transparency, accountability and responsibility into the setting of pay in the banking sector.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 131 - Exemption from Child Maintenance and Enforcement Commission Fees
aye: not to exempt parents from Child Maintenance and Enforcement Commission fees where it is not possible or appropriate for them to have made a maintenance agreement.
nay: to exempt parents from Child Maintenance and Enforcement Commission fees where it is not possible or appropriate for them to have made a maintenance agreement.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 11 - Housing costs
aye: not to require the housing cost element of universal credit be sufficient to cover the actual cost of housing for social tenants so long as no offer of alternative accommodation had been made and the household has no more than one spare bedroom.
nay: to require the housing cost element of universal credit to be sufficient to cover the actual cost of housing for social tenants so long as no offer of alternative accommodation had been made and the household has no more than one spare bedroom.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 10 - Universal Credit Payments In Relation to Disabled Children and Young People
aye: not to set the lower rate of the Universal Credit payment in relation to disabled children and young people at a minimum of two-thirds of the higher rate.
nay: to set the lower rate of the Universal Credit payment in relation to disabled children and young people at a minimum of two-thirds of the higher rate.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 93 - Exclusion of Child Benefit from Benefit Cap
aye: not to exclude child benefit from the benefit cap.
nay: to exclude child benefit from the benefit cap.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 51 - Employment and Support Allowance for Those With Cancer
aye: not to make an exception for those with a cancer diagnosis or undergoing cancer treatment from the 365 day limit on receiving contribution based Employment and Support Allowance.
nay: to allow those with a cancer diagnosis or undergoing cancer treatment to continue to receive contribution based Employment and Support Allowance after the usual 365 day limit is reached.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 51 - Period of Entitlement to Contributory Employment and Support Allowance
aye: not to increase the time people can receive contribution based ESA from one year to at least 730 days.
nay: to increase the time people can receive contribution based ESA from one year to at least 730 days.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 51 - Employment and Support Allowance for Those Ill or Disabled Since Their Youth
aye: against those who have been ill or disabled since their youth recieving Employment and Support Allowance on the same basis as if they had made sufficient National Insurance contributions to qualify for a contribution based allowance.
nay: for those who have been ill or disabled since their youth to receive Employment and Support Allowance on the same basis as if they had made sufficient National Insurance contributions to qualify for a contribution based allowance.

title: Draft City of Bristol (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Bristol City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Bristol City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Leeds (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Leeds City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Leeds City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Nottingham (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Nottingham City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Nottingham City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Liverpool (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - 3 May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Liverpool City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Liverpool City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - New Clause 11 - Central Government Funding of Full Costs of Council Tax Reduction Schemes
aye: to require central government to reimburse local councils for the full costs of their council tax reduction schemes for people in financial need.
nay: against requiring central government reimbursing local councils for the full costs of their council tax reduction schemes for people in financial need.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Clause 8 - Move from Council Tax Benefit to Council Tax Reduction Schemes
aye: to move from a national council tax benefit to a system of local councils administering council tax reductions for those in financial need.
nay: against moving from a national council tax benefit to a system of local councils administering council tax reductions for those in financial need.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Clause 8 - Spending on Council tax Reduction Schemes
aye: to require local councils to keep the amount they spend on council tax reductions for those in financial need the same from year to year.
nay: against requiring local councils to keep the amount they spend on council tax reductions for those in financial need the same from year to year.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Clause 8 -  Council Tax Reduction Schemes
aye: to require local councils to consider the impact of schemes to reduce council tax for those in financial need on those in, or seeking employment, and on levels of poverty, including child poverty, in the area.
nay: against requiring local councils to consider the impact of schemes to reduce council tax for those in financial need on those in, or seeking employment, and on levels of poverty, including child poverty, in the

title: Devolution of Powers Relating to Energy Generation to the National Assembly for Wales.
aye: to devolve powers relating to energy generation to the National Assembly for Wales.
nay: against devolving powers relating to energy generation to the National Assembly for Wales.

title: London Local Authorities Bill -  Street Litter Control Notices  - Application to All Non Domestic Premises
aye: to enable all non-domestic premises in London, rather than just commercial or retail premises, to be subject to notices making requirements in relation to litter or refuse such as the provision of, and emptying of a bin.
nay: against enabling all non-domestic premises in London, rather than just commercial or retail premises, to be subject to notices making requirements in relation to litter or refuse such as the provision of, and emptying of a bin.

title: London Local Authorities Bill - Closure of Debate on Street Litter Control Notices
aye: to bring their debate on if it ought be possible to issue a street litter control notice in respect of all non-domestic premises rather than just commercial or retail premises to a close.
nay: against bringing their debate on if it ought be possible to issue a street litter control notice in respect of all non-domestic premises rather than just commercial or retail premises to a close.

title: Draft City of Bradford (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Bradford City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Bradford City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Draft City of Birmingham (Mayoral Referendum) Order 2012 - May 2012 Referendum on a Directly Elected Mayor
aye: to require Birmingham City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.
nay: against requiring Birmingham City Council to hold a referendum on 3rd May 2012 on if to have a directly elected mayor.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - New Clause 7 - Annual Reset of Business Rate Retention System
aye: for an annual reset of the system for business rate retention by local councils.
nay: against an annual reset of the system for business rate retention by local councils.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - New Clause 2 - Safety Net Payment to Local Authorities - Major Redevelopmnet Areas
aye: to set out what the Secretary of State must consider when deciding if to make a payment to a local authority in relation to the loss of business rate income due to a major redevelopment scheme.
nay: against setting out what the Secretary of State must consider when deciding if to make a payment to a local authority in relation to the loss of business rate income due to a major redevelopment scheme.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Schedule 2 - Consider Needs of Local Authority When Determining Revenue Support Grant
aye: to require the Secretary of State to satisfy himself the resources available to a local authority are sufficient to meet the needs of the local authority when considering if to make a revenue support grant payment to the authority.
nay: against requiring the Secretary of State to satisfy himself the resources available to a local authority are sufficient to meet the needs of the local authority when considering if to make a revenue support grant payment to the authority.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Schedule 1 - Any Distribution of Surplus Business Rate Levy on Basis of Need in Local Authroity Area
aye: to require any distribution of surplus money amassed via the business rate levy be made on the basis of need in the relevant local authority area.
nay: against requiring any distribution of surplus money amassed via the business rate levy be made on the basis of need in the relevant local authority area.

title: Opposition Day - The Economy, Bankers Bonuses and Job Creation
aye: for urgent action to kickstart the economy to promote jobs and growth, for a tax on bankers' bonuses and for the government to fund 100,000 jobs for young people.
nay: against urgent action to kickstart the economy to promote jobs and growth, against a tax on bankers' bonuses and against the government funding 100,000 jobs for young people.

title: Opposition Day - Groceries Code Adjudicator - Clarity of Pricing
aye: in favour of introducing a Groceries Code Adjudicator and working with retailers to provide more responsible, transparent price promotions and clearer unit pricing.
nay: against introducing a Groceries Code Adjudicator and against working with retailers to provide more responsible, transparent price promotions and clearer unit pricing.

title: Daylight Saving Bill - Clause 4 - Approval of Scottish Parliament and the Welsh Assembly Before Advancing Time in the UK by an Hour
aye: to require the approval of the Scottish Parliament and the Welsh Assembly before advancing time in the UK by an hour.
nay: against requiring the approval of the Scottish Parliament and the Welsh Assembly before advancing time in the UK by an hour.

title: Proceedural Motion - Daylight Saving Bill - Clause 4 - Motion to Bring Debate to a Close and Move to a Vote
aye: to close the debate on a series of amendments to the Daylight Saving Bill and move to a vote on if the approval of the Scottish Parliament and the Welsh Assembly ought be required before advancing time in the UK by an hour.
nay: against closing the debate on a series of amendments to the Daylight Saving Bill and move to a vote on if the approval of the Scottish Parliament and the Welsh Assembly ought be required before advancing time in the UK by an hour.

title: Daylight Saving Bill - Clause 1 - Report To Consider Advancing Summer Time Only
aye: to restrict consideration of changes to time in the UK to "advancing the period of summer time in the UK by an hour", as opposed to advancing time by an hour throughout the year.
nay: against restricting consideration of changes to time in the UK to "advancing the period of summer time in the UK by an hour", as opposed to advancing time by an hour throughout the year.

title: Proceedural Motion - Daylight Saving Bill - Motion to Bring Debate to a Close and Move to a Vote
aye: to bring debate on a series of amendments to the Daylight Saving Bill to a close and move to a vote.
nay: against bringing debate on a series of amendments to the Daylight Saving Bill to a close and moving to a vote.

title: Proceedural Motion - Stop Christopher Chope MP's Speech on Daylight Saving Time
aye: to stop MP Christopher Chope's speech on amendments to the Daylight Saving Bill which had been going on for about an hour.
nay: against stopping MP Christopher Chope's speech on amendments to the Daylight Saving Bill which had been going on for about an hour.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: New Standing Order - Consideration of Orders to Abolish, Merge or Modify Public Bodies
aye: in favour of a new House of Commons standing order which sets out which committee is charged with considering orders to abolish, merge or modify public bodies.
nay: against a new House of Commons standing order which sets out which committee is charged with considering orders to abolish, merge or modify public bodies.

title: European Union Documents - Connecting Europe Facility
aye: for the overall European Union budget to be reduced and for proposed spending on integrating transport, energy and communications networks within the European Union to be "reordered", as opposed to calling the proposed spending on this area "unacceptable".
nay: for the overall European Union budget to be reduced and to call proposed spending on integrating transport, energy and communications networks within the European Union "unacceptable" as opposed to calling for the proposals to be "reordered".

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Schedule 1 - Process for National vs Local Allocation of Business Rates
aye: for a more transparent process based on a published assessment of need for determining the national verses local share of business rates.
nay: against a more transparent process based on a published assessment of need for determining the national verses local share of business rates.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Schedule 1 - Considerations When Determining Local vs National Share of Business Rates
aye: to require the Secretary of State to consider need in a local authority area, the likely capacity for the authority to benefit from business rate growth, and the council tax base when determining the national verses local share of business rates that would apply to the area.
nay: against requiring the Secretary of State to consider need in a local authority area, the likely capacity for the authority to benefit from business rate growth, and the council tax base when determining the national verses local share of business rates that would apply to the area.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Clause 1 - Local Retention of Business Rates
aye: to delay  enabling local councils to keep money raised from business rates in their areas.
nay: against delaying enabling local councils to keep money raised from business rates in their areas.

title: NHS - Private Patient Income Cap
aye: to reduce the amount of income a NHS foundation trust is permitted to make from private patients.
nay: against reducing the amount of income a NHS foundation trust is permitted to make from private patients.

title: Opposition Day - Implementation of Individual Voter Registration
aye: to ask the Government to reconsider its plans for the implementation of Individual Voter Registration.
nay: in favour of the Government's plans for the implementation of Individual Voter Registration.

title: Opposition Day - Energy Prices
aye: in favour of a series of measures aimed at making energy bills more affordable, including extending benefits, reforming the energy market, reducing VAT on home improvements and reforming the Green Deal scheme.
nay: against a series of measures aimed at making energy bills more affordable, including extending benefits, reforming the energy market, reducing VAT on home improvements and reforming the Green Deal scheme.

title: Opposition Day - Rail and Bus Fares
aye: to prevent individual rail fares being increased by more than the amount of the Government's cap, which applied to average increases.
nay: to allow individual rail fares to be increased by more than the amount of the Government's cap on average increases.

title: Trade Unions - Refund of Pay to Employers for Hours Worked by Trade Union Officials on Union Business
aye: to require trade unions to refund employers in respect of hours trade union officials spent working on behalf of their union while being paid by their employer.
nay: against requiring trade unions to refund employers in respect of hours trade union officials spent working on behalf of their union while being paid by their employer.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Carry over to next Parliamentary session
aye: to allow local councils to retain a proportion of the business rates generated in their area and to localise assisting those in financial need to pay their council tax.
nay: against allowing ocal councils to retain a proportion of the business rates generated in their area and not to localise assisting those in financial need to pay their council tax.

title: Local Government Finance Bill (Money)
aye: to fund support paying council tax for those in financial need and to fund technical reforms to council tax
nay: against funding support paying council tax for those in financial need and against funding technical reforms to council tax

title: Local Government Finance Bill (Money)
aye: to fund support paying council tax for those in financial need and to fund technical reforms to council tax
nay: against funding support paying council tax for those in financial need and against funding technical reforms to council tax

title: Local Government Finance Bill (programme)
aye: to agree a proposed timetable for debating the Local Government Finance Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for debating the Local Government Finance Bill.

title: Local Government Finance Bill - Second reading
aye: to allow local councils to retain a proportion of the business rates generated in their area and to localise assisting those in financial need to pay their council tax.
nay: against allowing local councils to retain a proportion of the business rates generated in their area and not to localise assisting those in financial need to pay their council tax.

title: Opposition Day - Bank Bonuses - Jobs Guarantee - New Homes - VAT - Tax Incentives for Small Companies Employing More Workers
aye: to create 100,000 jobs and build 25,000 homes using funds raised via a bank bonus tax, to reduce VAT on home improvements and for tax breaks for small firms taking on new workers.
nay: against creating 100,000 jobs and building 25,000 homes using funds raised via a bank bonus tax, against reducing VAT on home improvements and against tax breaks for small firms taking on new workers.

title: Business of the House - Standing Orders on Carrying Over Finance and Appropriation Bills to a New Parliament
aye: to smooth the progress of finance bills through the House of Commons when they are carried over from one session of Parliament to the next.
nay: against smoothing the progress of finance bills through the House of Commons when they are carried over from one session of Parliament to the next.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Report (2nd Day)
Opposition Day - European Union
aye: to commend the Prime Minister for refusing to sign up to an EU Treaty without safeguards for the UK.
nay: not to commend the Prime Minister for refusing to sign up to an EU Treaty without safeguards for the UK.

title: Opposition Day - Public Sector Pensions
aye: against making public sector pensions less generous.
nay: in favour of making public sector pensions less generous.

title: London Local Authorities Bill - Clause 4 - Power to Require Name and Address for Council Officers, PCSOs and Accredited Individuals When Issuing FPNs
aye: against giving authorised council officers, PCSOs and accredited civilians the power to require an individual's name and address when issuing fixed penalty notices.
nay: to give authorised council officers, PCSOs and accredited civilians the power to require an individual's name and address when issuing fixed penalty notices.

title: Chancellor of the Exchequer - Consideration of The Economy
aye: to express a view that the House of Commons had considered the economy.
nay: to express a view that the House of Commons had not considered the economy.

title: Backbench Business - Ministerial Statements To Be Made to Parliament First
aye: to make clear Ministers are expected to make announcements to Parliament first and that serious breaches of the expectation should be investigated by the Committee on Standards and Privileges.
nay: against making clear Ministers are expected to make announcements to Parliament first and that serious breaches of the expectation should be investigated by the Committee on Standards and Privileges.

title: Opposition Day - Living Standards - Government Out of Touch - Living Standards
aye: to state a belief the Government is out of touch and its policies have squeezed living standards.
nay: against stating a belief the Government is out of touch and its policies have squeezed living standards.

title: Regulation of Hairdressers - Fines for Hairdressing Commercially Without a Licence
aye: to introduce greater regulation for hairdressers including fines for hairdressing commercially without a licence.
nay: against introducing greater regulation for hairdressers including fines for hairdressing commercially without a licence.

title: Public Bodies Bill - Schedule 5 - Power to Modify or Transfer Functions of Chief Coroner, Deputy Chief Coroner, and their Medical Advisers
aye: against allowing a Minister to, by order, modify or transfer the functions of the Chief Coroner, Deputy Chief Coroners, and their medical advisers; and to remove the route of appeal to a Chief Coroner in respect of specified decisions made by a senior coroner.
nay: to allow a Minister to, by order, modify or transfer the functions of the Chief Coroner, Deputy Chief Coroners, and their medical advisers; and against removing the route of appeal to a Chief Coroner in respect of specified decisions made by a senior coroner.

title: Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures Bill - Schedule 8 - Length of Transtional Period During Which Existing Control Orders Remain In Place
aye: for Control Orders in place when the Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures Bill comes into force to remain in place for 365 days, rather than 42 days, unless revoked or quashed.
nay: against Control Orders in place when the Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures Bill comes into force remaining in place for 365 days, rather than 42 days, unless revoked or quashed.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Opposition Day - Feed-in Tariff - Subsidies for Renewable or Low Carbon Electricity Generation
aye: in favour of proposed cuts to subsidies (feed-in-tariffs) for electricity produced from renewable or low-carbon techniques.
nay: against proposed cuts to subsidies (feed-in-tariffs) for electricity produced from renewable or low-carbon techniques.

title: Opposition Day - Feed-in Tariff - Subsidies for Renewable or Low Carbon Electricity Generation
aye: against cutting the subsidy for electricity generated via renewable or low-carbon methods on 12 December 2011 and against ensuring the future of the payments.
nay: in favour of cutting the subsidy for electricity generated via renewable or low-carbon methods on 12 December 2011 and against ensuring the future of the payments.

title: Opposition Day - Economic Growth and Employment
aye: to start long-term investment projects sooner, to reduce VAT on home improvements and repairs, and to give a tax break to small companies employing new workers.
nay: against starting long-term investment projects sooner, against reducing VAT on home improvements and repairs, and against giving a tax break to small companies employing new workers.

title: Deferred Division - Schengen Governance
aye: to support stronger governance of the Schengen area and adding Bulgaria and Romania to it.
nay: against stronger governance of the Schengen area and against adding Bulgaria and Romania to it.

title: Opposition Day - Pensioners and Winter Fuel Payments
aye: to requiring a review of the impact of decision on Winter Fuel Payments and VAT and to act to ease the burden on pensioner households.
nay: against requiring a review of the impact of decision on Winter Fuel Payments and VAT and to act to ease the burden on pensioner households.

title: Education Bill - Efforts of Chief Executive of Skills Funding to Secure Apprenticeship Training - Best or Reasonable
aye: to require the Chief Executive of Skills Funding make "best efforts" (rather than "reasonable efforts") to secure apprenticeship training for employees aged 19 and under.
nay: to require the Chief Executive of Skills Funding make "reasonable efforts" (rather than "best efforts") to secure apprenticeship training for employees aged 19 and under.

title: Education Bill - Clause 39 - Parliamentary Scrutiny of Exemptions for Schools from Inspections
aye: for stronger Parliamentary scrutiny of Ministers' first use of their powers to exempt schools from inspections.
nay: against stronger Parliamentary scrutiny of Ministers' first use of their powers to exempt schools from inspections.

title: Opposition Day - Bankers Bonuses - Jobs Guarantee - Reducing VAT - Tax Incentive for Small Firms to Take on Extra Workers
aye: to introduce a tax on bank bonuses to guarantee a job for 100,000 young people and build 25,000 affordable homes; to make investment sooner; to reducing VAT, and to introduce a tax break for small firms taking on extra workers.
nay: against introducing a tax on bank bonuses to guarantee a job for 100,000 young people and build 25,000 affordable homes; against making investment sooner; against reducing VAT, and  against a tax break for small firms taking on extra workers.

title: Border Checks Summer 2011 - Opposition Day Debate
aye: for the immediate publication of information relating to the relaxation of UK border controls in Summer 2011.
nay: against requiring the immediate publication of information relating to the relaxation of UK border controls in Summer 2011.

title: Localism Bill - Clause 94 - Abolition of Regional Strategies
aye: to require transitional arrangements where regional planning policies called regional strategies are abolished.
nay: against requiring transitional arrangements where regional planning policies called regional strategies are abolished.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill  - Third Reading
aye: to reform legal aid, including removing it from some types of cases, to reform sentencing, and remand and to introduce new offences relating to threatening with a weapon.
nay: against reforming reform legal aid, against removing it from some types of cases, against sentencing and remand reforms and not to introduce new offences relating to threatening with a weapon.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill  - Clause 41 - Regulation of No-Win No-Fee Arrangements
aye: to exempt defamation cases and privacy cases under the right to respect for private and family life from regulation, including caps, on success fees in no-win no-fee arrangements for charging for legal services.
nay: against exempting defamation cases and privacy cases under the right to respect for private and family life from regulation, including caps, on success fees in no-win no-fee arrangements for charging for legal services.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Clause 41 - Regulation of No-Win No-Fee Arrangements
aye: against increased regulation of no-win no-fee arrangements for charging for legal services including capping success fees.
nay: in favour of increased regulation no-win no-fee arrangements for charging for legal services including capping success fees.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Clause 12 - Legal Aid for Those in Custody
aye: not to make legal aid available to advise and assist those held in custody and not to provide the option for making such legal aid means tested in the future.
nay: to make legal aid available to fund advice and assistance for those held in custody and to provide the option for making such legal aid means tested in the future.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - New Clause 17 - Extension of Scope of Legal Aid
aye: to make legal aid available to cover the entirety of assistance required where people are deemed to have complex, interconnected needs, some of which do not usually attract aid.
nay: against making legal aid available to cover the entirety of assistance required where people are deemed to have complex, interconnected needs, some of which do not usually attract aid.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - New Clause 26 - Offence of Squatting in a Residential building
aye: to introduce a new offence of of squatting in a residential building.
nay: against introducing a new offence of of squatting in a residential building.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - New Clause 26 - Exemptions from Offence of Squatting in a Residential Building
aye: to exclude squatting in a building which has been empty for six months or more and where there are no significant steps being taken to refurbish, let or sell the building at the time of the trespass from a new offence of squatting in a residential building.
nay: not to exclude squatting in a building which has been empty for six months or more and where there are no significant steps being taken to refurbish, let or sell the building at the time of the trespass from a new offence of squatting in a residential building.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - New Clause 18 - Criminal Penalty for Breach of Personal Injury of Death Damages Claim Referral Fee Ban
aye: to introduce a criminal penalty for charging for a referral relating to legal services in connection with a claim or potential claim damages for personal injury or death.
nay: against introducing a criminal penalty for charging for a referral relating to legal services in connection with a claim or potential claim damages for personal injury or death.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - New Clause 30 - Abolition of Prison Sentences for Public Protection
aye: to abolish sentences of imprisonment for public protection.
nay: against abolishing sentences of imprisonment for public protection.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Schedule 1 - Legal Aid in Clinical Negligence Cases
aye: to make legal aid available in clinical negligence cases.
nay: against making legal aid available in clinical negligence cases.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Evidence of Domestic Abuse Used In Relation to Eligibility for Civil Legal Aid
aye: to explicitly list what counts as evidence of abuse in relation to he award of civil legal aid to domestic abuse victims.
nay: against explicitly listing what counts as evidence of abuse in relation to he award of civil legal aid to domestic abuse victims.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Definition of Domestic Abuse Used In Relation to Eligibility for Civil Legal Aid
aye: to explicitly include threats plus financial and emotional abuse in the definition of domestic abuse used in relation to the award of civil legal aid to domestic abuse victims.
nay: against explicitly including threats plus financial and emotional abuse in the definition of domestic abuse used in relation to the award of civil legal aid to domestic abuse victims.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Programme Amendment
aye: to make more time available to MPs for consideration of the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill.
nay: against making more time available to MPs for consideration of the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill.

title: Opposition Day - Jobs - Recycling - Infrastructure Investment
aye: to create jobs, invest in infrastructure and raise the UK's recycling target to 70%.
nay: against creating jobs, investing in infrastructure and raising the UK's recycling target to 70%.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Drop the Bill - Cross Party Talks on NHS Commissioning
aye: to drop the Health and Social Care Bill and to enter cross party talks on reforming NHS commissioning.
nay: against dropping the Health and Social Care Bill and against entering cross party talks on reforming NHS commissioning.

title: Public Bodies Bill - Third Reading
aye: to give ministers powers to abolish, merge or transfer the functions of certain public bodies.
nay: against giving ministers powers to abolish, merge or transfer the functions of certain public bodies.

title: Public Bodies Bill - Schedule 1 - Power to Modify or Transfer Functions of Chief Coroner, Deputy Chief Coroner, and their Medical Advisers
aye: against allowing a Minister to, by order, modify or transfer the functions of the Chief Coroner, Deputy Chief Coroners, Medical Advisers to the Chief Coroner and Deputy Medical Advisers to the Chief Coroner.
nay: to allow a Minister to, by order, modify or transfer the functions of the Chief Coroner, Deputy Chief Coroners, Medical Advisers to the Chief Coroner and Deputy Medical Advisers to the Chief Coroner.

title: Public Bodies Bill - Schedule 1 - Power to Abolish Youth Justice Board for England and Wales
aye: not to give a minister the power to abolish the Youth Justice Board for England and Wales.
nay: to give a minister the power to abolish the Youth Justice Board for England and Wales.

title: Public Bodies Bill - Schedule 1 - Power to Abolish Agricultural Wages Board
aye: not to give a minister the power to abolish the Agricultural Wages Board for England and Wales.
nay: to give a minister the power to abolish the Agricultural Wages Board for England and Wales

title: National Referendum on the United Kingdom's Membership of the European Union
aye: for a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union
nay: against a referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the European Union

title: Education Bill - Report (2nd Day) - fair access to opportunity for education
Education Bill - Report (2nd Day) - requirement for students to get careers guidance by qualified person
Equality and Diversity (Reform) Bill - Second Reading - Positive Discrimination
aye: to prohibit positive discrimination by public bodies in relation to recruitment and by political parties seeking to reduce inequality in the numbers of men and women elected.
nay: in favour of positive discrimination by public bodies in relation to recruitment and by political parties seeking to reduce inequality in the numbers of men and women elected.

title: Armed Forces Bill  - Allow Medals Awarded by Commonwealth Governments to be Worn Without Restriction
aye: to allow the wearing, without restriction, of medals awarded by Commonwealth Governments to present or former members of Her Majesty’s armed forces and other Crown servants.
nay: against allowing the wearing, without restriction, of medals awarded by Commonwealth Governments to present or former members of Her Majesty’s armed forces and other Crown servants.

title: House of Commons Recess Dates - Winter 2011-12
aye: to approve a series House of Commons recess dates for Winter 2011-12.
nay: against a proposed series of House of Commons recess dates for Winter 2011-12.

title: Pensions Bill - Third Reading
aye: to accelerate raising the state pension age to 66, amend the rules on enrollment to occupational pensions and to take a pension contribution from judges' pay.
nay: against accelerating raising the state pension age to 66, against amending the rules on enrollment to occupational pensions and against taking a pension contribution from judges' pay.

title: Pensions Bill - Clause 1 - Accelerate Transition to Pensionable Age for Men and Women
aye: against accelerating the transition to an equal pension age for men and women.
nay: to accelerate the transition to an equal pension age for men and women.

title: Use of Hand-held Electronic Devices and Social Media in the Chamber (Backbench Business)
aye: against allowing MPs to tweet from the commons chamber.
nay: to allow MPs to tweet from the commons chamber.

title: Opposition Day - Jobs and Growth
aye: to create more jobs for young people, funded by bank bonuses, to make planned investment sooner, to reduce VAT and for a tax break for small firms taking on extra workers.
nay: against creating more jobs for young people, funded by bank bonuses, making planned investment sooner, reducing VAT and a tax break for small firms taking on extra workers.

title: First-tier Tribunal (Immigration and Asylum Chamber) Fees Order 2011 - Fees for Appealing Immigration Decisions
aye: to introduce fees for appealing many immigration decisions.
nay: against introducing fees for appealing many immigration decisions.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - select comittee to scrutinise Bill
Health and Social Care Bill - Reject at Second Reading
European Union Financial Stability
aye: to note a number of documents related to European financial stability, to welcome steps towards economic recovery in Ireland and Portugal and to welcome the replacement of the European Financial Stabilisation Mechanism with a Euro-area only Stability Mechanism.
nay: against noting a number of documents related to European financial stability, against welcoming steps towards economic recovery in Ireland and Portugal and against welcoming the replacement of the European Financial Stabilisation Mechanism with a Euro-area only Stability Mechanism.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Third Reading - DNA Retention, Clamping, CCTV, FOI Datasets
aye: for a series of measures including requiring the police to destroy fingerprints and DNA taken in certain circumstances; to introduce a CCTV code of practice; to ban wheel clamping on private land; and to make new Freedom of Information provisions for datasets.
nay: against a series of measures including requiring the police to destroy fingerprints and DNA taken in certain circumstances; against introducing a CCTV code of practice; against banning wheel clamping on private land and against new Freedom of Information provisions for datasets.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Clause 66 - Alteration of Test for Barring Decisions
aye: to continue automatically placing those convicted of serious offences against children on the Independent Barring Board's Barred lists which enable schools etc. to find out about their history.
nay: to stop automatically placing those convicted of serious offences against children on the Independent Barring Board's Barred lists which enable schools etc. to find out about their history.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - New Clause 18 - Independent Safeguarding Authority Barred List Information On Enhanced Criminal Records Certificates
aye: to include if an individual is on a barred list maintained by the Independent Safeguarding Authority in relation to work with vulnerable adults or children on an enhanced criminal record certificate.
nay: against including if an individual is on a barred list maintained by the Independent Safeguarding Authority in relation to work with vulnerable adults or children on an enhanced criminal record certificate.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill -  Report on use of CCTV for Crime Prevention and Detection
aye: to require a report on the use of CCTV for the prevention and detection of crime.
nay: against requiring a report on the use of CCTV for the prevention and detection of crime.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - New Clause 15 - Offence of Issuing Excess Parking Charges
aye: for greater regulation of charges and fines in private car parks.
nay: against greater regulation of charges and fines in private car parks.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Clause 20 - National Security: Appointment of Commissioner
aye: to require a report, produced after consultation with the Association of Chief Police Officers, and approved by both Houses of Parliament, prior to the appointment of a Commissioner for the Retention and Use of Biometric Material.
nay: against requiring a report, produced after consultation with the Association of Chief Police Officers, and approved by both Houses of Parliament, prior to the appointment of a Commissioner for the Retention and Use of Biometric Material.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Clause 3 - Retention of DNA and Fingerprint Information
aye: not to allow ministers to make orders on when DNA or fingerprints can be retained for up to three years.
nay: against allowing ministers to make orders on when DNA or fingerprints can be retained for up to three years.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Programme
aye: to approve a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Protection of Freedoms Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Protection of Freedoms Bill.

title: Protection of Freedoms Bill - Amendment to Programme Motion
aye: for more time to consider amendments to the Public Order Act, including reducing the scope of offence of causing harassment, alarm or distress.
nay: against more time to consider amendments to the Public Order Act, including reducing the scope of offence of causing harassment, alarm or distress.

title: Energy Bill - Clause 42 - Bring Forward Date Landlords of Private Rented Homes Must Follow Domestic Energy Efficiency Regulations
aye: to require landlords of private rented homes to make their properties meet regulations on energy efficiency by January 2016 rather than April 2018 as initially proposed.
nay: against requiring landlords of private rented homes to make their properties meet regulations on energy efficiency by January 2016 rather than April 2018 as initially proposed.

title: Energy Bill - Clause 42 - Energy Efficiency Requirement for Landlords of Private Rental Properties
aye: for a law setting out the energy efficiency improvements landlords of private rental properties are required to make (rather than just setting a required level of energy efficiency).
nay: against a law setting out the energy efficiency improvements landlords of private rental properties are required to make (preferring to just set a required level of energy efficiency).

title: Energy Bill - New Clause 1 - Purpose of Green Deal Loans
aye: to explain in law the purpose of the Green Deal system of loans for energy efficiency improvements to be repaid by future bill-payers for the property.
nay: against explaining in law the purpose of the Green Deal system of loans for energy efficiency improvements to be repaid by future bill-payers for the property.

title: European Union Directive - Access to a Lawyer
aye: against an EU Directive on the right of access to a lawyer in criminal proceedings and on the right to communicate upon arrest
nay: in favour of an EU Directive on the right of access to a lawyer in criminal proceedings and on the right to communicate upon arrest

title: Opposition Day  - Guaranteed Face-to-Face Careers Advice for All Young People in Schools
aye: for guaranteed face-to-face careers advice for all young people in schools.
nay: against guaranteed face-to-face careers advice for all young people in schools.

title: Opposition Day - Bank Bonus Tax - Jobs - Homes - VAT - Apprenticeships
aye: for a tax on bank bonuses to be spent on creating 100,000 jobs and building 25,000 affordable homes; for increased funding to support businesses; for more apprenticeships; and for a VAT cut.
nay: against a tax on bank bonuses to be spent on creating 100,000 jobs and building 25,000 affordable homes; against increased funding to support businesses; against more apprenticeships; and against a VAT cut.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Schedule 8 - Threshold for Police and Crime Panel Veto of Chief Constable Appointment
aye: against setting the threshold proportion of Police and Crime Panel members required to vote to veto the appointment of a Chief Constable at two-thirds rather than three-quarters.
nay: to set the threshold proportion of Police and Crime Panel members required to vote to veto the appointment of a Chief Constable at two-thirds rather than three-quarters.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Clause 1 - Police and Crime Commissioners
aye: to introduce directly elected Police and Crime Commissioners and to reject an alternative of Police and Crime Panels electing commissioners from among their number.
nay: against directly elected Police and Crime Commissioners and in favour instead of Police and Crime Panels electing commissioners from among their number.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Clause 1 - Police and Crime Commissioners
aye: in favour of introducing elected police and crime commissioners for each police area in England and Wales outside of London.
nay: against introducing elected police and crime commissioners for each police area in England and Wales outside of London.

title: Legislation (Territorial Extent) Bill - Third Reading - Impact of Bills on Each Part of the United Kingdom
aye: for the legal and financial effect of draft Bills on each part of the United Kingdom to be separately and clearly identified.
nay: against the legal and financial effect of draft Bills on each part of the United Kingdom being separately and clearly identified.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Parliamentary Approval of General Election Date - Committee to Review Operation
aye: against requiring a motion approved by a simple majority of both houses Parliament to initiate a general election and for a committee to review the operation of the Fixed Term Parliaments Bill in lieu of proposals to make key provisions of the Bill expire after the next election.
nay: to require a motion approved by a simple majority of both houses Parliament to initiate a general election and voted against a committee to review the operation of the Fixed Term Parliaments Bill in lieu of proposals to make key provisions of the Bill expire after the next election.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Third Reading
aye: to support proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.
nay: against proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Transfer of Responsibilities on Abolition of Strategic Health Authorities
aye: to require the Secretary of State be satisfied the workforce education and training functions of strategic health authorities are being fulfilled by another body before abolishing the authorities.
nay: against requiring the Secretary of State be satisfied the workforce education and training functions of strategic health authorities are being fulfilled by another body before abolishing the authorities.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Should Secretary of State for Health "Secure" or "Provide or Secure" Services
aye: for a law saying the Secretary of State must "provide or secure" rather than just "secure" the provision of services under the Health and Social Care Bill.
nay: for a law saying the Secretary of State must "secure" rather than "provide or secure: the provision of services under the Health and Social Care Bill.

title: Health and Social Care Bill 2011 - Independent Abortion Advice
aye: to require independent advice be made available to women requesting an abortion.
nay: against a proposal to require independent advice be made available to women requesting an abortion.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Clause 168 - Private Patient Income Cap
aye: to continue restricting the amount of income a foundation trust can earn from private charges, known as the "private patient income cap".
nay: to remove the restriction on the amount of income a foundation trust can earn from private charges, known as the "private patient income cap".

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Establishment of the Health Service Regulator - Monitor
aye: against creating the health service regulator, Monitor.
nay: in favour of creating the health service regulator, Monitor.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - New Clause 2 - Powers and Responsibilities of the Health Service Regulator - Monitor
aye: to give the health service regulator,  Monitor, powers to require information and co-operation from those it regulates and to publish guidance and maintain a risk assessment when it imposes conditions on a licensed health service provider.
nay: against giving the health service regulator,  Monitor, powers to require information and co-operation from those it regulates and against requiring Monitor to publish guidance and maintain a risk assessment when it imposes conditions on a licensed health service provider.

title: Health and Social Care Bill (Programme) (No. 3)
aye: to approve an amendment to the timetable for their consideration of the Health and Social Care Bill.
nay: against an amendment to the timetable for their consideration of the Health and Social Care Bill.

title: Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures Bill - Third Reading
aye: to abolish control orders and introduce Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures(TPIMs) as a means to protect the public from those believed to be terrorists but who cannot be prosecuted.
nay: against abolishing control orders and introducing Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures(TPIMs) as a means to protect the public from those believed to be terrorists but who cannot be prosecuted.

title: Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures Bill - Clause 27 - Any Additional Resources Required for Switch From Control Orders to TPIMs
aye: to require reports on, and confirmation of the provision of, any extra resources required as a result of abolishing control orders and replacing them with Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures (TPIMs) prior to making the change.
nay: against requiring reports on, and confirmation of the provision of, any extra resources required as a result of abolishing control orders and replacing them with Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures (TPIMs) prior to making the change.

title: Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures Bill - New Clause 1 - Relocation of Terrorist Suspects
aye: to allow a Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures notice to require an individual reside at any location in the UK.
nay: against allowing a Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures notice to require an individual reside at any location in the UK.

title: Closure of Debate - Establishment of Joint Committee to Consider Draft Financial Services Bill
aye: to bring a debate on the establishment of a Joint Committee of Lords and Commons to consider the draft Financial Services Bill to a close.
nay: against bringing a debate on the establishment of a Joint Committee of Lords and Commons to consider the draft Financial Services Bill to a close.

title: Suspension of Standing Order on Deferred Divisions to Prior to a Motion Appointing a Joint Bill Committee
aye: to suspend the House of Commons' rules on deferring contested votes after a certain point in the day
nay: against suspending the House of Commons' rules on deferring contested votes after a certain point in the day

title: Programme Motion to Continue Debate on the Establishment of the Draft Financial Services Bill (Joint Committee)
aye: to continue to debate the establishment of the Draft Financial Services Bill (Joint Committee) until any hour rather than stopping at the previously agreed time.
nay: against continuing to debate the establishment of the Draft Financial Services Bill (Joint Committee) until any hour preferring to stop at the previously agreed time.

title: National Planning Policy Statement for Nuclear Power Generation
aye: to approve the principle of building new nuclear power stations on sites at Bradwell, Hartlepool, Heysham, Hinkley Point, Oldbury, Sizewell, Sellafield and Wylfa.
nay: against the principle of building new nuclear power stations on sites at Bradwell, Hartlepool, Heysham, Hinkley Point, Oldbury, Sizewell, Sellafield and Wylfa.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Report - Parliament Square committee
Sovereign Grant Bill - Clause 7 - Review Sovereign Grant Caluculation If Crown Estate Income Rises Faster than GDP
aye: to review of the amount paid by taxpayers to the Royal Household if the Crown Estate income, on which the amount of the payment is based, is rising faster than GDP.
nay: against prompting a review of the amount paid by taxpayers to the Royal Household if the Crown Estate income, on which the amount of the payment is based, is rising faster than GDP.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Report - alcohol monitoring requirements for Youth Rehabilitiation Orders
Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 1 - Both Houses of Parliament to Approve General Election Date
aye: against requiring a resolution of both Houses of Parliament to approve the date of a general election.
nay: to require a resolution of both Houses of Parliament to approve the date of a general election.

title: Youth Employment Bill - Youth Training and Employment - Bank Bonus Budget Tax
aye: in favour of providing more  training and employment opportunities for unemployed young people between the ages of 16 and 25, supported by payments from banks out of their bonus budgets.
nay: against providing more  training and employment opportunities for unemployed young people between the ages of 16 and 25, supported by payments from banks out of their bonus budgets.

title: Equality Act 2010 (Specific Duties) Regulations 2011 - Publication of Equality Objectives by Specified Public Bodies
aye: to require specified public bodies to publish objectives in relation to their duties to promote equality.
nay: against requiring specified public bodies to publish objectives in relation to their duties to promote equality.

title: Equality Act 2010 (Work on Ships and Hovercraft) Regulations 2011 - Application of Discrimination Laws to Mariners
aye: to apply laws against work related discrimination to mariners.
nay: against applying laws against work related discrimination to mariners.

title: European Union Bill - Suspension of Requirement for Referendum on Certain EU Decisions
aye: to allow the suspension of the requirement for a referendum on decisions which increase the powers and competencies of the EU. This wouldn't apply to amendments to the core treaties of the EU.
nay: against allowing the suspension of the requirement for a referendum on decisions which increase the powers and competencies of the EU, other than amendments to the core treaties of the EU.

title: European Union Bill - Minister Empowered to Determine Referendum on Increased EU Powers and Competences Not Required
aye: to allow a Minister to decide a decision to increase the powers and competencies of the EU is not of major economic and constitutional significance and so does not warrant a referendum.
nay: against allowing a Minister to decide a decision to increase the powers and competencies of the EU is not of major economic and constitutional significance and so does not warrant a referendum.

title: Public Bodies Bill - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Public Bodies Bill.
nay: against favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Public Bodies Bill.

title: Public Bodies Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against enabling ministers to abolish, merge or transfer the functions of the public bodies.
nay: to enable ministers to abolish, merge or transfer the functions of the public bodies.

title: Draft International Monetary Fund (Increase in Subscription) Order 2011,
aye: to increase the UK's maximum financial commitment to the International Monetary Fund from around £10.54 billion to £19.77 billion.
nay: against increasing the UK's maximum financial commitment to the International Monetary Fund from around £10.54 billion to £19.77 billion.

title: European Union Bill - New Sunset Clause - rejected
aye: against requiring each new Parliament to reaffirm the key provisions within the European Union Bill.
nay: to require each new Parliament to reaffirm the key provisions within the European Union Bill.

title: European Union Bill - Clause 18 - Status of EU law dependent on continuing statutory basis
aye: against a declaration that all EU law which takes effect in the UK does so by virtue of the European Communities Act 1972, saying instead it can come into force via any Act of the UK Parliament.
nay: to include in the European Union Bill a declaration that EU law takes effect in the UK by virtue of the European Communities Act 1972.

title: Finance Bill - Third Reading
aye: in favour of the measures in the 2011 Budget including reducing the threshold for paying higher rate income tax, increasing the income tax free personal allowance, reducing corporation tax and reducing the main rate of corporation tax from 27 to 26%.
nay: against measures in the 2011 Budget including reducing the threshold for paying higher rate income tax, increasing the income tax free personal allowance, reducing corporation tax and reducing the main rate of corporation tax from 27 to 26%.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 78 - Report on Impact of Reform of Taxation on Fossil Fuels for Generating Electricity
aye: to require a report on the expected impact of changes before reforming the taxation of fossil fuels for generating electricity.
nay: against requiring a report on the expected impact of changes before reforming the taxation of fossil fuels for generating electricity.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 73 - Financial Transaction Tax
aye: to require the chancellor to review the possibility of introducing a financial transaction tax and how the revenue raised could be spent on tackling unemployment and reducing poverty.
nay: against requiring the chancellor to review the possibility of introducing a financial transaction tax and how the revenue raised could be spent on tackling unemployment and reducing poverty

title: Finance Bill - Clause 73 - Tax on Bankers' Bonuses
aye: to require the chancellor to review the possibility of reintroducing a tax on bankers' bonuses and how the revenue raised could be spent on tackling unemployment.
nay: against requiring the chancellor to review the possibility of reintroducing a tax on bankers' bonuses and how the revenue raised could be spent on tackling unemployment.

title: Finance Bill - Report on Operation of 50 percent Income Tax Rate and Impact on Economy
aye: to require a report on the operation of the 50 percent rate of income tax, and its impact on the economy.
nay: against requiring a report on the operation of the 50 percent rate of income tax, and its impact on the economy.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 11 - High cost credit lending
aye: to require a review of taxation affecting high cost credit lending.
nay: against requiring a review of taxation affecting high cost credit lending.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill  - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for consideration of the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for consideration of the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill.

title: Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Bill - Second Reading
aye: to reform legal aid, including removing it from some types of cases, to reform sentencing, and remand and to introduce new offences relating to threatening with a weapon.
nay: against reforming reform legal aid, against removing it from some types of cases, against sentencing and remand reforms and not to introduce new offences relating to threatening with a weapon.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 10 - VAT
aye: for an assessment of the impact of the rate of VAT on the UK's economic growth.
nay: to reject a proposal to assess the impact of the rate of VAT on the UK's economic growth.

title: Value Added Tax (Change of Rate) Order 2011
aye: to decrease the main rate of VAT by 2.5% to 17.5%.
nay: not to decrease the main rate of VAT by 2.5% to 17.5% for one year as of the 30th of August 2011.

title: Finance Bill - New Clause 5 - Transfer of personal allowances between spouses
aye: to allow people to transfer their unused personal tax allowance to their spouse(s).
nay: against allowing people to transfer their unused personal tax allowance to their spouse(s).

title: Establishment of Draft House of Lords Reform Bill (Joint Committee)
aye: to establish a Joint Committee of MPs and Members of the House of Lords to consider proposals to reform the House of Lords
nay: against the establishment of a Joint Committee of MPs and Members of the House of Lords to consider proposals to reform the House of Lords

title: Opposition Day - The Economy
aye: to express support for the Government's economic policy
nay: against the Government's economic policy

title: Opposition Day - The Economy
aye: to reduce the deficit over a longer period, to cut VAT to 17.5%, to repeat the 2010 bank bonus tax, to build 25,000 affordable homes and create 100,000 jobs for young people.
nay: against Labour proposals to reduce the deficit over a longer period, to cut VAT to 17.5%, to repeat the 2010 bank bonus tax, to build 25,000 affordable homes and create 100,000 jobs for young people.

title: Ban on Smoking in Private Vehicles
aye: for a ban on smoking in private vehicles where there are children present.
nay: against a ban on smoking in private vehicles where there are children present.

title: Scotland Bill - Chapter 5 - Empower Scottish Parliament to Tax Company Profits
aye: to allow the Scottish Parliament to tax the profits of companies.
nay: against allowing the Scottish Parliament to tax the profits of companies.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Re-committal
aye: for the re-committal of the Health and Social Care Bill to its Public Bill Committee, restarting its consideration by Parliament after a pause which had occurred.
nay: against the re-committal of the Health and Social Care Bill to its Public Bill Committee

title: Devolving Responsibility for Jobcentre Plus to the Welsh Government
aye: to devolve responsibility for Jobcentre Plus to the Welsh Government.
nay: against devolving responsibility for Jobcentre Plus to the Welsh Government.

title: Pensions Bill 2010/11 - Second Reading
aye: to accelerate raising the state pension age to 66, amend the rules on enrollment to occupational pensions and to take a pension contribution from judges' pay.
nay: against accelerating raising the state pension age to 66, against amending the rules on enrollment to occupational pensions and against taking a pension contribution from judges' pay.

title: Employment Opportunities Bill - Second Reading - Removal of Restrictions on Foreign Nationals Working - Allow Opt-Out from Minimum Wage
aye: to remove restrictions on working applied to foreign nationals lawfully resident in the UK and to allow people to opt out from an entitlement to the national minimum wage.
nay: against removing restrictions on working applied to foreign nationals lawfully resident in the UK and against allowing people to opt out from an entitlement to the national minimum wage.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Third Reading
aye: to introduce Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payments and to restrict housing benefit for those in social housing deemed to have excess bedrooms.
nay: against introducing Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payments and against restricting housing benefit for those in social housing deemed to have excess bedrooms.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 83 - Personal Independence Payment Eligibility - Hospital In-Patient and Care Home Residents
aye: for a proposed change to eligibility for personal independence payments for hospital in-patients and those in care homes.
nay: against a proposed change to eligibility for personal independence payments for hospital in-patients and those in care homes.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 79 - Personal Independence Payment - Qualifying Period
aye: to reduce the period claimants with health conditions must wait before they are eligible for personal independence payments from from six to three months.
nay: not to reduce the period claimants with health conditions must wait before they are eligible for personal independence payments from from six to three months.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 69 - Ending of discretionary payments
aye: to require details of a replacement scheme for providing emergency help from the benefits system, before abolishing discretionary payments out of the Social Fund.
nay: not to require details of a replacement scheme for providing emergency help from the benefits system, before abolishing discretionary payments out of the Social Fund.

title: European Union Bill - Expiry of Provisions Requiring Referendum Before Tranfering UK Powers to the EU
aye: for the provisions requiring a referendum prior to transferring further powers from the UK to the EU to expire at the end of each Parliament.
nay: against the provisions requiring a referendum prior to transferring further powers from the UK to the EU expiring at the end of each Parliament.

title: European Union Bill - Mechanism of EU Law Taking Effect in the UK
aye: to state EU law takes effect in the UK specifically via the European Communities Act 1972; rather than stating it does so via "an Act of Parliament".
nay: to state EU law takes effect in the UK via via "an Act of Parliament" rather than specifically saying it does so via the European Communities Act 1972.

title: Armed Forces Bill - New Clause 17 - Special Health, Housing and Education Provisions for Service Personnel
aye: to require public bodies and minsters to consider the effects of people's service in the armed forces when setting healthcare, education and housing policy and to consider if special provisions for current, and former, service personnel are justified.
nay: against requiring public bodies and minsters to consider the effects of people's service in the armed forces when setting healthcare, education and housing policy and to consider if special provisions for current, and former, service personnel are justified.

title: Armed Forces Bill - New Clause 15 - Regional Defence Spending and Employment Statistics
aye: to require the publication of defence spending and estimates of defence related employment by UK region.
