nay: against a proposal to require the publication of defence spending and estimates of defence related employment by UK region.

title: Armed Forces Bill - Clause 2 - Armed Forces Covenant Report - Minister for Former Armed Services Personnel
aye: to require a Minister for Former Armed Services Personnel, rather than the Secretary of State for Defence, to report each year on the armed forces covenant.
nay: against requiring a Minister for Former Armed Services, rather than the Secretary of State for Defence, Personnel to report each year on the armed forces covenant.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Schedule 1 - Universal credit - Income from Self Employment
aye: in favour of an attempt to require people’s actual income from self employment be used to assess their eligibility for Universal Credit.
nay: against an attempt to require people’s actual income from self employment be used to assess their eligibility for Universal Credit.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Clause 5 - Exclusion of Up to Fifty Thousand Pounds in an ISA from Capital Used to Determine Universal Credit Eligibility
aye: to exclude up to fifty thousand pounds in an ISA from the assessment of capital used to determine if someone in work is eligible for Universal Credit.
nay: against a proposal to exclude up to fifty thousand pounds in an ISA from the assessment of capital used to determine if someone in work is eligible for Universal Credit.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - New Clause 2 - Childcare Element in Universal Credit
aye: to introduce a childcare element to Universal Credit.
nay: against introducing a childcare element to Universal Credit.

title: European Union Bill - Requirement of Referendum Prior to the UK Adopting the Euro
aye: to require a referendum prior to the UK adopting the Euro as its currency.

title: European Union Bill - Requirement for Referendum on Decisions Under Existing Treaties - Joining Euro - Border Controls - EU Prosecutor's Office
aye: not to require a referendum prior to making the Euro the UK's currency, the UK joining the European Public Prosecutor’s Office, or changes impacting the UK's border controls, or other decisions made within existing existing European Union treaties.
nay: to require a referendum prior to making the Euro the UK's currency, the UK joining the European Public Prosecutor’s Office, or changes impacting the UK's border controls, or other decisions made within existing existing European Union treaties.

title: Opposition Day - Pension Age for Women - Policies Widening Inequality Between Men and Women
aye: against raising the state pension age for women sooner than 2020 and for independent research on the impact of Government policies on women which could widen inequality between women and men.
nay: to increase the state pension age for women sooner than 2020 and against independent research on the impact of Government policies on women which could widen inequality between women and men.

title: European Union Bill - Report (1st Day) - Clause 2 - Treaties amending or replacing TEU or TFEU
aye: to allow a Parliamentary committee to deny a referendum following the passing of an Act approving the transfer of powers from the UK to the EU.
nay: for a referendum following the passing of an Act approving the transfer of powers from the UK to the EU; and against allowing a Parliamentary Committee to deny such a referendum.

title: European Union Bill - Inconsequential wording change : supporting to permitting
aye: to make an inconsequential change to the wording of the European Union Bill.
nay: against making an inconsequential change to the wording of the European Union Bill.

title: Royal Assent - Eurozone Financial Assistance
aye: to dilute proposed opposition to EU bailouts of countries in financial trouble.
nay: strongly against EU bailouts of countries in financial trouble.

title: Opposition Day - Police and Crime Commissioners
aye: against introducing Police and Crime Commissioners to provide strategic direction for, and oversight of, police forces.
nay: in favour of introducing Police and Crime Commissioners to provide strategic direction for, and oversight of, police forces.

title: Opposition Day - Sentencing - Discount for Guilty Plea
aye: against a discount of up to 50% on a custodial sentence in return for a guilty plea.
nay: in favour of a discount of up to 50% on a custodial sentence in return for a guilty plea.

title: Localism Bill - Third Reading
aye: to devolve more powers to local councils and local people particularly in relation to social housing and planning.
nay: against devolving more powers to local councils and local people particularly in relation to social housing and planning.

title: Localism Bill - Clause 130 - Flexible Tenancies - Safeguards for Exsiting Secure Tenancies
aye: for safeguards preventing the conversion of secure tenancies to new "Flexible" tenancies.
nay: against safeguards preventing the conversion of secure tenancies to new "Flexible" tenancies.

title: Localism Bill - Clause 130 - Flexible Tenancies
aye: to introduce a new type of fixed term tenancies called flexible tenancies.
nay: against introducing a new type of fixed term tenancies called flexible tenancies.

title: Localism Bill - Clause 168 - Designation of Mayoral Development Areas
aye: to only allow  the Mayor of London to designate a Mayoral development area if the majority of councils covering the area agree to the designation.
nay: against only allowing the Mayor of London to designate a Mayoral development area if the majority of councils covering the area agree to the designation.

title: Localism Bill - Clause 90 - Production of  Joint Infrastructure Planning Guidance
aye: to be more prescriptive about the collaborative process for producing Joint Infrastructure Planning Guidance.
nay: against being more prescriptive about the collaborative process for producing Joint Infrastructure Planning Guidance.

title: Localism Bill - New Clause 31 - Planning Permission for Betting Shops
aye: to make specific planning permission be required for betting shops rather than allowing any premises with permission for use for financial and professional services to become a betting shop.
nay: against making specific planning permission be required for betting shops rather than allowing any premises with permission for use for financial and professional services to become a betting shop.

title: Localism Bill - New Clause 29 - Retail Diversity Scheme
aye: to enable councils to protect retail diversity.
nay: against enabling councils to protect retail diversity.

title: Localism Bill  - New Clause 15 - Clarification Local Finance Considerations Can Be Taken Into Account When Determining Planning Application
aye: to clarify that taxes to be levied on a development, or government funding, can be taken into account when determining a planning application.
nay: against clarifying that taxes to be levied on a development, or government funding, can be taken into account when determining a planning application.

title: Localism Bill - Schedule 2 - Power for Secretary of State to Impose Change to Mayor and Cabinet Executive
aye: against the Secretary of State having the power to implement change a local council's system of governance to a mayor and cabinet executive.
nay: for the Secretary of State to have the power to implement change a local council's system of governance to a mayor and cabinet executive.

title: Localism Bill - Schedule 2 - Allowing Voters to Express a Second Preference When Electing Mayors
aye: to declare the candidate with the most votes the winner of mayoral elections rather than allowing people to express a second preference vote which would get taken into account if no candidate obtained over half of the first preference votes.
nay: to allow people to express a second preference when voting for mayors which would get taken into account if no candidate obtained over half of the first preference votes; rejecting the alternative of not allowing a second preference to be expressed and declaring the candidate with the most votes the winner.

title: Localism Bill - Clause 5 - Power for Secretary of State to Repeal Laws Conflicting with General Power of Competence for Local Government
aye: to limit the power of the Secretary of State to repeal laws considered to detract from the general power of competence for local authorities.

title: Regulatory Authorities (Level of Charges) Bill - Second Reading
aye: to stop regulatory bodies increasing fees above the rate of inflation and to require any additional charges by regulatory authorities be approved by Parliament.
nay: not to stop regulatory bodies increasing fees above the rate of inflation and not to require any additional charges by regulatory authorities be approved by Parliament.

title: Education Bill - Third Reading
aye: for more academy schools, free early education for 3 and 4 year olds, restricting reporting on allegations against teachers, and to abolish five education related quangos.
nay: against more academy schools, free early education for 3 and 4 year olds, restricting reporting on allegations against teachers, and to abolish five education related quangos.

title: Education Bill - Clause 34 - Role of Local Authority in Implementation of Decisions by School Admissions Adjudicator
aye: to give local councils more powers in relation to school admissions.
nay: not to give local councils more powers in relation to school admissions.

title: Education Bill - New Clause 9 - Requirement to achieve specified standard: suppliers of careers guidance
aye: to require school governing bodies and head teachers comply with standards set out by the Secretary of State in relation to the provision of independent careers guidance.
nay: not to require school governing bodies and head teachers comply with standards set out by the Secretary of State in relation to the provision of independent careers guidance.

title: NHS Reforms - Market Based Approach
aye: for a fundamental change to the Government's plans for NHS reforms and to drop the proposed market-based approach.
nay: against fundamentally changing the Government's plans for NHS reforms including dropping the proposed market-based approach.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 10 - Report on Capital Allowance Changes
aye: to require a report on the effect of changes to capital allowances (the amount spent on assets which can be written off against profits for Corporation Tax purposes).
nay: against requiring a report on the effect of changes to capital allowances (the amount spent on assets which can be written off against profits for Corporation Tax purposes).

title: Sex Education (Required Content) Bill
aye: to require additional sex education for girls aged 13 - 16, including information and advice on the benefits of abstinence from sexual activity.
nay: against requiring additional sex education for girls aged 13 - 16, including information and advice on the benefits of abstinence from sexual activity.

title: Section 5 of the European Communities (Amendment) Act 1993 - Financial and Economic Outlook
aye: to express approval for the Government’s assessment of the UK’s economic and budgetary outlook as outlined in the pre-Budget report by the Office for Budget Responsibility.
nay: against expressing  approval for the Government’s assessment of the UK’s economic and budgetary outlook as outlined in the pre-Budget report by the Office for Budget Responsibility.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 7 - Increase Tax Rate For Companies Producing Oil and Gas from 20% to 32%
aye: to increase the tax rate applying to companies producing oil and gas in the UK and on the UK Continental Shelf from 20% to 32%.
nay: against increasing the tax rate applying to companies producing oil and gas in the UK and on the UK Continental Shelf from 20% to 32%.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 7 - Report on Impact of System of Taxation of Oil and Gas Production on Investment and Sustainability Particularly of North Sea Operations
aye: to require a report on the impact of the tax arrangements for oil and gas production in the UK on investment and growth and particularly the sustainability of operation the North Sea.
nay: against requiring a report on the impact of the tax arrangements for oil and gas production in the UK on investment and growth and particularly the sustainability of operation the North Sea.

title: Finance Bill - Report on Impact of Fuel Duty Changes
aye: to require a report on the impact of changes to fuel duties.
nay: not to require a report on the impact of changes to fuel duties.

title: Finance Bill - Clause 72 - Report on the Bank Levy
aye: to require a review and report on the bank levy.
nay: not to require a review and report on the bank levy.

title: Opposition Day -  Higher Education Policy - Charging £9,000 Fees in Only Exceptional Cases - University Places - Teaching Budgets
aye: for £9,000 per year university tuition fees to only be charged in exceptional cases and against reducing the number of university places and against cuts to university teaching budgets.
nay: against £9,000 per year university tuition fees only being charged in exceptional cases and not to rule out reducing the number of university places or cutting university teaching budgets.

title: Opposition Day - Sure Start Children's Centres
aye: to protect the Sure Start network of Children’s Centres.
nay: against protecting the Sure Start network of Children’s Centres.

title: European Union - Regulation of Short Selling and Certain Aspects of Credit Default Swaps
aye: to agree proposals for European Union regulation of short selling and equivalent financial practices should not impact market efficiency and liquidity, in particular in relation to sovereign debt.
nay: against the view proposals for European Union regulation of short selling and equivalent financial practices should not impact market efficiency and liquidity, in particular in relation to sovereign debt.

title: Finance Bill 2011 - Second Reading
aye: in favour of the measures in the 2011 Budget including reducing the threshold for paying higher rate income tax, increasing the income tax free personal allowance, reducing corporation tax and reducing the main rate of corporation tax from 27 to 26%.
nay: against measures in the 2011 Budget including reducing the threshold for paying higher rate income tax, increasing the income tax free personal allowance, reducing corporation tax and reducing the main rate of corporation tax from 27 to 26%.

title: Finance Bill - Reject Second Reading
aye: against measures in the 2011 Budget including reducing the threashold for paying higher rate income tax, increasing the income tax free personal allowance, reducing corporation tax and reducing the main rate of corporation tax from 27 to 26%.
nay: in favour of the measures in the 2011 Budget including reducing the threashold for paying higher rate income tax, increasing the income tax free personal allowance, reducing corporation tax and reducing the main rate of corporation tax from 27 to 26%.

title: Prohibition on Emergency Service and Transport Strikes Withouth Majority of Employees in Unionised Workforce Voting For Action
aye: to prohibit strike action in the emergency and transport service sectors unless a majority of employees in the unionised workforce has voted in favour of such action.
nay: not to prohibit strike action in the emergency and transport service sectors unless a majority of employees in the unionised workforce has voted in favour of such action.

title: Control of Negative Election Campaigns by Third Parties - Allowing All UK Residents Over 18 to Vote - Introduction of Voter ID
aye: to strengthen measures to control negative campaigns by third parties in elections, to allow all those over 18 and legally resident in the UK to vote, and to introduce a requirement to identify voters.
nay: against strengthening measures to control negative campaigns by third parties in elections, against allowing all those over 18 and legally resident in the UK to vote, and against introducing a requirement to identify voters.

title: Opposition Day - Government Reductions in Policing
aye: in favour of police cuts
nay: against police cuts

title: Opposition Day - Cuts to Police Officer Numbers
aye: against cuts to the number of police officers.
nay: in favour of cuts to the number of police officers.

title: Broadcasting (Public Service Content) Bill - Second Reading
aye: to set out a new definition of public service broadcasting which would need to be followed for broadcasters to receive money from the television licence.
nay: against setting out a new definition of public service broadcasting which would need to be followed for broadcasters to receive money from the television licence.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Third Reading
aye: to introduce Police and Crime Commissioners, to give local councils more powers in relation to licensing, and in support of the other measures in the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.
nay: against introducing Police and Crime Commissioners, against giving local councils more powers in relation to licensing, and against the other measures in the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Clause 142 - Directions Releated to Prohibited Actvitity in Parliament Square
aye: to only allow the police, not local government officials, to direct that prohibited activity in Parliament Square must either cease, or not start.
nay: to empower local government officials, as well as police officers, to direct that prohibited activity in Parliament Square must either cease, or not start.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Clause 140 - Police Conditions on Public Assemblies - Retrospective
aye: against giving the police the power to impose conditions on public assemblies which were initiated before a proposed change in the law on regulating demonstrations near Parliament comes into force.
nay: to give the police the power to impose conditions on public assemblies which were initiated before a proposed change in the law on regulating demonstrations near Parliament comes into force.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Clause 152 - Specialist Police and CPS Units to Deal with Universal Jurisdiction Arrest Warrants in Private Prosecutions
aye: to establish specialist units in the Crown Prosecution Service and Metropolitan Police to deal with arrest warrants in private prosecutions of universal jurisdiction cases.
nay: against establishing specialist units in the Crown Prosecution Service and Metropolitan Police to deal with arrest warrants in private prosecutions of universal jurisdiction cases.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Clause 152 - Director of Public Prosecution's Consent - Universal Jurisdiction Arrest Warrants in Private Prosecutions
aye: against requiring the Director of Public Prosecutions' consent before an arrest warrant is issued to a private prosecutor in respect of certain offences such as grave breaches of the Geneva conventions, hostage taking and hijacking, which may be tried in England and Wales wherever the crime has occurred and irrespective of the nationality or residence of the offender.
nay: to require the Director of Public Prosecutions' consent before an arrest warrant is issued to a private prosecutor in respect of certain offences such as grave breaches of the Geneva conventions, hostage taking and hijacking, which may be tried in England and Wales wherever the crime has occurred and irrespective of the nationality or residence of the offender.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - New Schedule 1 - Police and Crime Panels
aye: to establish Police and Crime Panels to provide scrutiny of police and crime commissioners.
nay: against establishing Police and Crime Panels to provide scrutiny of police and crime commissioners.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - New Clause 5 - Memorandum of Understanding on Roles of Chief Constables vs Police and Crime Commissioners
aye: to require The Secretary of State to publish a Memorandum of Understanding on the Operational Responsibility of Chief Constables detailing where their actions shall be independent of the Police and Crime Commissioner.
nay: against requiring The Secretary of State to publish a Memorandum of Understanding on the Operational Responsibility of Chief Constables detailing where their actions shall be independent of the Police and Crime Commissioner.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - New Clause 4 - Inquiry Before Introducing Police and Crime Commissioners
aye: to require an inquiry by Her Majesty’s Inspectorate of Constabulary on the impact of introducing Police and Crime Commissioners, and to consider its recommendations before introducing them.
nay: against requiring an inquiry by Her Majesty’s Inspectorate of Constabulary on the impact of introducing Police and Crime Commissioners, and to consider its recommendations before introducing them.

title: Local Government Publicity
aye: to recommend publicity by local authorities be lawful, cost effective, objective etc.
nay: against recommending publicity by local authorities be lawful, cost effective, objective etc.

title: Pensions Bill [HL] - Report
Pensions Bill [HL] - Report
Budget Resolutions -  10. Alcoholic liquor duties (rates)
aye: to increase taxes on alcoholic drinks.
nay: against increasing taxes on alcoholic drinks.

title: Budget Resolution - Capital Allowances - Tax Breaks for Investing in Machinery and Green Technology
aye: to reduce the tax incentives for companies to invest in assets.
nay: against reducing the tax incentives for companies to invest in assets.

title: Budget Resolution - Taxation of UK Oil and Gas Production
aye: to increase the tax on profits from oil and gas production.
nay: against increasing the tax on profits from oil and gas production.

title: March 2011 Budget
aye: in favour of the March 2011 budget which outlined £710 billion of government spending for 2011-12  while only expecting to bring in £589bn; a corporation tax cut, an increase in the personal income tax free allowance and a presumption in favour of sustainable development.
nay: against the March 2011 budget which outlined £710 billion of government spending for 2011-12 while only expecting to bring in £589bn; a corporation tax cut, an increase in the personal income tax free allowance and a presumption in favour of sustainable development.

title: Establishment of the European Stability Mechanism
aye: in favour of the creation of the European Stability Mechanism to give financial assistance to Eurozone countries in need.
nay: against the creation of the European Stability Mechanism to give financial assistance to Eurozone countries in need.

title: United Nations Security Council Resolution 1973 - Libya - No Fly Zone
aye: to support the establishment of a no-fly zone in Libya.
nay: against the establishment of a no-fly zone in Libya.

title: United Kingdom Parliamentary Sovereignty Bill - Second Reading
aye: to require a referendum before any increase in the functions of the EU.
nay: against requiring a referendum before any increase in the functions of the EU.

title: NHS Reorganisation
aye: to stop the Government's NHS reorganisation.
nay: in support of the Government's NHS reorganisation.

title: Opposition Day - Fuel Prices and the Cost of Living
aye: to note the Government's position in respect of fuel prices and the cost of living.
nay: against noting the Government's position in respect of fuel prices and the cost of living.

title: Opposition Day - Reduce Taxation on Fuel for Motor Vehicles Paid for by a Bank Levy
aye: for lower taxes on fuel for motor vehicles.
nay: against taxes on fuel for motor vehicles.

title: Draft Waste (England and Wales) Regulations 2011
aye: to bring a European Directive on Waste Disposal into UK law.
nay: against bringing a European Directive on Waste Disposal into UK law.

title: Scotland Bill - New Clause 19 - Devolution of Powers Relating to Food Labelling and Content
aye: to devolve powers relating food content and labeling to Scotland.
nay: against devolving powers relating food content and labeling to Scotland.

title: Scotland Bill - New Clause 11 - Devolution of Powers Related to Time
aye: to devolve powers related to timescales, time zones and British Summer Time, to Scotland.
nay: against devolving powers related to timescales, time zones and British Summer Time, to Scotland.

title: Scotland Bill - New Clause 10 - Crown Estate - Devolution of Powers
aye: to make the Crown Estate accountable to the Scottish Government and to devolve powers related to the Crown Estate to Scotland.
nay: against making the Crown Estate accountable to the Scottish Government and to devolve powers related to the Crown Estate to Scotland.

title: Scotland Bill - New Clause 9 - Devolution of Responsibility for Rail Services to the Scottish Parliament
aye: to devolve responsibility for railway services which start and finish in Scotland to the Scottish Parliament.
nay: against devolving responsibility for railway services which start and finish in Scotland to the Scottish Parliament.

title: Scotland Bill - New Clause 3 - Devolution - Maritime and Coastguard Agency
aye: to devolve the powers relating to Scottish elements of the Maritime and Coastguard Agency to the Scottish Government.
nay: not to devolve the powers relating to Scottish elements of the Maritime and Coastguard Agency to the Scottish Government.

title: Scotland Bill - Clause 32 - Code of Practice on Borrowing by Scottish Ministers
aye: to require Scottish Ministers to have regard to any code of practice agreed between them and the UK Treasury when borrowing money.
nay: against requiring Scottish Ministers to have regard to any code of practice agreed between them and the UK Treasury when borrowing money.

title: Scotland Bill - Clause 26 - Scottish Parliament Consent for Commencement of Scottish Set Income Tax Rate
aye: to require the consent of the Scottish Parliament before devolving the power to set a Scottish rate of income tax to the Scottish Parliament.
nay: against requiring the consent of the Scottish Parliament before devolving the power to set a Scottish rate of income tax to the Scottish Parliament.

title: Scotland Bill - Clause 24 - Devolution of Power to Tax Quarrying or Mining to Scottish Parliament
aye: to devolve power to the Scottish Parliament to tax quarrying and mining.
nay: against devolving power to the Scottish Parliament to tax quarrying and mining.

title: Business of the House - Closure of Debate - Scrutiny of EU Foreign, Defence and Security Policy
aye: to bring a debate on scrutiny of European foreign, defence and security policy to a close.
nay: against bringing a debate on scrutiny of European foreign, defence and security policy to a close.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Second Reading
aye: to introduce Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payments and to restrict housing benefit for those in social housing deemed to have excess bedrooms.
nay: against introducing Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payments and against restricting housing benefit for those in social housing deemed to have excess bedrooms.

title: Welfare Reform Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against introducing Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payments and against restricting housing benefit for those in social housing deemed to have excess bedrooms.
nay: to introduce Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payments and to restrict housing benefit for those in social housing deemed to have excess bedrooms.

title: Scotland Bill - Clause 13 - Return Responsibility for Regulating Health Professionals in Scotland to UK Parliament
aye: to return responsibility for regulating health professionals in Scotland to UK Parliament
nay: against returning responsibility for regulating health professionals in Scotland to UK Parliament

title: Scotland Bill - Clause 12 - Return of Certain Insolvency Powers from Scotland to the UK Parliament
aye: to return the responsibility for making laws in relation to certain elements of insolvency to from Scotland to the UK Parliament.
nay: against returning  the responsibility for making laws in relation to certain elements of insolvency to from Scotland to the UK Parliament.

title: Scotland Bill - Clause 11 -  Devolution to Scotland of Powers to Regulate Specially Dangerous Air Weapons
aye: to devolve powers to Scotland to regulate those air weapons deemed so dangerous they need to be licenced or prohibited in the same way as a firearm.
nay: against devolving powers to Scotland to regulate those air weapons deemed so dangerous they need to be licenced or prohibited in the same way as a firearm.

title: Scotland Bill - Clause 1 - Administration of Elections - Start Counting Within Four Hours of Polls Closing
aye: to require Scottish Ministers to order returning officers to start counting votes for elections to the Scottish Parliament within four hours of polls closing.
nay: against requiring Scottish Ministers to order returning officers to start counting votes for elections to the Scottish Parliament within four hours of polls closing.

title: Further and Higher Education (Access) Bill - Second Reading - Selection on Merit
aye: to require further and higher education institutions in receipt of public funds to consider applicants from England on the basis of merit alone; with exemptions.
nay: against requiring further and higher education institutions in receipt of public funds to consider applicants from England on the basis of merit alone; with exemptions.

title: Sports Grounds Safety Authority Bill - That the House Sit in Private
aye: for the House of Commons to sit in private for the remainder of the day.
nay: against the House of Commons sitting in private for the remainder of the day.

title: Draft Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order 2011
aye: to increase the Basic State Pension and various benefits and allowances to account for inflation.
nay: against increasing the Basic State Pension and various benefits and allowances to account for inflation.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - No Threshold for Making Result of AV Referendum Binding
aye: to make the referendum on using the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs binding on the Government even if less than 40% of the electorate took part.
nay: to make the referendum on using the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs non-binding on the Government if less than 40% of the electorate took part.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 1 - Referendum on the Alternative Vote System - Threshold on Making Result Binding
aye: to reject imposing a threshold for acting on the result of the referendum on using the AV system for electing MPs but to amend the proposals for such a threshold to ensure if one was imposed and not reached the AV provisions would be repealed.
nay: to impose a threshold for acting on the result of the referendum on using the AV system for electing MPs and against ensuring if a threashold was imposed and not reached the AV provisions would be repealed.

title: Opposition Day - Military Covenant
aye: for a legally binding Military Covenant set out in law.
nay: against a legally binding Military Covenant set out in law.

title: Opposition Day - Youth Unemployment
aye: to commission an independent assessment of the "Future Jobs Fund" before implementing the "Work Programme".
nay: against commissioning an independent assessment of the "Future Jobs Fund" before implementing the "Work Programme".

title: Terrorist Finance Tracking Program
aye: to agree the Terrorist Finance Tracking Program, which gives the US Government access to bank transaction data, is an important tool in the global counter-terrorism effort and to note a European Union council decision to supply information to the program.
nay: not to agree the Terrorist Finance Tracking Program, which gives the US Government access to bank transaction data, is an important tool in the global counter-terrorism effort and against noting a European Union council decision to supply information to the program.

title: Immigration and Nationality (Fees) Order 2011 - Fees for Immigration, Nationality and Consular Applications
aye: to extend the circumstances where fees can be charged in relation to immigration, nationality and consular applications, services and transactions.
nay: against extending the circumstances where fees can be charged in relation to immigration, nationality and consular applications, services and transactions.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Allowing Greater Variation from Mean Number of Electors in MP Constituency in Exceptional Circumstances
aye: to allow geographical considerations or local ties to justify greater variation from the mean number of electors in a parliamentary constituency.
nay: against allowing geographical considerations or local ties to justify greater variation from the mean number of electors in a parliamentary constituency.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Threshold for Making Result of AV Referendum Binding
aye: to make the referendum on using the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs non-binding on the Government if less than 40% of the electorate took part.
nay: against making the referendum on using the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs non-binding on the Government if less than 40% of the electorate took part.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 1 - Referendum on the Alternative Vote - Threshold for Binding Result
aye: to require a 40% turnout in the referendum on using the Alternative Vote system for electing MPs for the result to be binding.
nay: not to require a 40% turnout in the referendum on using the Alternative Vote system for electing MPs for the result to be binding.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - Special Case of the Isle of Wight
aye: to create two Parliamentary constituencies wholly on the Isle of Wight rather than just one.
nay: against creating two Parliamentary constituencies wholly on the Isle of Wight rather than just one.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - Number and distribution of seats - Isle of Wight
aye: in favour of allowing a Parliamentary constituency to cover both part of the Isle of Wight and part of the UK mainland.
nay: against allowing a Parliamentary constituency to cover both part of the Isle of Wight and part of the UK mainland.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - permissible variation in population in a constituency
aye: not to increase the permitted variation from the norm in the number of voters in each parliamentary constituency to 7.5% from the 5% previously proposed.
nay: to increase the permitted variation from the norm in the number of voters in each parliamentary constituency to 7.5% from the 5% previously proposed.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - permissible variation in population in a constituency
aye: not to increase the permitted variation from the norm in the number of voters in each parliamentary constituency to 7.5% from the 5% previously proposed.
nay: to increase the permitted variation from the norm in the number of voters in each parliamentary constituency to 7.5% from the 5% previously proposed.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Programme
aye: to agree a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Ban on Party Political Broadcasts Taking Sides in AV Referendum
aye: to ban party election broadcasts during the referendum period from supporting a particular side on the question of if the "alternative vote" system should be used for electing MPs.
nay: not to ban party election broadcasts during the referendum period from supporting a particular side on the question of if the "alternative vote" system should be used for electing MPs.

title: Legislation (Territorial Extent) Bill - Second Reading
aye: for the legal and financial effect of draft Bills on each part of the United Kingdom to be separately and clearly identified.
nay: against the legal and financial effect of draft Bills on each part of the United Kingdom being separately and clearly identified.

title: Backbench Business - Voting by Prisoners
aye: against prisoners voting.
nay: in favour of prisoners voting.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Reduce Number of Members of the House of Lords Before Reducing Number of MPs
aye: not to reduce the number of MPs until the number of members of the House of Lords has been capped.
nay: not to require the number of members of the House of Lords be capped before reducing the number of MPs.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Reduce Number of Ministers If Number of MPs Reduced
aye: to require the number of ministers to be reduced in line with any reduction in the number of MPs.
nay: against requiring the number of ministers to be reduced in line with any reduction in the number of MPs.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Limit Reduction of MPs from Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland
aye: to require that the number of MPs from each of  Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland will remain within 10 per cent of the current number.
nay: against requiring that the number of MPs from each of  Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland will remain within 10 per cent of the current number.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Special Case for Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
aye: to require Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly to be included in parliamentary constituencies which are wholly in Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly.
nay: against requiring Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly to be included in parliamentary constituencies which are wholly in Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly.

title: Local Government Finance Settlement 2011-12 (England)
aye: to reduce funding for local councils by 4 percent in 2011-12 compared to 2010-11.
nay: against reducing funding for local councils by 4 percent in 2011-12 compared to 2010-11.

title: Police Grant Report 2011-12
aye: to approve the Police Grant for 2011-12
nay: to oppose the Police Grant for 2011-12

title: Taxation of the Financial Sector - Financial Transaction Tax - Banking Levy
aye: for a banking levy, a tax charged as a fraction of a bank's assets, and against a financial transaction tax.
nay: against a banking levy, a tax charged as a fraction of a bank's assets, and for a financial transaction tax.

title: Police and Criminal Evidence Act (PACE) Code Revision - Stop and Search - Fingerprints and DNA - Entry and Search - CCTV
aye: to update the PACE codes to reflect legislative and policy changes on Stop and Search, Fingerprints and DNA, Entry and Search and CCTV.
nay: not to update the PACE codes to reflect legislative and policy changes on Stop and Search, Fingerprints and DNA, Entry and Search and CCTV.

title: European Union - UK Contributions to the Eurozone Financial Stabilisation Mechanism
aye: to support the Government's position that the UK should not contribute to the European Stability Mechanism and financial assistance for Euro area Member States should primarily be provided by other euro area Member States.
nay: not to support the Government's position that the UK should not contribute to the European Stability Mechanism and financial assistance for Euro area Member States should primarily be provided by other euro area Member States.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Allowing Greater Variation from Mean Number of Electors in MP Constituency in Exceptional Circumstances
aye: to allow geographical considerations or local ties to justify greater variation from the mean number of electors in a parliamentary constituency.
nay: against allowing geographical considerations or local ties to justify greater variation from the mean number of electors in a parliamentary constituency.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Reduce Number of MPs from 650 to 600
aye: to reduce the number of MPs from 650 to 600.
nay: against reducing the number of MPs from 650 to 600.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Complete and Accurate Electoral Register Before Reforms
aye: to ensure the electoral register is as complete and accurate as possible before using it as a basis for reform to parliamentary constituencies.
nay: against a proposal to ensure the electoral register is as complete and accurate as possible before using it as a basis for reform to parliamentary constituencies.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Establish Committee on Parliamentary Constituency Reforms
aye: to establish a committee to make recommendations on parliamentary constituency reforms.
nay: against establishing a committee to make recommendations on parliamentary constituency reforms.

title: Education Bill (second reading)
aye: to allow the establishment of free schools, to abolish a range of teaching related bodies, to allow student loan interest to be charged at market rates, and to allow teachers to search pupils.
nay: against proposals which would have allowed the establishment of free schools, resulted in the abolition of a range of teaching related bodies, allowed student loan interest to be charged at market rates, and allowed teachers to search pupils.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Consultation Period on New Constituency Boundaries
aye: to reduce the consultation period on proposed new parliamentary constituencies from 12 to six weeks.
nay: against reducing the consultation period on proposed new parliamentary constituencies from 12 to six weeks.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Turnout Threshold for Alternative Vote Referendum to be Binding
aye: to make the referendum on using the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs non-binding on the Government if less than 40% of the electorate took part.
nay: against making the referendum on using the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs non-binding on the Government if less than 40% of the electorate took part.

title: Opposition Day - Fuel Duty In Remote Rural Areas
aye: in favour of noting the government's commitment to deliver a discount in fuel duty for certain remote rural areas.
nay: against noting the government's commitment to deliver a discount in fuel duty for certain remote rural areas.

title: Opposition Day  - Reduction of Fuel Duties for the Most Remote Areas
aye: to introduce a lower rate tax on fuel in the most remote areas.
nay: against introducing a lower rate tax on fuel in the most remote areas.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - 40 Percent Turnout Threshold to make AV Referendum Binding
aye: to require a 40% turnout in the referendum of using the "Alternative Vote" system for electing MPs for the referendum result to be binding.
nay: not to require a 40% turnout in the referendum of using the "Alternative Vote" system for electing MPs for the referendum result to be binding.

title: Backbench Business - Consumer Credit and Debt Management - Powers to Cap Costs of Certain Unsecured Lending
aye: to clarify that no new powers are required to cap the costs of certain unsecured lending.
nay: against clarifying that no new powers are required to cap the costs of certain unsecured lending.

title: Access and Conservation Arrangements After Sell Off of England's Public Forests
aye: to approve arrangements for public access to, and conservation of, for England's public forests once they are sold off.
nay: not to approve arrangements for public access to, and conservation of, for England's public forests once they are sold off.

title: Sale of Public Forest Estate
aye: against the sale of England's public forest estate.
nay: in favour of the sale of England's public forest estate.

title: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills - remedy its deficiency - rejected
aye: in favour of action to remedy the deficiencies in the Business, Innovation and Skills Department.
nay: against action to remedy the deficiencies in the Business, Innovation and Skills Department.

title: European Union Bill - New Clause 11 - Referendum on EU Membership If Referendum Opposes Transfer of Powers
aye: for a proposal that if a proposed transfer of powers from the UK to the EU was rejected in a referendum a subsequent, binding, referendum ought be held on the UK's membership of the EU.
nay: against a proposal that if a proposed transfer of powers from the UK to the EU was rejected in a referendum a subsequent, binding, referendum ought be held on the UK's membership of the EU.

title: Health and Social Care Bill - Second Reading
aye: to support proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.
nay: against proposed NHS reforms including giving more power to GPs to commission services, strengthening the Care Quality Commission, and cutting admin costs for example by abolishing Primary Care Trusts.

title: Scotland Bill - Reject Second Reading - Devolution of Further Powers, Inlcuding Tax Raising Powers to Scotland
aye: against giving more powers to the Scottish Parliament, including the power to set income tax, and other tax rates.
nay: to give more powers to the Scottish Parliament, including the power to set income tax, and other tax rates.

title: European Union Bill - Clause 9 - Approval required in connection with Title V of Part 3 of TFEU
aye: to require a referendum, and Act of Parliament, prior to a decision being taken on the UK's membership of the EU's policing and criminal justice institutions.
nay: not to require a referendum, and Act of Parliament, prior to a decision being taken on the UK's membership of the EU's policing and criminal justice institutions.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Minimum of 35 MPs for Wales
aye: for a minimum of 35 MPs for Wales.
nay: against requiring a minimum of 35 MPs for Wales.

title: European Union Bill - Clause 6 - Referendum on Emergency Financial Assistance for EU Member States
aye: to require a referendum prior to UK giving emergency financial assistance via the EU to member states other than the Republic of Ireland.
nay: against requiring a referendum prior to UK giving emergency financial assistance via the EU to member states other than the Republic of Ireland.

title: European Union Bill - Clause 6 - Decisions requiring approval by Act and by referendum
aye: voted to clarify there is no requirement for both a referendum and an Act of Parliament before powers relating to EU patents can be transferred from the UK to the EU.
nay: voted not to clarify there is no requirement for both a referendum and an Act of Parliament before powers relating to EU patents can be transferred from the UK to the EU.

title: European Union Bill - Clause 5 - Statement to be laid before Parliament
aye: for Parliament rather than a minister to decide if a European Union decision involves a transfer of power or competence to the EU and so is significant enough to require both a referendum and an Act of Parliament.
nay: for a Minister, rather than Parliament, to decide if a European Union decision involves a transfer of power or competence to the EU and so is significant enough to require a both a referendum and an Act of Parliament.

title: European Union Bill - Clause 1 - European Union Referendum Committee
aye: to establish a European Union Referendum Committee to recommend to Parliament whether or not to hold a referendum on each EU treaty amendment.
nay: against establishing a European Union Referendum Committee to recommend to Parliament whether or not to hold a referendum on each EU treaty amendment.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: to hold a private session of the House of Commons.
nay: not to hold a private session of the House of Commons.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Continuation of Consideration of Bill
aye: to stop their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.
nay: to continue their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Special Case for Isle of Wight Constituency
aye: to require Parliamentary constituencies covering the Isle of Wight to be wholly in the Isle of Wight and to exempt them from a rule requiring equal numbers of electors per constituency.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Cap on Total Population of Parliamentary Constituency
aye: to cap the total population of a parliamentary constituency at 130% of the mean number of electors in a constituency (excluding two exceptional constituencies).
nay: against capping the total population of a parliamentary constituency at 130% of the mean number of electors in a constituency (excluding two exceptional constituencies).

title: Opposition Day - Education Maintenance Allowance
aye: to support the Government reforms to arrangements for supporting students aged 16-19.
nay: against the Government reforms to arrangements for supporting students aged 16-19.

title: Opposition Day - Education Maintenance Allowance
aye: to call on the Government to keep the education maintenance allowance (EMA) in England.
nay: in favour of scrapping the education maintenance allowance (EMA) in England.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Moving to Vote on Population Cap for Parliamentary Constituency
aye: to conclude their consideration of a proposed cap on the total population of a parliamentary constituency.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Third Reading
aye: to hold general elections on a regular basis every five years, with some exceptions permitting early elections.
nay: against holding general elections on a regular basis every five years, with some exceptions permitting early elections.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 3 - Timing of Dissolution of Parliament before General Election
aye: to dissolve Parliament 25 days, rather than 17 days, before a general election.
nay: to dissolve Parliament 17 days, rather than 25 days, before a general election.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - New Clause 5 - Expiry of Provisions for Early General Elections
aye: to make the conditions for holding an early general election expire at the end of the current Parliament, defaulting to simply allowing an election to be initiated following a motion being approved by the House of Commons.
nay: against making the conditions for holding an early general election expire at the end of the current Parliament, defaulting to simply allowing an election to be initiated following a motion being approved by the House of Commons.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - New Clause 4 - Power of the Monarch to Decide When Parliament Meets
aye: against continuing to let the monarch determine when Parliament meets and to allow MPs themselves, or the Speaker of the House of Commons, to decide instead.
nay: in favour of continuing to let the monarch determine when Parliament meets rather than allowing MPs themselves, or the Speaker of the House of Commons, to decide.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Continuation of Consideration of the Bill
aye: to stop their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.
nay: to continue their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Continuation of Consideration of the Bill
aye: to stop their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.
nay: to continue their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Continuation of Consideration of the Bill
aye: to stop their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.
nay: to continue their consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill -  Set Number of MPs at Between 500 and 650
aye: to set the number of MPs at between 500 and 650.
nay: against a proposal to set the number of MPs at between 500 and 650.

title: Localism Bill (Money)
aye: to authorise spending relating to the Localism Bill, enabling the devolution of more powers to local councils and local people particularly in relation to social housing and planning.
nay: against authorising spending relating to the Localism Bill, enabling the devolution of more powers to local councils and local people particularly in relation to social housing and planning.

title: Localism Bill (Programme)
aye: to approve a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Localism Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Localism Bill.

title: Localism Bill - Declines Second Reading
aye: against devolving more powers to local councils and local people particularly in relation to social housing and planning.
nay: to devolve more powers to local councils and local people particularly in relation to social housing and planning.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Curtail Debate and Make Decsion On Setting Number of MPs Between 500 and 650
aye: to bring the debate to a close and make a decision on setting the number of MPs to some number between 500 and 650.
nay: against bringing the debate to a close and make a decision on setting the number of MPs to some number between 500 and 650.

title: National Insurance Contributions Bill - Clause 4 - Regional Exclusions from National Insurance Exemption for New Businesses
aye: not to exclude Greater London, the South East Region and the Eastern Region from an exemption for new companies from class 1 National Insurance payments for a a period.
nay: to exclude Greater London, the South East Region and the Eastern Region from an exemption for new companies from class 1 National Insurance payments for a a period.

title: National Insurance Contributions Bill - Clause 3 - Increased product of additional rates to be paid into National Insurance Fund
aye: to require a report on the amount of money required to be raised from Class 4 National Insurance contributions for the health service allocation of National Insurance revenues to grow in real terms each year.
nay: against requiring a report on the amount of money required to be raised from Class 4 National Insurance contributions for the health service allocation of National Insurance revenues to grow in real terms each year.

title: Postal Services Bill - Third Reading - Privatisation of Royal Mail
aye: to privatise up to 90% of Royal Mail and for related restructuring.
nay: against privatising up to 90% of Royal Mail and against related restructuring.

title: Postal Services Bill - Clause 33 - Review of Minimum Requirements
aye: to require at least five years to pass after the Bill enabling the privatisation of Royal Mail comes into effect before the minimum requirements of a universal postal service can be reviewed by the regulator Ofcom.
nay: not to require at least five years to pass after the Bill enabling the privatisation of Royal Mail comes into effect before the minimum requirements of a universal postal service can be reviewed by the regulator Ofcom.

title: Postal Services Bill - New Clause 4 - Restriction on Universal Service Provider Disposals
aye: to require regulatory approval prior to disposals of part of a universal postal service provider's business.
nay: against requiring regulatory approval prior to disposals of part of a universal postal service provider's business.

title: Postal Services Bill - New Clause 2 - Minimum 10 Year Agreement With Post Office Limited Required before Royal Mail Sale
aye: to require a ten year agreement between Royal Mail and Post Office Ltd relating to Royal Mail's use of the post office network prior to the sale of Royal Mail.
nay: against requiring a ten year agreement between Royal Mail and Post Office Ltd relating to Royal Mail's use of the post office network prior to the sale of Royal Mail.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Maximise Fraction of 17-24 Year Olds On Electoral Register Before Reviewing Constituancy Boundries
aye: to require an assurance action has been taken to to maximise the proportion of 17 to 24 year olds who are on the electoral register before using the register as a basis for reviewing the boundaries of Parliamentary constituencies.
nay: not to require an assurance action has been taken to to maximise the proportion of 17 to 24 year olds who are on the electoral register before using the register as a basis for reviewing the boundaries of Parliamentary constituencies.

title: European Union Bill - Annual Report on Court Challenge of Clause 18 - Status of EU law dependent on continuing statutory basis
aye: to require an annual report on the extent to which the principle that EU law only applies in the UK via Acts of Parliament has been challenged or questioned in the courts.
nay: against requiring an annual report on the extent to which the principle that EU law only applies in the UK via Acts of Parliament has been challenged or questioned in the courts.

title: European Union Bill - Clause 18 - Status of EU law dependent on continuing statutory basis
aye: to reaffirm the sovereignty of the United Kingdom Parliament in relation to EU law.
nay: against reaffirming the sovereignty of the United Kingdom Parliament in relation to EU law.

title: Identity Documents Bill - Consideration of Commons Reason: Motion to adjourn
Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Voting Areas for AV Referendum
aye: to use parliamentary constituencies as voting areas for the referendum on moving to the alternative vote system for electing MPs.
nay: against using parliamentary constituencies as voting areas for the referendum on moving to the alternative vote system for electing MPs.

title: Loans to Ireland Bill - Clause 1 - Interest Rate to be Charged on United Kingdom Loans to Ireland
aye: to require the interest rate to be charged on loans of up to £3,250 million from the UK to Ireland be determined by the House of Commons.
nay: against requiring the interest rate to be charged on loans of up to £3,250 million from the UK to Ireland be determined by the House of Commons.

title: Loans to Ireland Bill - Second Reading
aye: to authorise a loan from the UK to the Republic of Ireland of up to £3.25bn and to set proceedures for increasing this amount.
nay: against authorising  loan from the UK to the Republic of Ireland of up to £3.25bn and against setting proceedures for increasing this amount.

title: Loans to Ireland Bill - Programme - Expidte Consideration of the Bill
aye: to approve a proposed timetable, and rules, intended to expedite the consideration of the Loans to Ireland Bill
nay: against approving a proposed timetable, and rules, intended to expedite the consideration of the Loans to Ireland Bill

title: Draft Mutilations (Permitted Procedures) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2010 - Permitting Beak Trimming of Laying Hens
aye: to continue to allow beak trimming of laying hens after 31 December 2010.
nay: not to allow beak trimming of laying hens after 31 December 2010.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Political Party Spending During Referenda
aye: in favour of a step intended to work towards reducing the amount political parties can spend in referendum campaigns.
nay: against a step intended to work towards reducing the amount political parties can spend in referendum campaigns.

title: University Tuition Fee Cap raise to £9,000
aye: against raising the UK's undergraduate tuition fee cap to £9,000 per year.
nay: to raise the UK's undergraduate tuition fee cap to £9,000 per year.

title: University Tuition Fee Cap raise to £6,000
aye: to approve raising the tuition fee cap to £6,000 per year for courses for which there are no plans in place to promote access and student finance information.
nay: against raising the tuition fee cap to £6,000 per year for courses for which there are no plans in place to promote access and student finance information.

title: European Union Documents- Corporate Governance in Financial Institutions and Remuneration Policies
aye: to work closely with the European Commission to deliver a strong, principles-based framework for financial sector corporate governance.
nay: against working closely with the European Commission to deliver a strong, principles-based framework for financial sector corporate governance.

title: Superannuation Bill - Clause 3 - Time Limit on Renewal of Cap on Compensation for Civil Service Leavers
aye: for ministers to be able to renew a cap on compensation for those leaving the civil service for only up to one year, rather than for up to three years.
nay: for ministers to be able to renew a cap on compensation for those leaving the civil service so it applies for up to three years, rather than just one year.

title: Public Bodies Bill [HL] - Committee (4th Day) - Abolition of Chief Coroner
Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Money
aye: to introduce Police and Crime Commissioners, to give local councils more powers in relation to licensing, and in support of the other measures in the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.
nay: against introducing Police and Crime Commissioners, against giving local councils more powers in relation to licensing, and against the other measures in the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill  - Programme
aye: in favour of a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the consideration of the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.

title: Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill - Decline Second Reading
aye: against introducing Police and Crime Commissioners, against giving local councils more powers in relation to licensing, and against the other measures in the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.
nay: to introduce Police and Crime Commissioners, to give local councils more powers in relation to licensing, and in support of the other measures in the Police Reform and Social Responsibility Bill.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Flexibility to Cope with Changes to Poll Days
aye: to make the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill more flexible to cope with potential changes to poll dates affecting the referendum on using the alternative vote system to elect MPs.
nay: against making the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill more flexible to cope with potential changes to poll dates affecting the referendum on using the alternative vote system to elect MPs.

title: University Tuition Fee Cap - Set Basic Limit at £6,000 Per Year
aye: to approve raising the tuition fee cap to £6,000 per year for courses for which there are no plans in place to promote access and student finance information.
nay: against raising the tuition fee cap to £6,000 per year for courses for which there are no plans in place to promote access and student finance information.

title: University Tuition Fee Cap - Raise Upper Limit to £9,000 Per Year
aye: to raise the UK's undergraduate tuition fee cap to £9,000 per year.
nay: against raising the UK's undergraduate tuition fee cap to £9,000 per year.

title: Timetable Motion - Business of the House (Thursday) - University Tuiton Fee Caps
aye: in favour of restricting the amount of time available for the House of Commons to debate the university tuition fee cap.
nay: against restricting the amount of time available for the House of Commons to debate the university tuition fee cap.

title: Closure Motion - Timetable - Business of the House (Thursday) - University Tuiton Fee Caps
aye: in favour of curtailing debate and moving to a vote on the time available for the House of Commons to debate the university tuition fee cap.
nay: against of curtailing debate and moving to a vote on the time available for the House of Commons to debate the university tuition fee cap.

title: Suspension of Standing Order on Deferred Divisions to Enable Rearrangement of Next Day's Business
aye: to suspend the House of Commons' rules on deferring contested votes after a certain point in the day so that the following day's business could be rearranged.
nay: against suspending the House of Commons' rules on deferring contested votes after a certain point in the day so that the following day's business could be rearranged.

title: Business of the House - Suspension of Usual Rules of Proceedure to Enable Rearrangement of Next Day's Business
aye: to suspend the House of Commons' usual rules of procedure so the following day's business could be rearranged.
nay: against suspending the House of Commons' usual rules of procedure so the following day's business could be rearranged.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Committee (3rd Day)
aye: for a Gaelic version of the referendum question on changing the voting system for MPs to the "alternative vote" to appear on ballot papers in Scotland.
nay: against a Gaelic version of the referendum question on changing the voting system for MPs to the "alternative vote" appearing on ballot papers in Scotland.

title: European Union Bill  - Decline Second Reading
aye: against a referendum prior to any future transfer of powers from the UK to the EU.
nay: for a referendum prior to any future transfer of powers from the UK to the EU.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - AV Referendum on Separate Day from Other Elections and Polls
aye: for the referendum on electing MPs via the "alternative vote" system ought be held on a separate day from any other polls or elections.
nay: to reject a proposal for the referendum on electing MPs via the "alternative vote" system ought be held on a separate day from any other polls or elections.

title: Opposition Day - Local Government Funding - Spread Cuts Over Longer Period - Avoid Disproportionate Impact on Most Deprived Areas
aye: to spread cuts to local government funding more evenly over four years and ensure they do not fall disproportionately on the most deprived areas.
nay: against spreading cuts to local government funding more evenly over four years and ensuring they do not fall disproportionately on the most deprived areas.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Date of Referendum on Alternative Vote System for Electing MPs
aye: to allow the referendum on moving to use the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs to be held any time before 31 October 2011 rather than specifying the precise date in law.
nay: to specify the precise date of the referendum on moving to use the "alternative vote" system for electing MPs in law rather the law stating the referendum is to be held any time before 31 October 2011

title: Daylight Saving Bill - Second Reading
aye: to consider advancing time by one hour for all, or part of, the year.
nay: against considering advancing time by one hour for all, or part of, the year.

title: Daylight Saving Bill - Conclude Second Reading debate
aye: to bring the debate on the Daylight Savings Bill to a close. The Bill required consideration of advancing time by one hour for all, or part of, the year.
nay: against bringing the debate on the Daylight Savings Bill to a close. The Bill required consideration of advancing time by one hour for all, or part of, the year.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Early General Elections
aye: for no exceptions from the five year fixed term of a parliament and against the monarch have powers in relation determining when MPs meet in Parliament.
nay: in favour of exceptions from the five year fixed term of a parliament as well as to preserve the monarch's powers in relation determining when MPs meet in Parliament.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 2 - Definition of Motion of No Confidence - Early General Elections
aye: to expressly define what counts as "a motion of no confidence" for the purposes of prompting an early general election.
nay: against expressly defining what counts as "a motion of no confidence" for the purposes of prompting an early general election.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 2 - Speaker's Certificate re Early General Election to be Issued Within 24 Hours
aye: to require a certificate from the Speaker relating to an early general election be issued within 24 hours of the conditions requiring the holding of such an early election being met.
nay: against requiring  certificate from the Speaker relating to an early general election be issued within 24 hours of the conditions requiring the holding of such an early election being met.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 2 - Early parliamentary general elections
aye: to prevent a certificate from the Speaker of the House of Commons relating to the calling of a general election being questioned in court.
nay: not to prevent a certificate from the Speaker of the House of Commons relating to the calling of a general election being questioned in court.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 2 - Period Following Vote of No Confidence in the Government
aye: to exclude certain days from the period of 14 days to be allowed following a vote of no confidence in the Government to see if a Government can secure the confidence of MPs and remove the requirement for an early general election.
nay: against excluding certain days from the period of 14 days to be allowed following a vote of no confidence in the Government to see if a Government can secure the confidence of MPs and remove the requirement for an early general election.

title: Fixed Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 2 - Immediate General Election Following Vote of No-Confidence
aye: for an immediate general election following a vote of no confidence in the Government; and against allowing 14 days to see if a Government can secure the confidence of MPs.
nay: against an immediate general election following a vote of no confidence in the Government; preferring instead to allow 14 days to see if a Government can secure the confidence of MPs.

title: Draft Scottish Parliament (Elections etc.) Order 2010 - Scottish Parliament Election Rules
aye: to approve new rules for electing members of the Scottish Parliament.
nay: not to approve new rules for electing members of the Scottish Parliament.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Make Alternative Vote Referendum Only Consultative
aye: to make the referendum on the "alternative vote" only indicative rather than requiring change if the majority of those voting in the referendum voted for it.
nay: against making the referendum on the "alternative vote" only indicative rather than requiring change if the majority of those voting in the referendum voted for it.

title: Opposition Day - Tuition Fees
aye: to urge the Government to bring forward the publication date of a proposed White Paper on Higher Education and to express concern about the Government's Higher Education proposals.
nay: against urging the Government to bring forward the publication date of a proposed White Paper on Higher Education and against expressing concern about the Government's Higher Education proposals.

title: Opposition Day - School Sports Funding
aye: to ask the Government to reverse their decision to remove funding from the Youth Sport Trust, cut specialist sports schools and dismantle School Sport Partnerships.
nay: in support of the Government policy to remove funding from the Youth Sport Trust, cut specialist sports schools and dismantle School Sport Partnerships.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Committee to Decide on Form of AV to Put to Referendum
aye: to establish a committee to recommend which form of "alternative vote" system ought be the subject of a referendum.
nay: against establishing a committee to recommend which form of "alternative vote" system ought be the subject of a referendum.

title: Backbench Business - Banking Reform - Only Underwrite Purely Deposit-Taking Banks - State Run Derivatives Clearing House
aye: to remove the implicit taxpayer guarantee from all but purely deposit-taking banks and for the Government to establish a clearing house for all financial derivatives.
nay: against removing the implicit taxpayer guarantee from all but purely deposit-taking banks and for the Government to establish a clearing house for all financial derivatives.

title: Fixed-Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 2 - Early parliamentary general elections
aye: to allow a simple majority of House of Commons, subject to the agreement of the main party leaders, to initiate an early general election.
nay: for an early general election if two thirds of MPs vote for one, or if the Government loses a vote of no-confidence and no new Government is formed within 14 days.

title: Fixed-Term Parliaments Bill - Clause 1 - Polling days for parliamentary general elections
aye: for a General Election on the 7th of May 2015 and then every five years.
nay: against holding a General Election on the 7th of May 2015 and then every five years.

title: Draft Justification Decision (Generation of Electricity by the AP1000 Nuclear Reactor) Regulations 2010
aye: to state the generation of electricity by the AP1000 nuclear reactor is justified.
nay: against stating the generation of electricity by the AP1000 nuclear reactor is justified.

title: Draft Justification Decision (Generation of Electricity by the EPR Nuclear Reactor) Regulations 2010
aye: to state the use of the EPR nuclear reactor design is justified.
nay: against stating the use of the EPR nuclear reactor design is justified.

title: Northern Ireland Assembly (Elections) (Amendment) Order 2010
aye: to update local election procedures in Northern Ireland; introducing greater consistency with European and parliamentary elections.
nay: against updating local election procedures in Northern Ireland; a proposal which was aimed at introducing greater consistency with European and parliamentary elections.

title: Local Elections (Northern Ireland) Order 2010
aye: to modernise local election procedures in Northern Ireland; introducing greater consistency with other elections across the UK.
nay: against modernising local election procedures in Northern Ireland in a manner intended to introduce greater consistency with other elections across the UK.

title: Savings Accounts and Health in Pregnancy Grant Bill - Third Reading
aye: to scrap child trust funds, saving gateway accounts and health in pregnancy grants.
nay: against scrapping child trust funds, saving gateway accounts and health in pregnancy grants.

title: Savings Accounts and Health in Pregnancy Grant Bill - Clause 3 - Removal of entitlement to health in pregnancy grant
aye: not to abolish the Health in Pregnancy Grant.
nay: to abolish the Health in Pregnancy Grant.

title: Savings Accounts and Health in Pregnancy Grant Bill - Clause 2 - Repeal of Saving Gateway Accounts Act 2009
aye: not to abolish the Saving Gateway Account scheme.
nay: to abolish the Saving Gateway Account scheme.

title: Savings Accounts and Health in Pregnancy Grant Bill - Clause 1 - Removal of eligibility for child trust fund
aye: not to abolish child trust funds.
nay: to abolish child trust funds.

title: Opposition Day - Funding and Schools Reform
aye: to express concern about the Government's plans to reform education.
nay: to reject concerns raised in relation to the Government's plans to reform education.

title: Opposition Day  - NHS Reorganisation
aye: to express concern about the governments proposed reforms to the National Health Service.
nay: to reject concerns about the governments proposed reforms to the National Health Service.

title: Fixed-term Parliaments Bill — Clause 1 - Four Year Fixed Term
aye: to reduce the the fixed-term length of a parliament to four years, from the originally proposed five years.
nay: not to reduce the the fixed-term length of a parliament to four years, from the originally proposed five years.

title: Fixed-term Parliaments Bill - Clause 1 - 2014 General Election
aye: to bring the date of the next general election forward by a year to 1 May 2014.
nay: against bringing the date of the next general election forward by a year to 1 May 2014.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Motion to refer to the Examiners
aye: to require the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill be assessed by professional staff to determine if it ought be treated as a Government (public) bill or as a "hybrid" bill as it progresses through Parliament
nay: against requiring the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill be assessed by professional staff to determine if it ought be treated as a Government (public) bill or as a "hybrid" bill as it progresses through Parliament

title: Sustainable Livestock Bill - Closure Motion
aye: to close the debate on the Sustainable Livestock Bill and move straight to a vote.
nay: against closing the debate on the Sustainable Livestock Bill and moving straight to a vote.

title: Motion to Sit in Private
aye: for the House of Commons to enter a private session.
nay: against the House of Commons entering a private session.

title: European Union Economic Governance
aye: to approve the Government's position that any sanctions proposed by the EU in relation to economic governance do not apply to the UK.
nay: against approving the Government's position that any sanctions proposed by the EU in relation to economic governance do not apply to the UK.

title: Equitable Life (Payments) Bill - Clause 1 - Payments
aye: to require payments to Equitable Life policyholders to be made irrespective of the date on which policies were taken out.
nay: not to require payments to Equitable Life policyholders to be made irrespective of the date on which policies were taken out.

title: Housing Benefit
aye: against reducing housing benefit for those who have been on Jobseekers Allowance for over a year.
nay: in support of government plans to reduce housing benefit for those who have been on Jobseekers Allowance for over a year.

title: Finance (No.2) Bill - New Clause 3 - Bank taxation
aye: in favour of ordering a report examining the level of taxation on the banking and financial services industry.
nay: not to order a report examining the level of taxation on the banking and financial services industry.

title: Finance (No.2) Bill - New Clause 2 - Independent taxation and family benefits
