aye: to review the impact of new child benefit eligibility rules on the principle of taxing people independently even if they are married.
nay: against an independent review on the impact new rules on child benefit eligibility have on the principle of taxing people independently even if they are married.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Third Reading
aye: for a referendum on introducing the Alternative Vote system for electing MPs and to equalise the number of electors in each constituency via boundary changes which would also reduce the number of MPs from 650 to 600.
nay: against holding a referendum on introducing the Alternative Vote system for electing MPs and against equalising the number of electors in each constituency via boundary changes which would also reduce the number of MPs from 650 to 600.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 8 - 40% Minimum Turnout for Automatic Action on AV Referendum Result
aye: against only automatically acting on the outcome of the referendum on introducing the alternative vote system for electing MPs if at least forty per cent of electors entitled to vote did so.
nay: to only automatically act on the outcome of the referendum on introducing the alternative vote system for electing MPs if at least forty per cent of electors entitled to vote did so.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Postal voting
aye: to accept the Government's proposed detailed rules for postal voting in Northern Ireland during the referendum on the Alternative Vote for electing MPs.
nay: against the Government's proposed detailed rules for postal voting in Northern Ireland during the referendum on the Alternative Vote for electing MPs.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 12 - Boundary Commission proposals: publicity and consultation
aye: to allow a Boundary Commission to cause an inquiry to be held in relation to proposals to alter constituencies.
nay: against allowing a Boundary Commission to cause an inquiry to be held in relation to proposals to alter constituencies.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - number and distribution of seats
aye: for a provision which would have ensured a whole number of MPs would represent each of Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly, Anglesey, Argyll and Bute, the Highland Council area and the Isle of Wight.
nay: against a provision which would ensure a whole number of MPs would represent each of Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly, Anglesey, Argyll and Bute, the Highland Council area and the Isle of Wight.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - number and distribution of seats
aye: to ensure local government wards in England, Wales and Northern Ireland would be entirely within one Parliamentary constituency; and prevent Parliamentary Constituencies from spanning more than two counties or London Boroughs.
nay: against ensuring  local government wards in England, Wales and Northern Ireland would be entirely within one Parliamentary constituency; and not to prevent Parliamentary Constituencies from spanning more than two counties or London Boroughs.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - number and distribution of seats
aye: to seek make specified exemptions from the proposal to equalise the number of electors in each parliamentary constituency and voted to guarantee certain areas a whole number of MPs and also to widen the band within which the number of electors of all constituencies must remain.
nay: not to make specified exemptions from proposals to equalise the number of electors in each parliamentary constituency and voted against guaranteeing certain areas a whole number of MPs and also against widening the band within which the number of electors in every constituencies must remain.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Programme Motion No.4
aye: in favour of setting rules to govern the timetable for the final stages of the debate on the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill in the House of Commons.
nay: against setting rules to govern the timetable for the final stages of the debate on the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill in the House of Commons.

title: Postal Services Bill - Second Reading
aye: to prepare for and permit Royal Mail privatisation. The vote was also in favour of changing the rules relating to ownership of the Post Office and in favour of passing provisions modifying the regulation of postal services, particularly to protect the UK's universal postal service.
nay: against moves intended to permit the privatisation of Royal Mail and to make the company more attractive to private investors. The vote was also against changing the rules relating to ownership of the Post Office and against passing provisions modifying the regulation of postal services, particularly to protect the UK's universal postal service.

title: Savings Accounts and Health in Pregnancy Grant Bill - Second Reading
aye: to abolish child trust funds, the saving gateway scheme and health in pregnancy grants.
nay: against abolishing child trust funds, the saving gateway scheme and health in pregnancy grants.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - New Clause 20 - Combination of polls
aye: to allow the referendum on the system for electing MPs to be combined with other elections and referendums being held on the same day.
nay: against allowing the referendum on the system for electing MPs to be held at the same time as other elections and referendums.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - New Clause 20 - Combination of polls
aye: to try and prevent the referendum on the system for electing MPs from being held at the same time as Assembly Elections and local elections in Northern Ireland.
nay: against a provision intended to prevent the referendum on the system for electing MPs, Assembly Elections and local elections all  being held on the same day in Northern Ireland.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - New Clause 20 - Combination of polls
aye: to try and prevent local referendums and mayoral elections in England being held at the same time as the referendum on the system for electing MPs to the House of Commons.
nay: to allow referendums and mayoral elections in England being held at the same time as the referendum on the system for electing MPs to the House of Commons.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - New Clause 20 - Combination of polls
aye: to allow the referendum on the system for electing MPs to be combined with other elections and referendums being held on the same day.
nay: against allowing the referendum on the system for electing MPs to be held at the same time as other elections and referendums.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - New Clause 7 - Reduction of maximum number of Ministers —rejected
aye: to reduce the maximum number of MPs who can be appointed Ministers in proportion with the proposed reduction in the number of MPs in the Commons.
nay: against reducing the maximum number of MPs who can be appointed Ministers in proportion with the proposed reduction in the number of MPs in the Commons.

title: Lawful Industrial Action (Minor Errors) Bill - Second Reading
aye: to prevent industrial action being deemed illegal due to minor errors in procedures associated with balloting union members.
nay: to allow industrial action to be declared illegal in cases where there are minor errors in procedures associated with balloting union members.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 11 - Welsh Constituancies
aye: to keep the current Welsh Assembly constituencies but allow UK Parliamentary constituencies in Wales to diverge from them as a result of future boundary reviews.
nay: to keep the Welsh Assembly constituencies and UK Parliamentary constituencies the same. This would have the effect that boundary reviews affecting the UK Parliamentary constituencies would also affect the Welsh Assembly constituencies.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 10 - Boundary Commission proposals: publicity and consultation
aye: to require publicity and consultation on changes to Parliamentary constituency boundaries recommended by a Boundary Commission.
nay: not to require publicity and consultation on changes to Parliamentary constituency boundaries recommended by a Boundary Commission.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 9 - Number and distribution of seats
aye: to reduce the number of MPs to 600, and to equalise the number of electors in each UK Parliamentary constituency with some exceptions for hard to access areas.
nay: against reducing  the number of MPs to 600 and against equalising the number of electors in each UK Parliamentary constituency.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 9 - Number of MPs
aye: to keep the number of MPs at 650, rather than reduce it to 600.
nay: to reduce the number of MPs from 650 to 600

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 8 - Periodicity of Reports of the Boundary Commissions
aye: to require the Boundary Commissions to submit boundary reports to the Secretary of State before 1 October 2013 and every five years subsequently, replacing a requirement to report every 8 to 12 years.
nay: against requiring the Boundary Commissions to submit boundary reports to the Secretary of State before 1 October 2013 and every five years subsequently, replacing a requirement to report every 8 to 12 years.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 8 - Boundary Commission Veto on Modification of Their Recommendations
aye: to give the Boundary Commissions a veto on any modifications Parliament might want to make to their recommendations before acting on them.
nay: not to give the Boundary Commissions a veto on any modifications Parliament might want to make to their recommendations before acting on them.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 8 - Electoral Registration and Reports of the Boundary Commissions
aye: to make the Electoral Commission certifying sufficient measures have been taken to register voters a pre-requisite for the next review of Parliamentary constituency boundaries.
nay: not to make the Electoral Commission certifying sufficient measures have been taken to register voters a pre-requisite for the next review of Parliamentary constituency boundaries.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 8 - Periodicity of Reports of the Boundary Commissions
aye: for a review of Parliamentary constituency boundaries to be carried out every ten years, rather than every five years.
nay: for a review of Parliamentary constituency boundaries to be carried out every five years, rather than every ten years.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 8 - Review Welsh Parliamentry Constituancies With Respect to Further Devoloution
aye: to order a review of the number and size of Parliamentary constituencies in Wales within a year of deciding to go ahead with a referendum in Wales on additional devolution to the Welsh Assembly.
nay: against reviewing the number and size of Parliamentary constituencies in Wales within a year of deciding to go ahead with a referendum in Wales on additional devolution to the Welsh Assembly.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 7 - Defining the Alternative Vote System
aye: to allow voters to rank as many candidates as they like during elections held under the Alternative Vote electoral system (or to vote for just one candidate).
nay: to limit voters to only expressing a first and second preference under the Alternative Vote electoral system.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and constituencies Bill - Programme motion variation
aye: in favour of proposed changes to the timetable for the consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and constituencies Bill
nay: against proposed changes to the timetable for the consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and constituencies Bill

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Schedule 2 - Recount if Accuracy Doubted
aye: to require a recount if the officer running the referendum thinks there is a reason to doubt the accuracy of the count.
nay: not to require a recount if the officer running the referendum thinks there is a reason to doubt the accuracy of the count.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Schedule 2 - Allowed to Vote if in Queue by 10pm
aye: to allow those in the polling station queue when the polls close at 10pm to vote.
nay: not to allow those in the polling station queue when the polls close at 10pm to vote.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Schedule 2 - Use of Independent Schools as Polling Stations
aye: to require independent schools to house polling stations if counting officers wish to use them.
nay: against requiring independent schools to house polling stations if counting officers wish to use them.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 2 - Entitlement to vote in the referendum
aye: to allow British citizens living outside the United Kingdom to vote in the referendum on the electoral system for the house of commons.
nay: against allowing British citizens living outside the United Kingdom to vote in the referendum on the electoral system for the house of commons.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 2 - Entitlement to vote in the referendum
aye: to exclude citizens of Commonwealth countries or of the Republic of Ireland from voting in the referendum on the system for electing UK MPs.
nay: not to exclude citizens of Commonwealth countries or of the Republic of Ireland from voting in the referendum on the system for electing UK MPs.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Schedule 1 - Role of Electoral Commission in Referendum
aye: to make the Electoral Commission's work to promote public awareness of the referendum subject to the agreement of the Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission.
nay: against making the Electoral Commission's work to promote public awareness of the referendum subject to the agreement of the Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Schedule 1 - Further provisions about the referendum
aye: to include a specific provision in the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill to expressly allow Chief Counting Officers to give directions in relation to voters with disabilities.
nay: not to include a specific provision in the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill to expressly allow Chief Counting Officers to give directions in relation to voters with disabilities. Officers already have a duty to ensure ballot papers and polling stations are accessible to all.

title: Backbench Business - Contaminated Blood and Blood Products
aye: to call on the Government to implement the recommendations of the Archer Report into contaminated blood and blood products.
nay: against calling on the Government to implement the recommendations of the Archer Report into contaminated blood and blood products.

title: Draft EU Budget 2011
aye: to express concern at the above-inflation increase being made to Britain's EU budget contribution and to call on the Government to reduce that contribution'.
nay: against saying it would be wrong to increase Britain's contribution to the European Union budget; but expressed support for the Government's efforts to maintain the 2011 EU budget at the cash levels equivalent to the 2010 budget

title: London Local Authorities Bill - Second Reading
aye: to give more powers to London local authorities.
nay: not to give more powers to London local authorities.

title: Superannuation Bill - Third Reading
aye: to cap civil service redundancy payments.
nay: against caping civil service redundancy payments.

title: Superannuation Bill - Clause 1 - Limits on value of benefits provided under civil service compensation scheme
aye: not to cap civil service redundancy payments.
nay: to cap civil service redundancy payments.

title: Superannuation Bill - New Clause 1 - Consents required for civil service compensation scheme modifications
aye: to remove the need to get the agreement of civil servants before reducing (capping) their severance payments.
nay: to require the agreement of civil servants before  their severance payments can be reduced (capped).

title: Public Houses and Private Members' Clubs (Smoking) Bill
aye: to exempt pubs and private members clubs from the smoking ban where no food is being served.
nay: not to relax the smoking ban and allow smoking in pubs and private members clubs where no food is being served.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Part 3 - Text of referendum question
aye: to tweak the grammar and phrasing of the question for the referendum on the voting system.
nay: against tweaking the grammar and phrasing of the question for the referendum on the voting system.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Part 3 - Question for referendum on the system for electing MPs
aye: in favour of including voting systems which would be expected to result in proportional representation as options in the referendum on how MPs are elected to the commons.
nay: against including voting systems which would be expected to result in proportional representation as options in the referendum on how MPs are elected to the commons.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 1 - Date of referendum on the alternative vote system
aye: to allow a minister to set the date of the referendum on introducing the alternative vote system for electing MPs so long as the date doesn't coincide with elections for "any parliamentary assembly or regularly held local government election".
nay: for the referendum on introducing the alternative vote system for electing MPs to be held on the 5th May 2011 irrespective of clashes with local and devolved parliament elections.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill - Clause 1 - Date of referendum on the alternative vote system
aye: against allowing the referendum on introducing the alternative vote system for electing MPs to be held on the same day as elections to the Welsh Assembly or Scottish Parliament.
nay: to allow the referendum on introducing the alternative vote system for electing MPs to be held on the same day as elections to the Welsh Assembly or Scottish Parliament.

title: Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill — Programme motion
aye: to approve proposed rules and timetable for the consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.
nay: against approving proposed rules and timetable for the consideration of the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Bill.

title: Identity Documents Bill - New Clause 4 - Transfer of information from National Identity Register to Identity and Passport Service
aye: to allow ID cards to continue to be used as passports after the ID card system is scrapped.
nay: not to allow ID cards to continue to be used as passports after the ID card system is scrapped.

title: Identity Documents Bill - New Clause 2 - Passport fees for holders of ID cards
aye: to give those who bought ID Cards a discount on a new passport.
nay: not to give those who bought ID Cards a discount on a new passport.

title: Fixed-term Parliaments Bill - Programme Motion
aye: to approve a proposed timetable for the House of Commons' consideration of the Fixed Term Parliaments Bill.
nay: against a proposed timetable for the House of Commons' consideration of the Fixed Term Parliaments Bill.
